Segundo es una persona tranquila y bastante trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen tienen muy buenas referencias de él y asimismo le consideran alguien  responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Segundo is the father of a family, 41 years of age, who lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Oyotún, a zone located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been dedicated for 10 years to the raising and sale of small animals at his home.  He raises the animals, feeding them fodder and balanced feed.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale in the outdoor market that takes place in the district of Cayaltí once a week.  Eventually, he offers them for sale to the businesses that visit the zone.  With the income that he earns he moves his family ahead, which is why he always tries to manage his activity in the best way possible. 

Segundo woudl like to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to grow his business and receive greater profits when he sells his animals.  This will permit him to improve the quality of life of his family.  To realize his objective, he has found it necessary to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa; a loan of 1000 new soles.

Segundo is an industrious and tranquil person.  The people who know him give him good references and likewise consider him someone who is responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more animals and feed to grow his business

loans.name: Santos Cristina

texts.es:
Santos Cristina es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona que produce principalmente mango y limón para exportarlos a diversos países del extranjero. Pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. chicha D. jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desD. épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta dos veces por semana y con los ingresos que le brinda su venta ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Adicionalmente prepara y venD. comida durante toda la semana. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes D. iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Santos desea adquirir mas ingredientes e insumos como harina D. jora, azúcar y leña para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.

Santos es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a sus hijos y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Santos Cristina is the mother of a family, 58 years of age, who resides with her family in a rural zone of the agricultural district of TambogranD., a zone that produces principally mango and lemons in order to export them to diverse foreign countries.  It belongs to the province of Piura and is located in the region of the same name, more than 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She is dedicated to the preparation and sale of jora liquor (a typical beverage of the country that has been maD. since remote times from a base of a special type of cornflour).  She prepares this beverage in her residence and offers it for sale two times a week.  With the income that she earns from her sales, she helps her husband with the family expenses.  Additionally she prepares and sells food during the entire week.  The business is well received, since this beverage is often consumed in the zone, especially at diverse celebrations and festivities.  Likewise, the workers from the place consume it before starting their activities since they believe that the beverage offers them energy and vigor.  

Santos would like to acquire more ingredients and supplies such as jora flour, sugar and firewood to continue preparing this beverage and to increase her sales.  Because of this, she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternative; a loan of 500 new soles that will permit her to achieve her goals.  

Santos is a hard-working woman and cares for her family.  Her greatest wish is to see her children progress and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow her business of preparing and selling liquor.

loans.name: Santos Evelio

texts.es:
Santos Evelio de 35 años de edad, junto a su compañera de vida: Maria de los Angeles Zeledon, ama de casa,  tienen una niña de 8 añitos  de edad El Sr. S. O. labora para el CETA INATEC desde hace 2 años desempeñandose como Sub- Director, esto le ha permitido salir adelante.   
  
Este crédito lo requiere para reparar dos paredes de su casa ya que se encuentran sin repellar y comprar una puerta que se encuentra en malas condiciones.  

Su  mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral  ya que solamente es el sosten de la familia, que su hija estudie y poco a poco ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda con los crédito obtenidos por AFODENIC y KIVA.
texts.en:
Santos Evelio, age 35, along wiht his life companion: Maria de los Angeles Zeledon, housewife,  have a daughter 8 years of age.  Señor S. O. has worked for CETA INATEC as a sub-director for 2 years.  This has permitted him to do well.    
  
He requires this loan to repair two walls of his house which are without plaster and to buy a door to replace one that is in bad condition. 

His greatest dreams in life are to have stable work, since he is the only wage-earner in the family, to see his daughter go to school and little-by-little to improve the infrastructure of his dwelling with the loan obtained from AFODENIC and KIVA.

loans.use: To repair the walls in his house and buy a door

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María tiene  60 años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector La Claque del distrito D. Reque, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra ubicada a mas D. media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a la crianza D. animales. Ella cría animales menores en su vivienda y luego los venD. en los mercados. Adicionalmente cría vacas y venD. la leche que producen a los pobladores D. la zona. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Ana María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción D. sus animales. Por ello se ha vistoen la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante luchadora y que dia a dia da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su negocio. En la zona es una persona conocida por su amabilidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ana María is 60 years of age and lives with her family in the La Claque sector of the Reque district, an agricultural and cattle zone that is located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

She is dedicated to raising animals.  She raises small animals in her home and later sells them in the markets.  Additionally she raises cows and sells the milk that they produce to the people of the area.  The income that she earns from these activities permit her to settle her personal expenses and help her family by supporting the family economy.  

Ana María would like to acquire balanced feed to improve the production of her animals.  For this reason she has found it necessary to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa; a loan of 500 new soles which will help her achieve her objective. 

She is an industrious woman who gives her best day to day to do well in her business.  In the area she is a person known for her friendliness and responsibility.

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es:
Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio.,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad pero aun es dependiente de ella ya que estudia en la Universidad y sus tres hijos menores aun están en colegio. Hace varios años estudio belleza en una Academia de Portoviejo.
 
Se dedica junto a su esposo a la atención de un bar-restaurante que tienen cerca de la playa, trabajan todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta 22h00, preparan hamburguesas, papas fritas, alas de pollo asadas y otras comidas rápidas, también venden gaseosas y cervezas, nos cuenta que las temporadas playeras son muy buenas, en esos días trabajan desde las 9am hasta las 24h00. Dice que ya son 5 años que llevan en este negocio y han  salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo dedicado.

Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 ciclos, en la actualidad se desempeña como presidenta, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a este banco y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe de la institución. Este nuevo crédito lo quiere ocupar para comprar productos para su negocio y dos licuadoras para preparar batidos de frutas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante más grande y un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
This place is known for it's beautiful beaches, which are much visited by many national tourists and foreigners.  In the sands of the Crucita parish every 15 days, the 6th of July Communal Bank meets.  It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes typical of the region.  

Señora Rosa is 33 years of age, married and has 4 children.  One of them is already grown, but is still dependent on her, since she is studying at the University.  Her 3 younger children still attend secondary school.  For many years she studied to be a beautician at the Academy of Portoviejo.
 
She is dedicated along with her husband to tending a bar and restaurant that they have which is close to the beach.  They work every day from 2PM to 11PM preparing hamburgers, french fries, roasted chicken wings and other fast foods.  They also sell carbonated beverages and beers.  She tells us that the temporate seasons are very good.  In those days they work from 9am to midnight.  She says they have run this business for 5 years and they have done well thanks to their effort and dedicated work.  

She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 9 loan cycles.  Currently she is serving as the president of the group.  She is very pleased to belong to this bank and likes the aid that she receives from the institution.  She wants to acquire this new loan to buy products for her business and two blenders to prepare fruit smoothies.  Her dreams are to have a larger restaurant and a beauty parlor.

loans.use: To buy two blenders and food supplies.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

Para Luis Alberto este es su cuarto ciclo y está muy contento ya que gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la institución ha podido poco a poco ir comprando las cosas para poner su ansiado restaurante. El hasta hace poco se iba en un barco de pescadores a alta mar por espacio de 22 días a un mes, tenían que estar hasta llenar el barco de buena pesca, trabajo durante muchos años ahorrando lo mas que podía y con los créditos recibidos fue comprando todo lo necesario para inaugurar su restaurante, en la actualidad tiene todo listo y solo esperaba este crédito para echar en marcha su negocio y así poder dejar atrás tantos días de peligro y trabajo duro en alta mar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos que sirvan para la preparación de sus platos y para comprar ciertas cositas que aún le faltan.
 
Sus sueños son que su restaurante sea un éxito y seguir adelante tratando de mejorar día a día.
texts.en:
In Arenales, of the parish Crucita, every 15 days there is a meeting of the 6th of July Communal Bank. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical dishes of the region.

This is Luis Alberto’s fourth cycle and he is very happy, since thanks to the loans that he received from the institution he has been able, little by little, to buy the things he needs to start up his yearned-for restaurant. Until recently, he would go out on a deep-sea fishing boat for 22 days a month. They had to stay out until they had filled the boat with fish. He worked for many years saving as much as he could, and with the loans received he began buying everything necessary to start his restaurant. Currently, he has everything ready and is only waiting for this loan to open his business, which will enable him to leave behind so many dangerous and strenuous days working on the high seas.

He will use this loan to buy products that will be used to prepare dishes and to buy a few other little things that he still lacks.

His dreams are that his restaurant be a success and to get ahead by trying to improve every day.

loans.use: To buy provisions and various kitchenware for the restaurant.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Jessica tiene 28 años y es madre soltera de dos niños de 10 y 8 años de edad los mismos que están estudiando en la escuela, vive sola con sus hijos.

Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo,  trabaja  todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 20h00, vende de todo desde productos de primera necesidad hasta bebidas alcohólicas y tarjetas telefónicas, también vende helados Pingüino ya que la empresa le facilito un congelador para vender sus  productos lo cual le genera ganancias extras. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando ellos pueden, dice que le gusta su trabajo  por que le permite estar en su casa y ayudar a sus pequeños hijos con las tareas de la escuela, sus  productos los compra en Comercial Casanova en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para surtir su tienda. Es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la ayuda recibida y por las charlas educativas.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In Arenales, of the parish Crucita, every 15 days there is a meeting of the 6th of July Communal Bank. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical dishes of the region.
Jessica is 28 years old and a single mother of two children, aged 8 and 10. Her children attend school, and she lives alone with them.
She has a general store where she works everyday from 7am to 8pm. She sells everything, from basic necessities to alcoholic drinks to telephone cards. She also sells Pingüino ice cream since the company provided her the freezer from which to sell the products, which generates extra profit. Her children help her when they can. She says that she likes her work because it allows her to be at home and to help her children with their homework. She buys her products in the Casanova Commercial Center in Portoviejo.
She will use this loan to buy products to stock her store. This is her third cycle with the communal bank, and she has liked it because of the help she receives and the educational talks.
Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, meat, dairy products and general provisions.

loans.name: Elizabeth Monserrate

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Elizabeth esta en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y se desempeña como fiscal de reglamento, le gusta el Banco por la seriedad de sus amigas y compañeras y por la ayuda que recibe de la institución. Tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta bella relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 2 Años, el priM. ya está en la escuela. Su marido es pescador y comerciante de pescado.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescado, trabajan tres días a la semana en la venta del pescado desde las 5am hasta las 16h00, en los otros días su esposo se dedica a la pesca, sale los días lunes y regresa los miércoles o jueves con el pescado y es allí donde empieza la labor de la señora ya que tiene que limpiar el pescado para ir a venderlo en buen estado, muchas veces ellos compran a otros pescadores para cumplir con los encargos que tienen de sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar combustibles y pescado ya que tiene que cumplir con los clientes.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Arenales, of the parish Crucita, every 15 days there is a meeting of the 6th of July Communal Bank. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical dishes of the region.

Elizabeth has been part of the Communal Bank since its inception and is its fiscal regulator. She likes the bank because of the seriousness of her friends and colleagues and for the help she receives from the institution. She is 25 years old. She is married, and from this beautiful relationship has two children aged 8 and 2. The first one is in school. Her husband is a fisherman and a fishmonger.

Together with her husband, she sells fish. They work three days a week selling fish from 5am to 4pm. On the other days, her husband fishes. He goes out on Monday and returns on Wednesday or Thursday with the fish. This is when her work starts, since she has to clean the fish in order to sell it well. Often they buy fish from other fishers in order to meet the orders they have from their customers. 

This loan is for buying fuel and fish in order to meet the demand of their customers.

Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish and fuel

loans.name: Yenny Dolores

texts.es:
En la calle Medardo Cevallos, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dr. Medardo Cevallos.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Yenny, ella lleva ya diez años en el Banco Comunal y dice que está muy a gusto porque ha recibido muchos beneficios de parte de la Fundación Espoir para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 35 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años, los dos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en Quito en una empresa de seguridad.

Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Municipal, vende de todo en lo referente a víveres de consumo, además de eso entrega de forma personal especias molidas a algunos restaurantes de la ciudad, trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábados desde las 6am hasta las 16h00 y los domingos hasta las 12h00. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es justamente para surtir su tienda.
 
Sus metas son seguir creciendo en su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Dr. Medardo Cevallos community bank meets every two week on Medardo Cevallos street, in the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times. This is where we meet Yenny who has been a part of the community bank for 10 years. She says that she is happy because of all the benefits she has received for her business from Fundacion Espoir. 

She is 35, married and has two children ages 15 and 8 who both study. Her husband works in Quito for a security company. She has a store in the municipal market where she sells all types of food. She also sells custom ground spices to various restaurants around the city. She works from Monday  to Saturday from 6:00am to 4:00pm and Sundays until noon. 

She purchases her goods from a wholesaler in Portoviejo. This loan is to be able to stock her store. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to see her children as professionals.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, meat, dairy products and general groceries

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Đặng's Group

texts.en:
S.  Đặng Thị (20201050023) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  S. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).

S. is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, S. owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling plastic products to local businesses and community members.  S. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business operating a manufacturing business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


S.  Đặng Thị (20201050023) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  S.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng T. cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phú Mẫn 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng nhựa cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  S.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, S.  kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND.  Vào 2007, S.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  S.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Alba De Jesús

texts.es:
En la calle Medardo Cevallos, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dr. Medardo Cevallos.

La señora Alba es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como presidenta del Banco,  dice que le gusta porque siempre han estado prestos para cualquier ayuda que necesitaba. Tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad, el menor vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la calle Medardo Cevallos, trabaja todos los días  desde las 6h30 hasta las 22h00, vende desde artículos de bazar, útiles escolares y bebidas alcohólicas, además los domingos en la mañana prepara y vende encebollados y en las noches vende cueritos asados,  dice que todo lo que es trabajo y deje ganancias es bueno y por eso lo hace.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería para surtir su tienda.
 
Su sueño es tener un mini market.
texts.en:
Every other week, group members of the Dr. Medardo Cevallos Community Bank get together on Medardo Cevallos Street, in the city of Portoviejo, known as la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos since its colonization.

Mrs. Alba was the founding member of the community bank and she works very hard as its president. She says she likes it because there are always loans available to help with whatever she needs. She is 44 years old, married, and has two children. One child is already grown and the younger one lives with them. Her husband is a salesman.

She has a store in her home on Medardo Cevallos Street and she works every day from 6:30 am until 10:00 pm. She sells everything from tools to school supplies to alcoholic beverages and on Sunday mornings prepares and sells encebollados (a pork chop/onion dish) and in the evenings she sells grilled pork skins. She says that any kind of work that earns money is good and that is why she does it.

This loan is to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her dream is to have a mini-market.

loans.name: Slamet

texts.en:
Slamet H. (PK-10331) is a 46-year-old man living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  He is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Slamet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  

Slamet has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 600,000 IDR a month from these activities. Slamet really enjoys this business, especially when seeing the buyers are satisfied with the service.

In 2010, Slamet joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve  his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Slamet is requesting a new loan of 4,500,000 IDR from MUK which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Slamet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of his children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation, and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


  


Slamet H. (PK-10331) merupakan 46 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Slamet memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan ringan & makanan kecil lainnya di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Slamet sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Slamet menghasilkan sekitar 600.000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2010, Slamet bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Slamet telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4.500.000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris & modal kerja tambahan.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.  Slamet berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking..  "

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
H. Lê V. (20213010070) is a 34-year-old male living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a five-member group loA. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives A. individual loA., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is A. Ninh nhóm 13 (Nhóm 13).


H. is married and has one infant-aged child.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loA. of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loA. was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  He is now requesting a new loA. of 6,944,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loA. will be the second loA. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị H. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Chu Thị H. (0) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business running a food stall.


3.  Ngô Thị T. A. (0) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business operating a tailoring business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loA. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lê V. (20213010070) là 34 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là A. Ninh nhóm 13 (Nhóm 13).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.944.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị H. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Chu Thị H. (0) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Ngô Thị T. A. (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela A. is from the village of Baan, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Estela is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Estela is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three kids go to the local secondary school. Mrs. Battsetseg rents a basement room under an apartment block and runs a variety store. She has been running this business for three years. 

In Mongolia, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local residents. Her store is located nearby to her rented basement apartment, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local residents. Her store is in a good location and it is close to all amenities.

Her husband Boldbaatar has a family car and uses it for delivering goods from wholesale points to the store. Their future dream is to have their own family house and to give a proper education to their kids.

The loan they are requesting will be used to replace their old family car with a newer one in better condition.

loans.use: to replace their old family car with a newer one in better condition

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An H. (pictured with her loom), is a widow with five children, three sons and two daughters. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

An has been a silk weaver since she was young. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase silk material for continuing her weaving business. She will use a part of her loan to buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: De

texts.en:
Mr. De R. (shown in the photo) is 43 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kea Leng, is 41 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

De is a farmer and assists his wife in the business when he is free. Mrs. Kea Leng sells Pha Ork in Koki market. Pha Ork is made with chopped fish, salt, sugar, yeast and rice, placed in large airtight jars and allowed to ferment. 

De is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for his wife to purchase fish to produce Pha Ork to sell.

loans.use: To help finance his wife to purchase fish to produce Pha Ork for sale.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin H. is 43 years of age and a married woman in Kampong Chhnang Province. In order to meet the needs of the family, Mrs. Chin H. sells a  mixed grill to people who are passers-by in the village. She has six children who attend school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house, and then he turns fresh palm into sugar-palm juice to sell. This couple has always sold products items from nearby trees, but they dreams of having theirown farmland. So, Mrs Chim H. is taking out her first loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming on which she will grow different types of crops.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna S. is 42 year-old and her husband, Mr. Chanvorn Pich, is 44 yea-old. They have been married since 1985 and have seven children; four sons and three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and the other attends school. They live along National Road number five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vanna sells vegetables in the local market and she is a tailor as well. Her husband is a fisherman. She is applying for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en:
Miss. Makara C., 28, is single and lives with her parents and sister and brothers in a village along National Road NumberTwo about seventeen, kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Makara has been a garment factory worker for five years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives and build a fence around of her house.

Makara was not available for the picture, so her mother is pictured.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives and build a fence around the house.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: H. Nguyễn Thị is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two small children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in her community. H. has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. H. plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213030033. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm chăm sóc sức khỏe & dược phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun Yin is 25 years old and his wife, Mrs. Vanara Phorn, is 26 years old. They live in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2002 and have two children; one son and one daughter. 

Khoeun has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi for two months. His wife sells fish in Phnom Penh market.  She does not have her own shop at the market to sell her fish, and as a result, must spends a lot of money on rental fees which makes it very difficult to support her family. She wants to buy her own space at the market, but she does not have enough money.   
 
Therefore, Khoeun is asking for his first loan of loan of $1,000 to help finance his wife.

loans.use: To provide capital for his wife to purchase a space at the market for a shop to sell fish.

loans.name: Hangry

texts.en:
Mr. Hangry T. lives with his widowed mother in a small village on National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mr. Hangry T. has been driving a motor taxi since 2006. A recipient of a previous Kiva loan, he is now requesting another loan of $500 to repair his house by laying bricks and plastering the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To lay brick and plaster on the ceiling and the wall of his house.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: X. Nguyễn Thị is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three grown-up children. To make a living, X. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling confectionery products in her community. X. has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase products to sell. X. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. X. plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213030034. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== X. Nguyễn Thị (20213030034) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, X. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam. Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Đinh

texts.en:
T. Đinh Thị (20213030036) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business selling dried goods in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Đinh Thị (20213030036) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha D. ( in the photo), is 50 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sothy Chan, is 53 years old. They have been married since 1985. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of them is a teacher and the others are in school.  The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sitha has been selling finished silk fabrics for two years. Her husband is s teacher. She is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: Nguyễn Thị H.'s main source of income comes from providing general clothing services in her community. She is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two small children. Nguyễn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, Nguyễn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Nguyễn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nguyễn is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. Nguyễn plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213030037. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== Nguyễn Thị H. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nguyễn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyễn kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, Nguyễn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nguyễn đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Nguyễn dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mrs. Tong S. (in the photo), is a silk weaver. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. They have been married since 1960 and have six children; three sons and three daughters. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Tong has made Kiva loans several times already. She now is requesting another loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyroth S. (in the photo), is 23 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Pho, is 23 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, They were married in 2004 and have two young daughters. 

Mrs. Sreyroth S. has been a garment factory worker. Her husband is a driver. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to add to her own money to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To use along with the savings to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị is a 37-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, V. makes and sells food, primarily rice products, to the local community. V. has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008 V. joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. V. successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. V. is now requesting a new loan, her fourth from SEDA, of 8,288,000 VND that will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make her food. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients needed to make her food for sale

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon N.  is 52 years old, and her husband, Mr. Saret Soun, 60 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, They were married in 1980 and have five children; three sons and two daughters.   

Phon has been operating a business-laundry at her home for a year. Her husband is a Cyclo taxi driver.  Cyclo is a bicycle attached with a rickshaw in the front. 

Phon’s son hopes to launch a business-selling cell phones, but he does not have capital.  Therefore, Phon is asking for her first loan of loan of $700 to help finance her son.

loans.use: To help finance her son purchase cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich H. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sokhoeun Vann, have been married since 1993. They have 7 childrenl; 6 daughters and 1 son. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Pich H. has been selling vegetables for more than four years. Her husband is a wooden-house builder and a farmer. Pich has previously made Kiva loans twice before. She now is asking for her third loan of $350 to help capitalize her husband's farming business.

loans.use: To help provide capital for her husband to continue his farming business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Thắng's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

T. is married and has four adult-aged children. She is a tailor who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. T. has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. T. successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional fabric and materials. She is now requesting a new loan, her second from SEDA, of 6,048,000 VND that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị T. is a 63-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agricultural sector raising livestock. 2. Trần Thị T. is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 3. Tô Thị H. is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 4. Đinh Thị L. is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Nguyễn Thị (20213030032) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Gạo nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND. Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Trần Thị T. (0) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao S. (pictured with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Sarith Vit, have been married since 2000 and have four sons. The family lives along a National Road, approximately seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Mao S. has been a rice and vegetable farmer for more than 7 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Mao has already asked for a Kiva loan once, and she is now asking for her second loan of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Clarita is single and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Clarita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Clarita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Chu Thị Loan's Group

texts.en:
L. Chu Thị is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. is the group leader of a five-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo nhóm 05 (Nhóm 12).

L. is married and has two school-aged children. L. is a tailor who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2009 L. joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous L. of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She is now requesting a new L., her second from SEDA, of 6,496,000 VND that will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đinh Thị T. is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. Nguyễn Thị H. is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector running a food stall. 3. Đỗ Thị T. is a 22-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND L. to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business. 4. Chu Thị X. is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor T. is from the village of Calamagui. He is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nestor owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport to the local community members. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nestor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Nestor is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nestor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's school tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.en:
Baktygul A. is a 45 year-old widow with four children. At the age of 19, she got married and lived in a love-matched marriage for 20 years. In 2006, Baktygul’s beloved husband passed away and she became the only support for her children. 

She decided to engage in cattle-breeding with the starting capital of 7,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) and did her best to develop it. She also started to cultivate a plot of land with perennial herbs, which serve as a concentrate of forage for her cattle.

Her tireless efforts in these activities allowed her to renovate the family’s house and give an education to her children. Her elder daughter went off in search of a living and now Baktygul, in order to help her, maintains her two little children, which further raise the family’s expenditures. 

Baktygul wants to take a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy bull calves for fattening and reselling and to purchase manure to fertilize the land.  She hopes that this will help her to increase revenue.  Baktygul is a very attentive grandmother, who is fond of her grandchildren and indulges them with all her heart. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fertilizers

Francisca is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence L. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Florence is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Florence owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Florence has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florence is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Florence from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old single from Lebanon. She has been running a tailoring factory for the past 30 years. With this large amount of experience, she has become well known in her town and its surroundings. She produces women's clothes such as robes and skirts and delivers her products to the clothing stores she works with. She used her first loan provided through Kiva to perform maintenance for her machines. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to continue maintenance for her other tailoring machineries. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her factory and expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on tailoring machines

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: M. Daniel, a father of 4 says that the sale  of sugar cane molasses has helped him extricate himself out of poverty over the past 4 years. Though it is a small business, he has been able to make the best of his time. It is a business that he began with savings from a beer sale enterprise. He uses molasses to make crude alcohol that is in high favour among many people around his locality. His first business was agro produce sales. His monthly profits are 304,500 shillings. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more molasses for making more crude alcohol.

loans.use: The purchase of more molasses to make crude alcohol

loans.name: John Kipkorir

texts.en:
John Kipkorir M. is 39 years old and married to Joan Cherop M., a farmer and provider of an additional source of income for the family. The couple has two school-going children. They live in Soy, Eldoret, Kenya. John has been operating a general store for the past six years and earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.
John learnt about Kiva partner, KADET, through marketing carried out in his area. He is applying for his first loan of 49,500 KES from KADET, which he intends to use to buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, 5 bags of sugar, 10 bundles of baking flour and any other stock that he needs. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his business.
In the future, John hopes to have a wholesale business, as these have proved to be very profitable in the area. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, 5 bags of sugar and 10 bundles of baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is the mother of three school-aged children. She has been running an education business from her home since 2007. She has prepared a special education room to receive the students. Her income is important for her husband and children, especially for paying her own children's school fees. Today, she is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay schooling registrations for her three children. Her only aim is to be able to ensure a good education for her children so that they are able to reach university.

loans.use: To pay school registration fees for her three children

loans.name: Bulamu Bwoka Developement Group-Mukono

texts.en: Thirty-three year old Jalia N. is happily married, has six children, and is a member of the Bulamu Bwoka loan group. She knows that it is not possible to rest on your laurels in business, and this realization has allowed her to found and run for the last three years a flourishing grocery store. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell at her grocery

loans.name: Edward Kipkemboi

texts.en:
Edward N. is 49 years old and makes a living selling motor vehicle spare parts and accessories. He is married to Christine Ayuma and they have seven children, all of whom are in primary school. He operates his business along Nyabwoyo Street in Kilgoris Town, which is located south of the Great Rift Valley.

Edward got introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member, joined and has taken out and repaid two loans. He is now applying for a third loan, for Kshs 60,000. Demand for motor vehicle spare parts is high and he anticipates strong profits will allow him to repay this loan, which he will use to buy accessories such as bolts, oil, grease, bearings, brake fluid and brake pads.
 
Edward hopes to expand his business by ensuring that he has what his customers need. His goals are to see his children get a good education and his family leads a comfortable life. He is committed to work hard in his business to make this happen

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle parts such as bolts, oil, grease, bearings and other items

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn S., 46, is married to Mr. Sam Roern, 47. They have seven children, three of whom work in construction. Two of their children are newly married and starting families, while other two are still in school. Mrs. Hoeurn Sopha's husband (who we see here) who works in construction. Because raising and selling livestock is this family's main source of income, Mrs. Hoeurn S. is applying for a loan for $100 to buy an additional cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to raise and resell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita L. lives in the village of Brgy. Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last four years, she has made a living producing and selling charcoal. She earns about 5,000 PHP from her work.

Last year, Elenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 9,000 PHP, to buy the materials she uses to make charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.
