He makes his income by selling manufactured goods (female, children cloths and footwear). 2 years ago he had rented a trade outlet and began to deliver items from Bishkek city. Out of the profits, he has managed to help in the shop building to his parents and to purchase land. His loan purpose is to increase circulating capital. In the future, Chyngyz is planning to open a trade outlet in Osh city and to purchase a car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase oil.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 56 years old a shop keeper. She is married to K., a businessman. They have four children aged eight, 12, 16 and 18 years, respectively. Catherine has been operating a retail shop for the past 11 years. Her monthly income is KES 20,000.

Catherine plans to increase the stock for the business to buy one bag of sugar, two cartons of tea leaves, two dozen bars of soap, one bundle of salt and washing detergent. With the anticipated profits from her business, she intends to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve living standards for her family and also to have her children operate a business independently in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and detergent in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Abydahan's Group

texts.en:
Abydahan E. is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old and married. Her family has 6 children, the older are students, the younger go to school. The head of the family earns money by farming. Abydahan has a profession as a Geography schoolteacher. She makes 4470 soms per month. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase household appliances in order to improve her living conditions. In the future she is planning to give a proper education to her children. 

Kanayuim A., 48, is married. Her spouse raises money by working as a taxi driver. Earlier, he used to work in a village. After having received some profits, he was able to purchase a car. The couple has 4 children. The daughters are married, the elder son works in Russia, the youngest helps his parents in housekeeping. As for Kanayuim, she works at a school. The loan purpose is to obtain a refrigerator. In the future the family wants to provide education to the children, to buy a house and to increase cattle stock.

Aliima S., 50, is married. Her spouse works as a Geography school teacher. The family has 5 sons: the elder work in Russia, the youngest one is a schoolboy. The main way of enriching the family's budget is cattle breeding. During the past 20 years of working hard, the family has managed to increase cattle stock. They now have 2 cows, 2 calves and 22 sheep. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle (calves). In the future, Aliima is planning to obtain a house.

Shaiyrgul N., 37, is married. Her spouse has a creative profession; he is a musician. His salary has made it possible to purchase 3 goats. The couple brings up 3 children, all of whom go to school. The family’s mother earns money by working as a teacher in a school. Out of total earnings, the family has begun to build a house. The building is almost finished. The loan purpose is to purchase animal livestock. In the future Shaiyrgul wants to make major house repairs.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances.

loans.name: Ayuimbubu's Group

texts.en:
Ayuimbubu A. is the leader of the group. She is 60 years old and married. Her husband is already a pensioner. The couple has six children (4 sons and 2 daughters). All of their children are married and live separately from their parents. The family business consists of the following: cattle breeding and harvesting. By now they have managed to harvest 2 tons of barley and 2.5 tons of wheat. In order to develop family business, Aiyumbubu wants to purchase livestock animals for further fattening and increasing stock. In the future the family wants to improve their life's wealth.

Dariika S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband makes his living by renting a combine and working as a tractor operator. This kind of work makes it possible to earn 10,000-20,000 soms per season. The couple has four children (3 sons and a daughter): the eldest one is a university student, the younger sons are schoolboys, the daughter goes to kindergarten. At this point the family is engaged in harvesting. In order to purchase animal livestock for business development, the family hopes to get a loan. In the future, Dariika wishes to improve her family's welfare and to increase cattle stock.

Almabubu J., 50, is married. Her family has 5 children (3 daughters and 2 sons): the eldest are married and live separately from their parents, the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. The head of the family raises money by farming: he is harvesting and looking after cattle. They have managed to give their children an education. The loan purpose is to purchase animal livestock. In the future, Almabubu is planning to increase cattle stock. 

Asanaly U., 71, is married. He and his wife are pensioners. They brought up 5 children (a son and 4 daughters) who are all married and live separately from their parents. The main source of income comes from cultivating cereals. The family has managed to harvest 4 tons of barley. The loan purpose is to purchase animal livestock for further fattening and breeding. Asanaly, with his wife, are aiming to support their children and to improve their wealth.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en:
Tarnue A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers, called A. Group. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children whose ages are between 2 and 8 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties.

For five years he has been selling used clothing in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. He describes himself as a dedicated man whose dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Missie Group

texts.en:
Missie G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Missie Group. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven children whose ages range between 3 and 26 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulty. She cares for two siblings.
 
For 14 years she has been selling fish in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish. 

She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy cartons of fish

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul S. is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old and married. Her spouse makes his income by working as an odd-job man. The couple brings up five children (3 sons and 2 daughters), and the eldest of them help their parents in house keeping. The family has its own business, which was started 4 years ago. They sell fruits and vegetables by wholesale. Due to years of working hard, the family has managed to increase cattle stock and improve their wealth. Jazgul’s family hopes to get a loan in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables. In the future she wishes to improve her family's welfare and develop their business. 

Nurzat M. is the group’s treasurer. She is 24 years old and married. Together with her spouse, who earns additional income by working at a building site, she brings up 2 children (a son and a daughter). Both of their children go to kindergarten. Nurzat increases her family's budget by working as a business producer. In order to make her plans of purchasing furniture come true, Nurzat hopes to get a loan. In the future she is planning to improve her family’s welfare. 

Mahabat K. is 36 years old and married. Her family has two children (a daughter and a son, who is a schoolboy). She lives together with her husband’s parents, who make their living by farming. Mahabat’s spouse raises money by working as a driver for Red Cross. She works in the accounting profession. Her family needs to get a loan in order to purchase calves for fattening. In the future the family wants to increase their cattle stock. 

Nazira M. is 27 years old. She is a farmer. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sagynbubu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbubu O. is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old and married. Both her husband and she are pensioners. Her family has 5 sons: the eldest one works in Moscow, the youngest is a student, and the rest are working in the capital of the country. Sagynbubu has her own business which includes selling national wares. Her earnings made it possible to arrange her son’s wedding. She needs to get a loan in order to purchase fabric and materials (50 meters) for sewing national wares. In the future Sagynbubu is planning to purchase sewing machines and to open her own sewing shop. 

Toktobubu J. is 54 and married. She has 2 children (a daughter and a son). All of her family members are engaged in their own jobs: the head of the family is a farmer, the daughter is married and sews national wares, the son breeds cattle, and the mother sells sewing stuff, coats, costumes and national wares. From their profits the family has managed to arrange their son’s wedding. The purpose of this loan is to increase commodity circulation. 

Emilbek T. is 48 and married. His wife sews national wares. The couple has 5 children (4 sons and a daughter). The eldest son raises money by working at a building site in Bishkek, the daughter works in confectioner’s shop, the youngest one is a toddler, and the rest are schoolboys. The family is also engaged in cattle breeding. Out of their earnings, they have managed to build a temporary construction and make repairs to it. The purpose of the loan is to purchase more cattle. In the future Emilbek wants to give a proper education to his children.

Talantbek B. is 38 and married. His wife is a farmer. The couple brings up 2 preschool aged children. Their main source of income is from cattle breeding, which they started 2 years ago after a loan was received. Talantbek wants to use a loan to increase commodity circulation. In the future he is planning to increase cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials to make national wares

loans.name: Diamond Group

texts.en:
Alja K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Diamond Group. She is 30 years old, married, and has one child who is seven years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulty. 
 
For 8 years she has been selling lappas ( a traditional dress for women) in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of lappa. 

She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of lappa (traditional dresses)

loans.name: Nurjan's Group

texts.en:
Nurjan R. is the leader of the group. She is 33 years old and married. She has three children, 2 daughters and a son, the eldest of whom are school pupils. The main source of family income comes from cattle breeding.  Nurjan’s spouse is a farmer. The family also has two sheep and in order to increase the herd they need to purchase more sheep. This is why she wants to get a loan. In the future Nurjan is planning to give a proper education to her children and to develop her family’s business.

Shailoo S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and a widow. She has had to bring up three daughters alone. The eldest daughter raises money by working as a teacher in Orlovka village. The others are schoolgirls, and all of them support their mother by helping her with the housekeeping. Shailoo is building a house, if all the conditions for cattle breeding are provided. The loan purpose is to purchase livestock animals for further fattening and breeding. In the future the family wants to finish building their house and to develop their business.

Yimanakun J., 63, is married. He lives together with his wife. All of their children are already grownups and live separately from their parents. The family business is farming, but temporarily it has been paused. The loan purpose is to obtain livestock animals for further fattening and breeding. In the future Yimanakun hopes to improve his family wealth and to develop the business. 

Tolobek J., is 36 and married. He and his wife, who is a farmer, are bringing up three small children. Tolobek knows how to breed cattle and wants to start his own business in this familiar sphere. The loan purpose is to purchase livestock animals. In the future he wants his children to be well educated, and he is planning to increase his cattle stock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa S. is a 25-year-old married woman with a 5-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter lives with her mother-in-law, who operates a small cafe in the Uyanga sub-province. 

Bayarmaa started her own business in 2005 by trading a variety of grocery and consumer products between two sub-provinces, Uyanga and Arvaiheer. Her  husband operates a taxi service using his own car. Bayarmaa purchases her grocery products from local wholesale stores and her consumer goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Over the years, she has managed to expand her business, and her earnings have allowed her to purchase a new car as well as a house and fence for her family. Bayarmaa is a hardworking and optimistic person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of food and other goods in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of food to sell.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga J. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province in Mongolia in their own apartment. Both of his elder children are university students while his youngest child attends a local secondary school. His wife helps him with the business. 

Gantulga started his own business in 2005 by operating a raw material trading business. In 2009, he opened his second business, a used consumer goods retail business, after receiving a loan from the bank. Gantulga is a responsible for his raw material trading business while his wife manages the secondhand products retail business. Both businesses have proven to be successful, and the couple has managed to increase their working capital. Their earnings have enabled them to have their own workplace. 

For the future, he hopes to continue having success with both businesses and he is planning to save money for his children's future education. Gantulga is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more quality used consumer goods for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more quality used consumer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Monhor

texts.en:
Monhor D., age 64, lives with his wife in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province in western Mongolia. All his children are grown and live on their own. 

Monhor used to work in the rural areas as an agent. He has been operating a food trading business for three years in his own workshop, which was built and completed in his yard after moving to the capital city of Hovd province. With his business revenues, he is planning to build a house in his own yard for his family in the future. 

Monhor is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of products for his grocery shop, due to starting a new academic year,

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of products

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur O. lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Suhbaatar province in Mongolia. Both of his two children attend the local high school while his wife operates a block imprinting business outside of their home. 

Enhtur and his wife began their own business in 2003 by operating a meat trading business, which is currently stalled due to insufficient working capital. Instead, he has been driving a taxi since 2009 after purchasing a new Excel car, and has built a stable operation. They are planning to imprint more blocks in order to build a new garage for his car. Moreover, he hopes to build his own house for his family by 2011. 

Enhtur is a modest, diligent and hardworking man and says, "I am planning to build and move in a new house before my children start attending universities." He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary parts for his car and also to produce ceramic blocks that will be used in the construction of his new garage.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts for his taxi

loans.name: Zorigoo

texts.en:
Zorigoo A. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two young children, ages 2 and 4, in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in a rented yard. Both of his children attend the local kindergarten. 

Zorigoo operates a vegetable trading business in his town. He started this grocery business in 2008 by planting and harvesting vegetables to sell at the local market for a profit. After several years of successful business activity, he has used his earnings to provide for his family and was recently able to renovate and decorate his house. 

For the future, he plans to increase his working capital and to purchase land where he will grow a variety of vegetables. Zorigoo is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of vegetables when prices for those products are low.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of vegetables

loans.name: Norjmaa

texts.en:
Norjmaa D. is 40 years old and lives with her three adult children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house with a fence. Two of her children work privately in the construction sector in the summer months, while during wintertime they help in their mother's business. Her youngest daughter attends the university. 

Norjmaa operates a meat retail business in the local market in her town. She began this business in 1995 by selling only intestines of livestock. After many years of work, she has built a stable and successful operation and has gained much experience. Norjmaa is a very optimistic, clever and hardworking businesswoman. 

She is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and preserve more meat to sell during the upcoming winter months, when prices for meats traditionally rise.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more meat

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Amara.  He is married and has two children, aged 9 and 6.  He has three additional dependents who assist in taking care of his family and help to educate his children.  

In 2001, Amara established his provisions and cigarette business.  He began his business to generate income and to care for his family.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about $340 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy additional inventory.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 270,600 SLL. With these additional profits, Amara plans to further grow his business and to be more independent.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 29 years old and a member of the Pioneer Matasiah group in Faulu Kenya.  Since she joined the group, she has become focused in her clothes selling business.  She has two years of experience in the business and she hopes to expand.  

In five years, she wants to start importing clothes from other countries.  She wants to buy more clothes for resale, so she has requested a loan of 30,000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 43-year-old single mother of two.  A year ago, she left her previous employment and started a greengrocer shop to provide for her family.  The business is doing well, and Rose is focused on expanding her shop.  She hopes to open other outlets in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B.  is a twenty-seven-year-old hairdresser at Nyinasi near Abura. Ama B. is married and has two children. Her husband is a butcher. She plans to use her loan to improve her business; she wants to buy more of the gadgets such as hair dryers and chemicals like shampoo she uses in her hairdressing business. She will then use the profits she makes in her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy hair dryers and chemicals like shampoo

loans.name: Batbuyan

texts.en:
Batbuyan O. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. 

Batbuyan's oldest son, age 24, attends university.  His eldest daughter, age 21, recently graduated from college and is seeking employment as a teacher.   Two other children, ages 19 and 17, are both college students while his youngest three children, ages 13, 11 and 7, attend school. 

Batbuyan and his wife operate a retail business out of two  rented stalls at a local market. They began their business in 1998 and have built a stable and successful operation. The couple has managed to rent two stalls at a second local market by selling a variety of consumer goods such as socks, shoe polish, adhesive tape, stationery, soap and washing powder, etc. In the future, Batbuyan would like to increase his product line. 

Additionally, he produces a variety of steel and iron items such as fire tongs and steam bowls to supplement his earnings. His earnings have enabled him to pay his two children's tuition fees. In the future, Batbuyan plans to have his own fence. He is a open-minded and hard-working businessman who says, “My wish is to educate my two younger daughters in order to make them better people.”  Batbuyan is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase small household items for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase small household items to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, onions  and groundnut phase. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Florence is 40 years old and is married. her husband is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Bayar-Erdene

texts.en: Bayar-Erdene B. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and one year old daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home with her infant baby while Bayar-Erdene operates a raw material retail business in his town. He began his business in 2004 with the help of his uncle and after lots of hard work and determination, Bayar-Erdene operates his business independently. Initially, he purchased raw materials using his uncle's money and earned a small profit. In 2007, he has purchased his own van after selling his livestock (approximately 150 animals). He purchases his raw materials from herders in rural areas by traveling in his van and sells them for a profit at the central market. Since 2009, he started purchasing  raw materials in the local market where his customers and suppliers can come to him. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en: Enhjargal B. is 23 years old and lives with her mother, sibling and husband in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent that belongs to her mother. Her husband attends university and during his summer holiday, he operates a taxi service in his town. Enhjargal started her own business by operating a computer and copying services in a rented space at the Shine Tushig trade center in 2009 after her mother in law received a loan from a bank. She has recently found success with her new business and with her earnings, she started selling a variety of cellphones and parts in 2010. She is a modest and well calculated person. Enhjargal is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase more cellphones for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty H. is currently in the business of selling food stuffs at the hotel and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to sell.  Betty is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 7 children and 4 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Y. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Mary is 38 years old and is married to a business man. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal B., age 30, is single mother with two children. She lives with two children, ages 7 and 5, in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Gobi-Altay province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a local elementary school while her youngest son is in kindergarten. She operates a grocery as well as consumer goods selling business in a rented pavilion at the Shine Altai market in her town. 

She started her business in 2008 by selling only a dairy products in her rented shop with working capital of 300,000 MNT and since then she has managed to expand her business to sell not only a variety of grocery products but also consumer goods through her shop. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a new ger and fence. 

Jargal is planning to buy her rented pavilion by next year. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase 1,5 tons of rye in order to make and sell flour for the  upcoming winter.

loans.use: To purchase 1,5 tons of rye

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu I. is a trader at Nyinasi, near Abura. Salamatu is a widow with four children. She trades in cereals like beans and groundnuts, and apart from that also sells charcoal. She will use the loan she is requesting to expand her business. She will add the loan to the capital she already has to buy more beans and groundnuts to sell. She will then use the profits she gets to cater for her children, to further their education, and also pay the utility bills and other expenses of her home.

loans.use: buy more beans and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Ochirpurev

texts.en:
Ochirpurev C. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his children, ages 15 and 11, attend local school while his wife operates a sewing business at home. His son has a congenital decease of hip dislocation and has to be under treatment all the time.

 Ochirpurev operates an iron crafting business in his town. Before starting his iron craft business, he worked as a plumber in the school between 1989 and 1998. Since 1998, he started his own business by operating an electricwelding service in his home. He produces a variety of chimney and iron doors for fences in his own workplace that was built and completed in his yard. Moreover, he makes trailer and carriage bodies for vehicles according to customers' orders. Currently, he made contracts with construction companies to produce a variety of fence's doors, fence and roof items etc.

Over the many years of work, he has built a stable and successful operation and has gained much experience as a craftsman. Ochirpurev says, " I am one of first iron smiths in my town therefore my products are known and popular in the local community. It is good to learn and have one's skill". He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase awelding machine with high capacity and steels and irons used for making stove pipe, chimney, door etc, for his iron craft business.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Samilatu

texts.en: Samilatu S. is a business woman. She is married and has five children. Samilatu’s husband is a carpenter. She sells groceries such as Milo (cocoa powder), milk, sugar, and other provisions, which she does at Nyinasi, a town near Abura. Salimatu will use the loan she takes to stock her provisions store. She will buy more of the provisions she deals in and sell them to her customers. Salimatu will use her profits to cater for her children and also for the upkeep of her home.

loans.use: Salimatu will use the loan she takes to stock her provision store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy N. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol, tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Joy is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a messenger. She has 4 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne A. is 27 years old and married to Stephen Wewa who is a carpenter. She supports four children with her business. They live in Kondele,  just few kilometers from Kisumu City and this is the location of her business   Carolyne buys fish from the fishmongers and prepares them well, fries and sells the food to her customers who are mostly the residence of Kondele.She has been in this business for one and half years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs. 12,000

Carolyne found out about KADET LTD through a friend who is also a member of KADET and she is now applying for her second loan of Kshs.35,000 after repaying her previous loans well. She intends to purchase more supplies of fish to sell to her customers.   With the profit generated from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to buy a motorbike which will ease with the transport of fish.

In the future she hopes to have a stable business and better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish for sell to her customers

loans.name: Lucya

texts.en: Lucya J. is currently in the business of selling bananas, coffee and beans, and is requesting a loan to stock tea leaves and bags of beans to sell.  She is 29 years old and married to a man who works for MPA. She has 2 children, 1 of whom attends school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Lucya hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock tea leaves and more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: koukou est un homme dynamique qui est un père de famille, il est cambiste et exerce cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. il souhaite augmenter son capital pour réaliser plus de profits sur les opérations de change.c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite du crédit de WAGES. il a deux personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
Kokou is an energetic man, and a father with two dependents in his care. He makes a living as a broker, an activity he has been practicing for over five years. 

He is seeking a loan from WAGES to increase his working capital and bolster his profits on exchange transactions.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Mwahija Yosuph is in her mid-forties, and is married with four children. She is engaged in the sale — wholesale and retail — of cement, water, juice, and corn husks which are used as chicken feed. Mwahija has been selling these products for the past seven years, and works daily between 7:30 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. The business earns Mwahija a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwahija's fourth Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Her previous loans were used to increase her business — loans which she has successfully repaid. Mwahija aims to use this loan to buy more cement and water. 

Mwahija will share this loan with her loan group Subira, which has thirteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Mwahija is wearing red and black, in the back row.

loans.use: Cement and water inventory

loans.name: Yendoukoua

texts.fr: yendoukoua est un jeune homme très dynamique, très tôt il s'est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées, il a ouvert sa propre boutique qu'il appelle "ETS YENDOUKOUA". il s'approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé.sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il veut se réapprovisionner, il demande chez WAGES un crédit pour compléter ses économies et acheter diverses pièces détachées d'automobile. il est marié et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en: Yendoukoua is a very energetic young man. Early on, he became involved in the spare parts business, opening his own shop which he calls "ETS YENDOUKOUA." He gets his supplies from the local market at the Port of Lomé. His clientèle is made up of many different types of people. As he wants to re-stock, he is asking WAGES for a loan to increase his savings and to buy various spare parts for cars. He is married and is the father of two children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Zinabala  Nassuti Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Janiffer N., a happily married mother of 4, has been selling fish for the last 4 years in Nasuti-Mukono. Hard work and dedication lie at the root of her continuing track record of success. Accruing profits from this business has, to a certain magnitude, enabled her to keep her head above the water. In a week, her profits equate to 40,000 shillings and she is looking forward to using this loan money to buy more fish stock for resale. With more sales profits, she reckons she will be able to elevate the welfare status of her family even further.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for resale

loans.name: Kokou Louis

texts.fr: louis est un homme marié de 33 ans, il est père d'un enfant. il a ouvert il y a 5 ans déjà une boutique dans laquelle il vend des articles scolaires. la rentrée scolaire scolaire ayant débuté à Lomé, il voudrait alors augmenter ses recettes, il sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de cartons de papiers A4, 3 paquets de stylos, 1 paquet de crayons, des ardoises et divers autres articles.
texts.en: Louis is a 33 year-old man, married and the father of one child. Five years ago he opened a shop selling school supplies. Because the return to school has already begun in Lomé, he would like to increase his earnings. Thus he is seeking a loan through WAGES to buy boxes of A4 paper, 3 boxes of pens, 1 box of pencils, chalkboards, and various other items.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
H. A. is in his mid-twenties and single.  He owns a food shop where he sells rice, beans, wheat and sugar.  H. has been running his shop for the past four years, which is open daily between 7:30 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. The business earns H. a good monthly profit.

H. is requesting a Motisha loan as his second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  His main loan was used to increase the stock needed for his business, a loan which he has been paying on time.  H. aims to use the Motisha loan to buy more inventory for his shop as it runs out.  

H. will share this loan with his loan group Waukae, eleven members of which have also requested a Motisha loan.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, H. is seen wearing black at the back row.

loans.use: To increase food inventory

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Benito S. is in his late forties and is married with one daughter. One year ago, Benito started up his own poultry business. The business runs from 8 am to 6 pm daily and earns Benito a stable monthly profit. 

This will be Benito's second Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Benito's previous loans were used to buy more chicks and medicine, a loan which he has successfully repaid. The demand for Benito's chickens is growing, and Benito hopes for another loan to help finance more chicks and meet this demand. 

Benito will share this loan with his loan group Iringa, which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Benito is seen holding a bottle in his hand, first on the left.

loans.use: Buy more chicks.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: S. est une femme qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales notamment le maïs qui est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise; sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays pour avoir une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes. elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans dans ce commerce. faisant face à une rupture de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 32 sacs de maïs et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Akossiwa S. is a woman who earns money in grain sales, notably corn, which is frequently used in Togolese cuisine. Her customers come from all backgrounds. She gets her supplies inland in order to have a larger profit margin on her sales. She has seven years' experience in this business.

Facing a stock shortage, she would like to restock and thus is seeking a loan through WAGES in order to buy 32 bags of corn and to arrange delivery of the merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn

loans.name: Gangamala Group

texts.en:
B. M., a married man in his early seventies with 10 children, runs a small business selling fried fish on the street in his home village. He has been doing this for the past four years, between 6 a.m. and 2 p.m. daily, earning him a low monthly profit.

This will be B.'s first Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. With this loan, B. will buy more fish at the markets in the morning and thereby increase his sales. B. will share the loan with his loan group Gangamala, which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, B. is standing in the middle of the back row, wearing a striped shirt.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Mkwalia Group

texts.en:
Shukuru Ally, in his early thirties, is married and has two children. Three years ago, Shukuru started a food shop which he operates from 6:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily, earning him a stable monthly profit.

This will be Shukuru's second Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Shukuru's previous loan, which he has since repaid, was used to increase his business capital. He plans to use this loan to begin selling fruits and vegetables in his shop.

Shukuru will share this loan with his loan group Mkwalia, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Shukuru is on the far left.

loans.use: To begin selling fruits and vegetables in his shop

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin O., from Ngiya in Siaya town, is 23 years old, married to Roselyn, and the father of a three-year-old daughter. Edwin, who has been operating a cereals business for the last five years, has a monthly income of Kshs 30,000 and is now applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after having repaid the first one. He intends to use the money to buy green grams, maize and rice to add to his stock and will use the profits made to educate his daughter through school and pay for the family's needs.

Edwin's dream is to see the business grow and even open a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To buy green grams, maize and rice to add to his stock.

loans.name: Domtilla

texts.en:
Domtilla O., a resident of Kisumu city, is a widow with four school-going children: Alice, 19 years, Rosebella, 17 years, Gilbert, 15 years, and Margaret, 10 years old. Domtilla has operated a retail open-air business for the past nine years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 10,000. With a good credit history, she is now applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to buy bar soaps and cereals such as rice, beans and green grams to add to her stock.

Domtilla's main hope and dream is to see her business expand and be able to move into a shop instead of selling out in the open field. She also has a desire to educate her children well so that they have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cereals and bar soaps to add to her stock

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher A. is 57 years old and is married to Barack Ochieng. They have one adult son. The husband has retired from his place of work and depends on his pension to enable him make ends meet.

For the past 11 years, Jenipher has run a posho mill (grinding machine), grinding maize into maize flour. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a client, and she is applying for her second loan. She is in need of maize to add to her stock so that she can be able to meet the demands of her clients. Her monthly income is KES 15000.

She hopes to expand the business and yield more profit to help her contribute well to the upkeep of the family.

loans.use: To buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura T. sells "wakye", a local dish prepared with rice and beans cooked together, and also sells plain rice at Nyinasi, a town near Abura. Safura is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She will use the loan given to her to expand her business by ordering more rice and beans to cook her "wakye" and plain rice to sell. She will then use the profit from her business to cater for her children and also help her husband to provide for the family.

loans.use: order more rice and beans to cook

loans.name: Nubia Mayra

texts.es:
La profesora Nubia de 35 años de edad , vive con la Abuelita, su mamá y sus  dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad ambos estudian su primaria, los cuida su abuelita; la Sra. Nubia es docente de primaria y secundaria ejerce las dos plazas a la vez en turnos diferentes desde hace 11 años. 

Está solicitando su decimo crédito  para reparar su vivienda como es cambiarle el zinc a su casa ya que se encuentra en mal estado y para terminar de construir una habitación que empezo con el credito anterior que fue beneficiada con Kiva, el cual ahora espera culminar este proyecto, importante mencionar que esta clienta ha demostrado   ser una mujer bien honesta y bien trabajdora.

su mayor sueño en la vida es terminar de estudiar y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Nubia is a 35 year old teacher. She lives with her grandmother, mother, and her two children who are 14 and 12 years old and both attend primary school. Their grandmother takes care of them. Mrs. Nubia is a primary and secondary teacher and has been teaching at both levels in different shifts for 11 years.

She is asking for her tenth loan to repair her home. She wants to replace her metal roof as it is currently in poor condition and also wants to finish building the bedroom she began with her last loan from Kiva. It is important to mention that this client has proven herself to be a very honest and hard-working woman.

Her greatest dream in life is to finish her studies and that her children study so that they can be successful.

loans.use: New roof and to finish building a bedroom

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 34 años de edad , su esposa es Medico General en el MINSA y  ha sido cliente de AFODENIC, tienen un bebe de un añito de vida el que está al cuidado de su abuelita cuando ellos salen a trabajar, el Sr. C. P. labora como Director de suministro del Ministerio de educación desde hace 2 años, tienen buenas referencias de sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo.

Esta solicitando su  septimo crédito para construir una habitación para su hijo ya que necesita mas comodidad.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hijo este bien de salud, tener estabilidad laboral y que la familia permanezca unida,
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 34 years old. His wife is a doctor at MINSA and he has been a client of the AFODENIC Community Bank. They have a 1 year old baby that is cared for by his grandmother when his parents are working. Mr. C. P. has worked for 2 years as the Director of Supplies for the Department of Education. They have good references from their neighbors and coworkers.

He is asking for his seventh loan to build a bedroom for his son to provide him with greater comfort. His greatest dream in life is for his son to be healthy, have steady work, and for his family to remain united.

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es:
Magdali de 29 años de edad, vive con su hija de tres añitos de edad el cual el papá de la niña le pasa una pension alimenticia, labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace 4 años en la colonia San Antonio a 15 km de Nueva Guinea, Magdali se caracteriza por ser una joven honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está culminando sus estudios Universitarios en Universidad URACCAN.

Està solicitando su cuarto crèdito para repellar y hecarle la ceramica a una habitaciòn que construyo gracias al financiamiento anterior que tuvo con Kivalo cual ahora pretende terminar esta construccion dandole los toques finales y asi tener mejores condiciones como toda persona.  

Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que a su hijita no le falte nada y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Magdali is 29 years old and lives with her three year old daughter. She receives alimony from the girl's father. She has been working as a primary school teacher in the Diriangen school in Colonia San Antonio, which is 15 km from Nueva Guinea, for 4 years. Magdali is an honest and hard working young woman. She is currently finishing her university degree at the Universidad URACCAN.

She requests this fourth loan to plaster and tile a room that she built thanks to a previous Kivalo loan. She wants to finish the build by giving it the final touches and making it more comfortable, like anyone would.   

Her dreams are to finish building her home and enjoy better living conditions, make sure her daughter doesn't miss out on anything and have job security.

loans.use: Plaster and tile a room

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hermias de 60 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Julia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas y maíz, las cuales luego lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 38 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en anteriores préstamos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Julia, 54, is a cheerful and hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Hermias, aged 60, and their 2 young sons, who are the reason behind their efforts. Julia has painstakingly managed to make her land very productive. She cultivates potatoes, peas and corn, which she then sells at the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. Her crops have provided the necessary income to support her family. That's the reason why she wants to do everything she can to help the business succeed. 

What she likes the most about her job is caring for her crops. She has been doing it for 38 years and she thinks that the most difficult thing is transporting her products to Tarma, because the sacks are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she would like to buy more lands to increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in the repayment of previous loans and this time she expects to do the same. She is a very active member of her loan group, always aware of the agreements reached by her group. With the 1300 soles requested she will buy more fertiliser for her lands.

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Agustina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Agustina de 52 años, tiene 2 hijas ambas mayores de edad, la mayor trabaja como docente de secundaria y la otra es ejecutiva de ventas, su esposo trabaja en la finca que ellos poseen que es donde viven en la colonia San Juan, trabaja para el  MINED de  docente desde hace 24 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad.      
                                                                                                  Està Solicitando su sexto  crèdito para comprar materiales de construcciòn que pretende construir una habitacion  de esta manera mejorar sus  condiciones de vida y tener mejor comodidad en el hogar .    

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goce de salud y tener estabilidad laboral para vivir una vida digna como toda persona lo desea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agustina is 52 years old and has two grown daughters. The elder works as a secondary school teacher and the other is a sales executive. Her husband works on their farm and that is where they live in the San Juan region. She has worked for MINED as a teacher for 24 years, putting forth a lot of effort and showing responsibility and honesty.

She is asking for her sixth loan to buy materials to build a bedroom and improve her life and the comfort of the home. Her greatest dream in life is for her family to enjoy good health and have steady work and, like everyone else, to live a life of dignity.

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima Y. is a "chop bar" operator; she prepares a variety of foods to sell. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Some of the foods she prepares to sell are "fufu", which is prepared by pounding cooked cassava and plantain. She also sells other foods as requested by her customers. Fatima will use the loan she is able to obtain to expand her business. She will buy more foodstuffs to cook her food to sell. She will then use the profits she gets from her business to further her children’s education, and also help her husband to provide for her family.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya Z. is married with a grown son. She sells women’s clothing and footwear in two markets of her home town of Novaya Kahovka. Natalya launched her trade due to financial struggles 20 years ago. She managed to survive all the challenges of perestroika and the unfavorable economic climate back in the '90s in Ukraine. She currently has 40000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover capital amounts to 36000 Grivnyas.  

Natalya is planning to invest the loan of 10000 Grivnyas in additional merchandise. She is hoping to improve the selection of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk, thus attracting even more customers to her clothing and footwear sales business. Profits generated will be used to meet her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo de 42 años, tiene una hija de 9 años de edad, aunque no viven juntos él siempre está atento a lo que ella necesita labora para el Ministerio de Educación desde hace 23 años, como asesor pedagogico, es un hombre bien reconocido en el municipio por ser responsable, honesto, servicial y sobre todo bien querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y amigos.

Este prestamo lo requiere para terminar de arreglar su vivienda y para conexion de la luz de su nuevo hogar.

su mayor sueño en la vida es ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda y salud y que su hija estudie para que en el futuro sea una excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and has a 9-year-old daughter.  Although they do not live together, he is constantly attentive to her needs.  He has worked for the Ministry of Education for 23 years as a pedagogical consultant.  He is well known in the town as a reliable, honest, helpful person, and in particular he is loved by his colleagues at work, neighbors, and friends.

He would like this loan to complete construction of his house and for the electrical connection to his new home.

His greatest dream is to gradually improve his housing and health, so that his daughter may study and become a first-rate professional.

loans.use: house construction and electricity

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Vincent B.. He is married and has four children, aged 13, 10, 7 and 1. He has 15 additional dependents, who live with him to help assist his family. In 2000, Vincent established his building materials and spare parts business and now serves the entire Bo community. He began his business to generate income and to take care of his family. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 3146000 SLL every month from this business. Vincent would like a loan in the amount of 3000000 SLL in order to buy cement, iron rods and paint. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 314600 SLL. In the future, Vincent plans to become an international businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional building materials

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana D. is a widow with two grown sons. She is a market vendor from Berdyansk. Tatyana owns a clothing sales business. She sells women’s clothing items in one of the local marketplaces of her home town. Tatyana has been in business for more than 12 years. Currently, she has 13000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to 6500 Grivnyas. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise. She is hoping to purchase inventory in bulk at wholesale prices for resale at retail prices. Tatyana is an ambitious and determined entrepreneur. She works hard to keep her business running and meet her family’s basic needs. 

Note: On the photo Tatyana is in the front with her guarantor in the back.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Zhuzhanna

texts.en:
Zhuzhanna P. is a widow. She lives in Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. Zhuzhanna owns a fast food vending kiosk. Her fast food place is very popular among customers. Zhuzhanna has been in business for 12 years. She has gained a good client base. Moreover, she has a reputation as a qualified cook and entrepreneur who always sells fresh and tasty food. Currently, Zhuzhanna makes 3100 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Zhuzhanna is seeking a loan of 7100 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and satisfy growing demand in the fall/winter season. More people live on fast food in the colder season, especially students, market entrepreneurs and taxi drivers. Zhuzhanna’s affordable pies, pastries, hamburgers and hot dogs are always served hot and fresh, which is the best option for low-income people or those working outside.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Bahar

texts.ru:
Bahar A. 30 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey, doch kotoroy 5 let ona xodit v detskiy sadik i sin kotoromu 3 qoda. Bahar yavlyayetysa IDP personoy ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. 

Bahar uje 5 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom etumu biznessu ona nauchilas u tyoti. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Bahar A. is 30 years old. She is married and has two children: a 5-year old daughter who goes to kindergarten and a 3-year old son. Bahar is an Internally Displaced Person; she is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Fuzuli Region.

Bahar has been in this business for five years. She has learned it from her aunt.
At present she needs 2000 AZN  to purchase a cow so as to develop her business further.

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Jacha Uru Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “JACHA URU” está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho mujeres.  La frecuencia de reuniones, cada quince días permite que las integrantes de la asociación se conozcan mejor.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Ana María como presidenta, la señora Maria Luz como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Janette.

La señora  Ana Maria es una mujer de 31 años de edad, ha sido nombrada  presidenta por su asociación con la seguridad de que cumplirá con responsabilidad sus funciones.   Con respecto a su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de  Productos AVON  y tambien atiende una zapatería.  La señora Ana María solicitó Bs.2000.-, para la compra de peluches y venderlos en navidad.  Ella considera que la mercadería este mes de octubre es mucho mas barata que en noviembre  y evidentemente mucho más que en diciembre. De esta manera ella está 

Los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados: venta de comidas, venta de juguetes y poleras, tienda comercial, venta de ropa interior, zapatería y venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, promotora de venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "JACHA URU" is taking out its first loan from Focal Center of Villa Exaltation and is composed of eight women. They meet every two weeks which allows the group's members to get to know each other better. The board is composed of Mrs. Ana Maria as president, Ms. Maria Luz as treasurer, and Mrs Janette as recording secretary.

Mrs. Ana Maria, 31, has been named president of the group with the assurance that she will fulfill her duties responsibly. With respect to her business, she sells Avon products and also runs a shoe store. Ana María asked for 2,000 Bs to purchase stuffed animals to sell at Christmas. She believes that  merchandise in  is much cheaper in October than in November, and obviously, much more than in December.

The businesses of the remaining members of the group are varied: food sales, selling toys and t-shirts, a store, selling underwear, footwear and cosmetics a neighborhood store, and cosmetics sales.

loans.use: To purchase stuffed animals.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Danilo E. tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Sandy Emerita Martinez quien se dedica al cuidado de la casa y Jose Danilo se dedica a la compra venta de camarones, pescado blanco, pescado rojo, y babosa esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años.
 
su puntos de venta son Pespire, San Lorenzo, y Moropocay.
traslada en su carro su producto y tiene la ayuda de su papa quien tambien se dedica al mismo negocio. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado y camarones tambien necesita una parte para darle mantenimiento al carro en que transporta su prodcuto.
 
Jose vive en la casa de un hermano que radica en los estados unidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Danilo E. is 29 years old and married to Sandy Martinez Emerita who cares for the house and Jose Danilo.  Mr. E. buys and sells shrimp, white fish, red fish, and slugs for a living.  He has made his living this way for two years. 
 
He sells in Pespire, San Lorenzo, and Moropocay and transports his products by car.  His father, who works in the same business, helps him. He plans to use the loan to buy fish and shrimp. He also needs a part to fix the car they use to transport their product. 
 
Jose lives in his brother's house (who lives in the United States).

loans.use: To buy shrimp, fish, and spare parts for his car.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meybis Lorena

texts.es: Meybis Lorena tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que inicio este medio de vida para sufragar los gastos de su hogar y mantener a sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscarla para realizar los diferentes pedidos que ofrece ellos se encuentran contentos con el buen servicio y los diferentes productos que ofrece. El financiamiento es para la compra de pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, polvos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y proporcionar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Meybis Lorena is 38 years old and has made a living selling cosmetics for more than 8 years. She started this business to help defray her household expenses and support her two young children. Most of her customers come to her to order different things and are happy with the good service and different products offered. The funding is to buy nail polish, lipstick,  and powder. She dreams of improving her income and making home improvements.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eldar

texts.ru:
Eldar G. 48 let. On zamujem i imeyet 3 detey , doch kotoroy uje 19 let ona uchitsya v kolledje, sin kotoromu 17 let on uchitsya v shkole i sin kotoromu 15 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom. Eldar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy .

Eldar uje 7 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva , etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Eldar nujdayetsya n 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en:
Eldar G. is 48 years old. He is married and has three children: a 19-year old daughter who is a college student, a 17-year old son who goes to school and a 15-years old son who also goes to school and participates in sports.  Eldar is an Internally Displaced Person; he is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Fuzuli Region.

Eldar has been raising cattle for 7 years. He learned it from his father. At present Eldar needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.
.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Wulamatu. She is divorced and has two children, aged 17 and 6 years. She has one additional dependent in her niece.  

In 2008, Wulamatu established her provisions and cosmetics business. She began her business to assist with home expenses. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 854,360 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She is very savvy in establishing relationships with her customers in order to increase her daily sales.  

Wulamatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Wulamatu requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks, cola drinks and general provisions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 153,784. In the future, Wulamatu plans to expand her shop space by rebuilding her current one. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
la señora Juana F. G. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el barrio El Jazmin de Agua Fria Nacaome Valle. tiene 21 años de vivir en dicho lugar, Juana se dedica a la venta de abarroteria como ser jabon, harina de maiz, manteca, aceite, pollos, carnes, refrescos y todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar.
sus clientes son sus vecinos y familiares de la zona, Juana se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años,
recibe ademas ingresos de cuatro hijos que radican en los estados unidos. 
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio. 
su mayor preocupacion es que sus hijos esten bien en los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Juana G. F. is 55-years-old and lives in the neighborhood of El Jazmin de Auga Fria Nacaome Valle. She has lived here for 21 years.  Jane sells groceries like: soap, cornmeal, butter, oil, chicken, meat, soft drinks, and everything related to a general family grocery bag for a living.  Her customers are her neighbors and her relatives.  Jane has been in this business for 5 years and also receives income from four children who live in the United States.
 
The loan will be used to purchase merchandise for her business.

His biggest concern is that her children are well in the United States.

loans.use: To buy cornmeal, rice, coffee, bread, cookies, soft drinks, beans, lard, oil, sardines, matches, candles,soap, salt, and spices.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pinina Armandina

texts.es: Pinina se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en general desde hace más de diez años, su pequeña tienda se llama “TANIA” , Se inicio apañando cochinilla y cosechando tuna para una tercera persona que exportaba estas semillas y ganando su confianza la dueña de dicha plantación le prestó cuatrocientos nuevos soles con lo que apertura su pequeño negocio, atraves del tiempo ha logrado sostener su hogar con la ayuda de su esposo que es  albañil, ha logrado dar estudios a sus hijos y comprar algunos artefactos eléctricos para su uso, el capital recibido lo invertirá en la compra de tarjetas de recarga para teléfonos celulares que tienen cierta demanda en la zona  donde tiene su pequeña bodega, Pinina está contenta por conseguir capital para su inversión que le brindara ganancias en corto plazo.
texts.en:
Pinene has sold groceries for more than ten years in her small shop called "TANIA."  She started out harvesting cochineal and prickly pear for a third person who exported the seeds and then earned the plantation owner's confidence, who lent her 400 soles to open her small business. 

Through the years she has managed to sustain her home with her husband's help, who is a mason.  She has also managed to provide her children an eduction and to buy some appliances.  She will invest the capital received in the purchase of rechargeable cards for mobile phones that are in demand in the area where she has her small store, Pinina is happy to raise capital for an investment that will provide short-term gains.

loans.use: To buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Abdul, who is married, has three children aged 11, 7 and 1, and one additional dependent who lives with him to help with domestic work and to attend school.

In 2000, Abdul established his clothing business. Working six days a week and ten hours each day, he earns about Le 1,440,000 every month. Abdul is now requesting a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy jeans, shirts, and t-shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 288,000, and in the future he plans to further grow his business, build a house and educate his children. Abdul thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing for the business

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo, de 41 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa  Antonia de 41 años y sus 3 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que Mateo se dedica, es el cultivo de arveja y papa, productos que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado cultivar, los cuales después de la cosecha llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta labor depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Mateo is 41 years old, a happy, hard-working man.  He lives in his own home with his wife Antonia (41 years old) and their 3 small children.  He wishes to offer these children a better quality of life.  Mateo grows peas and potatoes, and he has worked hard to do so.  After harvesting, he takes them to sell in Tarma’s wholesale market.  What he likes most is to plant crops, for he knows that his family’s well-being depends on it.  He has been a farmer for 23 years, and finds that the hardest part is to protect his crops from abrupt changes in weather, for this strongly affects his productivity.  In the future, he wishes to continue his hard work and improve his plantings.  This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he knows that the support will be advantageous in helping him grow his business.  He is a responsible member of his communal bank, for which reason he is highly respected.  With the thousand new soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar de 43 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Norma sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su producción. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: 42 year old Norma is a happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her 43 year old husband Cesar and her 4 dear children, to whom she wishes to provide a better future. Early mornings every day, Norma starts working her fields; for her there are no days of rest, because she must work continuously to obtain a good crop. Her main products are potatoes and peas, which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. What she likes most about her job is the freedom she gets from working on her crops, as she can freely enjoy her green fields. She has been doing this activity for 20 years and considers that the hardest thing is protecting her crops from the plagues of insects that may damage her production. For the future she wishes to buy more land, to increase production. This is the first MFP credit and she hopes to be very punctual in her payments. In her communal bank she is liked by the rest of her colleagues because she is so happy. With the one thousand new soles she is requesting, she will buy more fertilizer for her crops.
