loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to enjoy better production

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
el señor Modesto Q. tiene 66 años de edad es padre de 4 hijos, sus hijos le ayudan a la pesca y colaboran con los gastos de la casa. don Modesto es una persona trabajadora que se esfuerza todo los dias por salir adelante, su trabajo consiste en comprar mariscos como ser pescado blanco, rojo y camarones. Sus ventas las realiza de casa en casa y en el mercado de Nacaome. 
 
Modesto vive en la comunidad de Agua Fria desde hace 18 años en donde a podido hacer su hogar junto a su esposa la señora Teodora Gutierrez.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mariscos y asi tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Modesto Q. is 66 years old and he is the father of 4 children. His children help him fish and they contribute to the household expenses. Modesto is a hardworking person and he struggles every day to come out ahead. His work consists of purchasing seafood such as fishes and shrimp. He carries out his sales by traveling from door to door, and he also sells in Nacaome market. 

Modesto has lived in the community of Agua Fria for the past 18 years and he has forged a home together with his wife, Teodora Gutierrez. 

The loan will be used to purchase more seafood to improve his earnings. He depends on this income to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sabina Ignacia

texts.es: Sabina es una mujer multifacética se dedica  a la elaboración y comercialización de queso, además se dedica  a la ganadería también  labora para el gobierno local como operaria de mantenimiento, tiene 3 hijos jóvenes a quienes ayuda en sus estudios, su sueño es comprarse una casa en la zona de Chosica y a seguir ayudando a sus hijos, como buena hija tiene a su cargo a sus padres ancianos. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara alimento concentrado para sus animales, sabina desea en algún momento tener capital para iniciar un negocio nuevo que le permita estar en casa como una bodega propia.
texts.en: Sabina is a woman of many talents. She makes and sells cheese, she is a cattle farmer, and she also works as a maintenance operator for the municipal government. She has 3 young children that she supports as they go to school. And as a good daughter she cares for her elderly parents. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase concentrated feed for her livestock. Sabina wishes to accumulate enough capital funds to start up a new business. She wants to have a business that she will be able to run while she’s at home, such as a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase concentrated feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Guadalupe Antia

texts.es:
Guadalupe Antia tiene 36 anos. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. 
Ella es una persona muy responsable. Guadalupe tiene su negocio que es la venta de tortillas y comida donde vende arroz, fideos, pollos, carnes y jugos. Hace las compras de sus productos en el mercado en donde compra lo necesario y lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Solicita el crédito para aumentar en una gran variedad de platillos  que ofrece en su vivienda. Su sueño es tener una restaurante bien grande y estable, y que a todos sus hijos estudien. Su mayor desafío es que a veces la gente paga por crédito y nunca le pagan su dinero pero esto no la desanima pues buaca la forma de mejorar cada dia.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antia is 36 years old. She has two young children. She is a very responsible person. Guadalupe has a catering business where she makes and sells tortillas and sells food items such as rice, pastas, chicken, meats and fresh juices. She makes her purchases for everything that she needs in the market, making sure to acquire whatever her clients request. Her dream is to have a large and well-established restaurant, and she also dreams of seeing all of her children in school. She faces her greatest challenge when sales on credit are not honored, but she doesn’t get discouraged with this. Every day she looks for ways to improve.

loans.use: Workind capital.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 32 años y sus queridos hijos Roger de 6 y Kevin de 1 año, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Silvia es el cultivo de arvejas, maíz y papas, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Silvia, thirty-three, is a very unassuming and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Alberto, thirty-two; and their two beloved children, Roger, six, and Kevin, 1, the primary reason for all of their efforts.  Silvia grows peas, corn, and potatoes.  She works with her husband, who also works arduously to bring in income for the family.  Silvia finds it convenient to bring her products to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, since, as she says, it's there that best profits can be made.

What Silvia likes best about her work is protecting the crops from insect infestations that can threaten productivity.  She's been in business for eight years and thinks that the hardest part is transporting the products because the trip is long and exhausting.  In time she hopes to purchase some new land to grow more crops, and increase her income with the sales.  This will be her second loan with MFP, and she feels an obligation to make all of her payments on time; she doesn't want to cause any trouble for the members of her village bank, where she is very well-loved.  With the seven-hundred soles she is seeking, Silvia will buy more fertilizer to improve productivity.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertlizer.

loans.name: Jesus The Bread Of Life Group

texts.es:
Zunilda participa más de tres años en la alcancía comunal Jesús Pan de Vida, en este grupo sus nueve integrantes se esfuerzas en sus negocios con la finalidad de brindarles los mejor a su familia y alcanzar sus objetivos. Ella nos cuenta que no tuvo el apoyo de sus padres en darle una carrera corta debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia; pudo alcanzar su sueño de ser profesional a través del apoyo de su esposo quien al principio no estaba de acuerdo con esta idea; fue él quien después le compró la máQ. de coser que necesitaba su esposa. Es así que empezó a confeccionar faldas, pantalones, blusas los cuales ofrecía a sus amigas ests prendas; además de su servicio como confeccionista; es así que a través de sus amistades, vecinos y conocidos fue teniendo más trabajos; pero le faltaba el capital para comprar mercadería de tela a fin de cumplir con el pedido de uniformes a un jardín para niños, aquí es donde vio la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de EDAPROSPO –PROSPERIDAD. A través de una conocida tuvo la oportunidad de los modelos para una línea de ropa que eran vendidos en un supermercado conocido años atrás. Confecionó además treinta vestidos para novias la mayoría eran jovencitas que radican en la zona de Zunilda.
Tenía pedidos de uniformes para los docentes, buzos para alumnos.
Los ingresos que tuvo le ayudaron mucho para asumir los gastos familiares junto a su esposo incluso cuando éste no contaba con trabajo, porque ganaba más que su pareja. Construyó su casa, apoyó en la educación a sus tres hijos quienes son profesionales. Actualmente los ingresos han minorado para Zunilda debido a la competencia cercana de un mercado cerca donde también ofrece este tipo de servicio; a pesar de ello cuenta con clientela fija.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en confeccionar polos a niños de un colegio particular quien está próximo a su aniversario.
texts.en:
Zunilda has been a member of the community bank named Jesus Pan de Vida for more than three years. There are nine members in this group and each member works hard with the goal of providing the best for their family and to reach their objectives. Zunilda was not give the support she needed from her parents to have a career given their humble financial situation. 

She was able to reach her dream of having a professional career through her husband’s support, though at first he was not in agreement with the idea.  But it was he that purchased the sewing machine that his wife needed. This is how she started making skirts, slacks, and blouses that she later sold to her friends. She also provided sewing services. It was through her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances that she started to receive more orders. But she lacked the capital funds to purchase the products and fabric that she needed to fill the order of school uniforms she received.  She approached Edaprospo Prosperidad (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan. 

A friend of hers gave her the opportunity to access patterns for a line of clothing that was sold at the supermarket years back. She made up more than thirty wedding dresses. Most of the brides that approached her were young women in the neighborhood. 

She received orders for uniforms for teachers and for students. The income that she earned helped a great deal to contribute to the family’s expenses, helping her husband especially when he was out of work. She earned more than her partner. She built her own house and she sent all of her three children to school and they have careers now. 

Zunilda has seen a drop in her earnings given the competition in a nearby market where they offer the same type of services. However, she does count with a steady client base. 

The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of materials to make polo shirts for a private school for their anniversary celebrations.

loans.use: To make polo shirts for kids.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El Sr, L. Sairitupac Alejandro es de estado civil soltero, no tiene carga familiar, vive con sus padres y hermanos con los cuales comparte los gastos. 
Trabaja como obrero en el campo y además tiene una mototaxi la cual alquila y así recibe otro ingreso. 
Solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento y arreglos de su mototaxi. Su meta es poder adquirir otra moto y asi poder tener mas adelante una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. L. Sairitupac Alejandro is single and he doesn't have children. He lives with his parents and with his siblings. They all share the household expenses. 

He works as a laborer in the fields and he also owns a rickshaw that he rents out as an additional source of income. 

He requests a loan to provide his rickshaw with maintenance repairs. His goal is to acquire another motorcycle rickshaw and to save enough money for a house of his own.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Leonzo J. P. tiene 52 años de edad, es padre de cuatro hijos y se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
sus ventas las realiza en Nacaome y Agua Fria en su bicicleta, coloca un termo en la parte de atras y ahi lleva el producto y cuando viaja a nacaome las ventas las realiza en bus ya que esta bien largo de donde el vive.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado blanco, rojo y camarones con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose Leonzo J. P. is 52 years old and he is the father of four children. He sells fish and shrimp and he has had 8 years' experience in the field. 

He carries out his sales in Nacaome and in Agua Fria, travelling on his bicycle. He places a thermos on the rear part of the bicycle to transport the product to Nacaome. He also uses the bus to complete his sales because he lives very far away.

The loan will be used to purchase fishes and shrimp with the goal of increasing his income.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es:
Anne participa hace cuatro meses en L. alcancía comunal Virgen D. L. Puerta, sus integrantes son personas responsable y muy trabajadores cada uno en su propio negocio. Anne quienes viajó a Lima con L. idea D. apoyar a su sobrina quien tenía un pequeño negocio, al ver el empeño que daba a su trabajo Anne su sobrina solicitó un crédito a fin que su tía empiece a trabajar D. manera independiente con ello compró productos plásticos como: bolsas, cubiertos descartables, vasos y platos, su negocio fue creciendo poco a poco; cada vez tenía más compradores, y era necesario un capital mayor a lo que tenía es así que se hizo un préstamo D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD para alquilar un puesto comprar baldes, recogedores, vasos descartables u otros. A pesar que no tiene hijos Anne apoya a sus hermanas en los gastos del hogar, comparte los gastos. ElL. tía abueL. D. una niña D. doce años a quien L. quiere como si fuese su propia hija, le ayuda en L. educación D. ésta pequeña.
El crédito que necesita lo invertirá en bolsas, platos, tapers,
texts.en:
Anne has been a member of the “Virgen D. L. Puerta” (Our Lady of the Door) communal bank.  Its members are responsible people, each with his or her own business.  

Anne moved to Lima to help out her niece who has a small business.  When her niece saw how hard Anne worked she decided to take out a loan so that her aunt could start to work independently.  With that, she bought plastic items like: bags, disposable dinnerware, drinking glasses and plates.  Her business gradually grew and her number of customers increased daily.

She needed an infusion of capital so she took out a loan with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD to lease a locale, buy buckets, dustpans, disposable drinking glasses and other items.

Despite not having children of her own, Anne helps her sisters meet household expenses; she shares expenses. She has a twelve year old grandniece that she loves as if she were her own and she helps with this young girl’s educational expenses.

She will use the loan to buy bags, dishes and plastic containers.

loans.use: To buy bags, plates and disposable plastic containers.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza W. is a petty businesswoman. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells kitchen utensils like spoons and knives, and also sells provisions like drinks, milk, soap, spaghetti, tinned tomatoes, etc. Adiza will use the loan she will take to buy more of the things she sells to stock her shop and thus expand her business. She will then use the profits she gets from her business to further her children’s education and also to help her husband to pay the utility bills for the home.

loans.use: buy more of the things she sells to stock her shop

loans.name: Jaratu

texts.en: Jaratu E. is a petty trader. She is married and has three kids. Her husband is a plumber. Jaratu sells dried maize at Nyinasi near Abura. She buys the maize from the farmer and then dries it before she sells to her customers. She will use the loan she will take to buy more of the maize she dries to sell. Jaratu will then use the profit she gets from the business to further her children’s education and also help her husband to cater for her family.

loans.use: buy more maize she dries for resale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima M. sells 'banku' at Nyinasi near Abura. She is married and has nine children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells 'banku' and okra stew, which she prepares by soaking corn in water and then milling it together with cassava. She uses that in preparing her 'banku' for sale. She will use the loan to buy more corn and cassava to mill for preparing her 'banku', and also buy more vegetables and spices to cook her stew.

Fatima will use the profits she gets to further her children’s education and also for the upkeep of her home. She will also use the rest of the profits to add to her capital for continuing her cooked food business.

loans.use: buy more corn and cassava to mill for preparing 'banku' and also more vegetables and spices to cook her stew

loans.name: Lafisatu

texts.en: Lafisatu S. is a petty trader. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She sells 'kenkey' (fermented corn dough), which she prepares with milled corn which she cooks and wraps in leaves for sale. She will use the loan she takes to add to her capital to buy more corn to prepare her 'kenkey' for sale. She will use her profits to cater for her five children and further their education.

loans.use: add to her capital to buy more corn to prepare  'kenkey'

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora L. es una persona de bajos recursos, por motivos de dinero ella solo alcanzo a estudiado hasta 2º de secundaria, ya que tuvo que dedicarse al trabajo desde muy temprana edad, actualmente es soltera debido a un fracaso conyugal, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son independientes(mayores de edad), y uno de ellos aún depende de la señora Teodora.    

La señora se dedica a la producción de pan y a la atención de una tiendita de barrio que esta ubicada en la casa de una de sus hijas, con el dinero que genera mantiene su hogar y hace estudiar a su hijo de 8 años. 

La señora necesita  $us. 1200.- para poder sutir su tienda y asi mejorar su situación economica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teodora L. is a person of few means. She was only able to study through the second grade because she could not afford it and had to work starting at a very young age. She is single following a failed marriage. She has three children, two of whom are grown and one still depends on Ms. Teodora. 

She makes bread and tends a small neighborhood store that is located in the house of one of her daughters. She uses the money the store generates to maintain her home and put her 8 year old son through school. 

She needs $1200 to be able to stock the store and this way, improve her and her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is a trader. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She sells foodstuffs, mainly cassava, and also sells bathroom slippers. She will use the loan she will take out to further expand her business by buying more slippers for sale. She will later use the profit she will acquire from her business to cater for her kids and also help her husband to pay the utility bills and other family expenses.

loans.use: further expand her business by buying more slippers for sale

loans.name: Rebozo De Mujer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  se llama “Rebozo D. Mujer “, porque dentro D. la comunidad se elaboran rebozos y son mujeres las que los hacen, este grupo está ubicado en Tenancingo estado D. México este grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.
La señora Julia S. es casada, tiene  una hija y  seis varones, en la actualidad ella vive con cuatro hijos en su domicilio, uno D. sus hijos es profesor y el otro está radicando en Estados Unidos  D. Norte América.

La señora Julia es originaria D. Tenancingo, quiere su crédito para invertir en una miscelánea que tiene aproximadamente catorce años, lo que ella pretenD. es darle crecimiento a su negocio, comprando más productos dado que la comunidad está alejada D. la cabecera municipal y la gente requiere variedad D. mercancías, D. esta forma ayuda a la gente ofertando los productos y su familia pueD. tener un sustento diario.
texts.en:
This group is called “Rebozo D. Mujer” (Woman’s Shawl) because shawls are manufactured in this community and it’s the women who make them.  The group is located in Tenancingo in the state of México and it has 10 members.

Julia S. is married.  She has a daughter and six sons.  She is currently living with four of her children in her home.  One of her sons is a teacher and the other lives in the United States.

Julia is from Tenancingo.  She wants a loan to invest in the general store she’s had for about fourteen years.  What she pretends to do is expand her business buying more products since her community is far from the area's main town and people need a variety of merchandise.  This way she both helps people by offering them the products and her family can have daily support.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina I. sells 'banku' and maize. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a farmer. Amina sells 'banku' which she prepares by soaking corn in water and then milling it to prepare the 'banku'. She also dries some of the maize for sale. She will use the loan to buy more maize to expand her business. Amina will then use the profit she will get to increase her capital for her business.

loans.use: buy more maize to expand her business

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: kokouvi est un jeune célibataire, il a ouvert en 2007 un bar qu'il a appelé "ALMAX", ce bar fonctionne bien et lui procure de bonnes recettes. son bar est très animé les soirs. les fêtes de fin d'année étant proches, il voudrait mettre les atouts de son côté et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des casiers de boissons et divers
texts.en: Kokouvi is a young unmarried man.  He opened a bar in 2007 that he calls "ALMAX".  It is doing well and brings in a good income.  His bar is very busy in the evenings.  Because the year-end holidays will soon be here, he would like to put his best foot forward.  So he is requesting a loan from WAGES that will be used to buy cases of beverages and miscellaneous items.

loans.use: Buying cases of beverages

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor Jose R. A. ha estudiado solo hasta el nivel primario, ha trabajado desde muy pequeño, actualmente tiene dos hijos, pero ambos hijos no viven con él, debido a que tienen familia y son independientes.   

Él vive solo, su trabajo es lo único que tiene, el señor Jose trabaja de guardia de seguridad, de la cual percibe ingresos de $us.257/mes. Adicianalmente a eso en su tiempo libre se dedica a dar servicios de taxi, de las cuales percibe ingresos de $us.200.-/mes.  

Recientemente el motor de su vehiculo, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo, se encuentra dañado y no puede trabajar, el señor Jose necesita $us 1200.- para poder reparar su vehiculo y asi poder trabajar de forma normal.
texts.en:
Mr. José R. A. only finished primary school.  He has worked since he was little.  He has two children but both have their own families and live independently.

He lives alone.  His work is all he has.  He’s employed as a security guard with a monthly salary of $257 dollars.  In addition to this job, he provides taxi services in his spA. time which produces an additional $200 dollars per month.

Recently, the motor of his vehicle, which is his work tool, broke down and he can’t work.  José needs $1200 dollars to repair his vehicle to be able to work normally.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Delali Ablavi

texts.fr: delali est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adakpamé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce depuis plus de 6 ans le commerce des articles de mercerie. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. la période des fêtes de fin d'année étant proche, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se préparer à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons de tissus, 3 boîtes de fils et divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en: Delali is a married woman and the mother of two children.  She lives with her family in the Adakpamé district, on the outskirts of Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She has been in the sewing supplies business for over six years.  Her customer base would include anyone.  The year-end holidays will soon be here.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES to get ready to meet customer demands.  The loan is for buying 5 boxes of cloth, 3 containers of thread, and sundry items for sewing.

loans.use: Buying sewing supplies

loans.name: Ayi

texts.fr: ayi est un homme très dynamique, il a appris la couture. en 1996 il a ouvert son propre atelier de couture, il est marié et c'est grâce à cette activité qu'il subvient aux charges de son ménage. pour accroître son revenu, il confectionne des habits à partir des tissus qu'il achète et les revend à sa clientèle. la demande actuelle est élevée, il veut satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de tissus de diverses qualités. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en: Ayi is an active man and he learned to be a taylor. In 1996 he opened his own tailoring shop. He is married and thanks to this business he is able to cover the household expenses. In order to improve his revenues he makes clothing from fabrics he purchases and then resells the products to his clientele. He has seen a rise in demand and he would like to fill his clients' requests. He requests a loan from WAGES (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase various kinds of fabrics. His clientele is made up of all types of people.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: El Bonete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Bonete, porque sobre la calle donD. se ubica el grupo  había un árbol D. bonetes  (es una  fruta  D. la región), así  es como la gente la identifica a esta comunidad, se encuentra cerca D. la zona arqueológica D. Xochicalco, en el Estado D. MoreL. en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.

La Sra. Juana Martínez es integrante del grupo,  Juani es como le gusta que la llamen,  tiene 56 años, vive sola, no tiene estudios, es costurera, tiene un total D. 8 hijas la mayor tiene 39 años y la menor 21 todas ellas ya están casadas. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta D. mandiles, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, venD. sus mandiles en la comunidad indígena  D. xoxocotla donD. la mayoría D. las mujeres utilizan esta prenda, solicita su préstamo para comprar telas e hiL. para la elaboración D. L. mandiles, la Sra. Juana se siente contenta ya que con L. prestamos ha podido tener su propio negocio, quiere este préstamo para incrementar la producción D. su negocio,  obtener mayores ganancias , comprar  otra  máquina D. coser, y montar un taller D. costura  para  poder darles trabajo a sus hijas.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Bonete” because there is a “bonete” (a regional fruit similar to a papaya) tree on the street where the group is located.  This is how people identify the community.  It is close to Xochicalco’s archaeological zone in the state of MoreL. in Mexico.  The group is comprised of ten members.

Juana Martínez is a member of the group.  Juani, as she likes to be called, is 56 years old, and she lives alone.  She does not have an education.  She is a seamstres, and she has eight daughters.  The oldest is 39 years old, and the youngest is 21 years old.  They are all married.  

She started her business of making aprons two years ago.  She sells her aprons to the indigenous community in Xoxocotla.  Most of the women there use this garment.  

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread to make the aprons.  Juana is very pleased because she has been able to have her own business through the loans.  She wants to use this loan to increase production in her business and get greater income.  She will buy another sewing machine and start up a sewing shop in order to give her daughters work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and invest in her business

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme de 33 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il fait la vente de maïs, il procède en remplissant des bidons jaunes de maïs, ainsi la marchandise est plus facile à déplacer. il fait ce commerce depuis 2007. il s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de Notsè. actuellement il fait face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un  crédit qui est son premier crédit pour acheter une vingtaine de sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a 33 year old man, he is married and he is the father of 3 children. He sells corn. He fills yellow containers full of corn to facilitate transportation of his product. He has had the business since 2007. He makes his purchases in the interior of the country, in the city of Notse. He has currently sold out his stock and he requests a loan to purchase more. This is his first loan and he will use it to purchase twenty sacks of corn.


kodjo est un homme de 33 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il fait la vente de maïs, il procède en remplissant des bidons jaunes de maïs, ainsi la marchandise est plus facile à déplacer. il fait ce commerce depuis 2007. il s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de Notsè. actuellement il fait face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un  crédit qui est son premier crédit pour acheter une vingtaine de sacs de maïs.

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia Maria tiene 68 años, su actividad es la venta de tortilla en su casa de habitación desde.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues las experiencias que ha obtenido han sido muy importantes para continuar con su negocio. Lo inicio hace más 32 años y adquiriendo buenas relaciones pues ha conocido muchas personas que la han ayudado pues la calidad de sus tortillas es la mejor. Este crédito es para la compra de  maíz, comal, cal bolsas leña.
texts.en:
Elia María, 68, sells home-made tortillas.  This isn’t her first loan because past experiences have been very important for her to be able to stay in business.

She started it over 32 years ago and has established good relationships because she has gotten to know a lot of people who have helped her because the quality of her tortillas is the best.

The loan is to buy corn, a griddle, lime powder, bags and firewood.

loans.use: To buy corn, a griddle, lime powder, bags and firewood.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un proprietaire de bar qu'il a ouvert en 2006 et appelé "bar le catimini". il anime son bar tous les vendredi, samédi et dimanche soir. ainsi il maximise ses recettes. il s'approvisionne en boissons auprès de la brasserie de Lomé. actuellement il veut augmenter le stock de boissons. il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour le'achat de 34 casiers de boissons et divers choses pour animer son bar. il est marié et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en: Kodjo opened his pub in 2006 and named it "Bar le Catimini".  He has live entertainement every Friday, Saturday and Sunday night. He also uses his recipes. He purchases drinks from the brewery in Lome. He would like to increase his inventory of drinks. He requests a first time loan from WAGES (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase 34 cartons of drinks and other various items to supply his pub. He is married and he is the father of 2 children.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of drinks.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme marié et père de 4 enfants. il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'ablogamé, l'activité qu'il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de  boissons locales alcoolisées appelées SODABI. il fait ce commerce depuis 1995 et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la localité de KOUVE. il veut s'approvisionner en sodabi, il sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 27 bidons de sodabi et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a married man and father of four children. He lives with his family in the district of Ablogamé. 

To provide for his family, he makes a living by selling the local alcoholic beverage called SODABI. 
He has been in this business since 1995 and buys his stocks inland, in the town of KOUVE. 

Kodjo wants to stock up on Sodabi. He is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 27 cans of Sodabi and pay for shipment.

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 & 6 Group

texts.es:
Flor es una D. los miembros del grupo El Sol Sale para Todos 4 y 6, ellos son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, ventas D. comida, etc; en la ciudad D. Hato Mayo una D. las ciudades mas rurales del pais, cuya economia depenD. D. la agricultura. Está asociada D. Esperanza es madre D. cinco hijos, casada, e inicio su negocio con el primer prestamo recibido D. Esperanza y actualmente llega 6 años y esta recibiendo su septimo prestamo, en cada uno ha realizado sus pagos satisfactoriamente y ha realizado buenas inversiones. Ella actualmente esta operando un pica pollo (pequeño restaurante D. pollos fritos)

Flor está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. Pollo, platanos, papas, harina, refrescos, etc. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para construir el techo D. su casa en concreto pagar sus gastos publicos e ir ahorrando con la finalidad D. poder terminar D. construir su vivienda. Su actividad favorita es ir a la iglesia y su reto primordial es cuidar a sus nietos, los cuales viven con ella
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the “El Sol Sale Para Todos 4 y 6” (The Sun Rises for Everyone 4 & 6).  They are micro businesspeople in clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoes, teachers, food sales, etc. in the city of Hato Mayo, one of the most rural cities in the country whose economy depends on agriculture.

This associate of Esperanza is a mother of five children.  She’s married and started her business with the first loan she got from Esperanza.  She is now in her sixth year and receiving her 7th loan.  Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has maD. good investments.

She is currently operating a “pica pollo” (small fried chicken restaurant).  She is planning to use the new loan to buy chicken, bananas, potatoes, flour, refreshments, etc.

She will use profits to install a concrete roof on her house, to pay public utilities and to save some in order to finish building her house.

Her favorite pastime is going to church and her primary challenge is caring for her grandchildren who live with her.

loans.use: For chicken, bananas, potatoes, flour, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Kevin Arturo

texts.es: El señor M. F. kevin Arturo, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, con direccion Av. Los Tunos 1137 La Tinguiña, casa de material noble de una planta. Se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte, en vehiculo alquilado por su madre, se dedica a este rubro hace mas de un año.El señor tiene metas  trazadas y obejetivos, en futuro quiere tener su propio auto tico, con el credito piensa invertir en sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Sr. Kevin Arturo M. F., 22, is single and lives with his parents at Av. Los Tunos 1137 La Tinguina, in a well-constructed, one-story house.  He makes a living driving a cab, in a vehicle that he rents from his mother.  He has been working as a driver for a year.  Sr. Kevin has well-defined goals in mind.  He wants to own his own Daewoo Tico.  He will use the loan to pay personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Adriana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Adriana C. B. tiene 30 años y es una ingeniera industrial con una microempresa llamada   “Marroquinería Alusso” que nació como su gran sueño de ser empresaria hace ya 6 años.  Aunque Adriana desarrolló su infraestructura hace apenas 1 año, ha ido creciendo con paso firme y ahora tiene como meta de posicionarse en el mercado local y a futuro en el mercado nacional, trabajando firmemente para lograrlo. Su unidad de negocio, cuenta con tres trabajadores, de los cuales dos son de planta y está  ubicado  en el barrio los Robles, sector cuya nomenclatura es de Barranquilla, pero técnicamente  pertenece al municipio de soledad.

 En la actualidad su credikiva es el primero que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo va a dirigir a la  compra de  sus materias primas en mayor volumen como sintético, cuero y accesorios, que adornaran sus finos diseños en esta época festiva de fin de año. Adriana planea en seis meses, posicionarse  en el mercado local y es que su gran desafío es lo competitivo de este segmento, pero como sus diseños son a la medida del cliente, aspira a repuntar sus ventas aprovechando el fin de años que se acerca y donde mas dinero circulante hay en el mercado. 
  
Adriana es una joven mujer muy emprendedora y como ingeniera industrial desde que comenzó su carrera, se enfocó en el empresarismo, por eso de antemano sabia que seria una empresaria y justamente inició con su sueño, pues se considera a si misma como una diseñadora empírica y amante del buen gusto  y  de los accesorios femeninos. En su trabajo se destaca en la elaboración de  bolsos y  gradualmente incursionará en la fabricación de calzado,  tomado de referencia la experiencia de sus padres y otros familiares, que han trabajado en estos oficios, por eso piensa que su aptitud dirigida hacia estas actividades será en un  futuro no muy lejano su gran éxito. Adriana es una mujer soñadora y delicada que produce naturalmente diseños muy exclusivos y de mucha  calidad, pues tiene el propósito de penetrar en el mercado nacional, tal como soñaron alguna vez sus padres y con ello pondrá en marcha el sueño de ellos,  que también es su propio  sueño
texts.en:
Adriana C. B., 30, is an industrial engineer with a microbusiness called Alusso Leather.  Owning her own business has been a dream for Adriana since she was 6 years old.  Although she only set up the business a year or so ago, it has grown steadily.  She wants to position the business in the local market first and then the national market, a goal that she is working hard to achieve.  Adriana has three employees, two of whom are full time.  The business is located in the Robles neighborhood which implies that it is in Barranquilla but, technically, it is a separate municipality. 

This is Adriana's first loan from Kiva, a loan she hopes to get from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of synthetic materials, leather and the accessories that dress her beautiful designs. She will use the supplies to make products for the upcoming holiday season.  Adriana plans to position herself in the local market within six months, a real challenge because she faces a lot of competition.  However, her designs are attractive to buyers and she expects her sales to take off over the coming holidays.  
  
Adriana is an entrepreneurial young woman and focused on building her business.  She has always known that she wanted to be an entrepreneur and now she's fulfilling her dream.  She chose to focus on accessories for women because she is a designer at heart and a lover of beautiful things.  She started by making bags and gradually added footwear, taking advantage of the experience of her parents and other members of her family who could show her the way.  She has skill and she believes that will help her make a success of the business quickly.  Adriana is committed to making high-quality products because she ultimately wants to establish a position in the national market.  That's a dream not only for her, but for her parents, as well.

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: La Sra. Araceli tiene 39 años de edad, ella es conviviente , no cuenta con carga familiar. Tiene casa propia de material  noble semi construida  aun sin acabados, ella esta construyendo poco a poco despues del terremoto. Ella y su conyugue se dedican a la elaboracion de artesania  y vente de bebidas en su domicilio, ellos se dedican a este nogocio hace 10 años. Como toda unidad familiar tienen sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder terminar de contruir su vivienda. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Sra. Araceli, 39, is partnered, with no pressing family obligations.  She owns her own house, a well-constructed semi that is not quite finished.  She has been building it little by little since the earthquake.  She and her partner operate a business making products for sale and selling cold drinks from their house.  They have operated the business for 10 years. Like all families, they have dreams and goals, one of which is to finish building the house.  Sra. Araceli will use this loan for working capital.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Maria tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio, la experiencia ha sido muy agradable. Las ganas de sobrevivir y mantener a su familia es lo que hacen que Lesbia se levante muy temprano, para atender a sus clientes.  A pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa como es la competencia que existe pero no todas ofrecen el mejor servicio que ella proporciona. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes  y pan. Ella sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida para proporcionarles lo necesario.
texts.en: Sra. Lesbia Maria owns a corner shop that she operates from her house.  This isn't the first time that she has borrowed money for her business and she likes the benefits of borrowing.  Her need to support her family is the reason that Lesbia gets up every day to tend to her customers.  Despite the challenges she faces, she perseveres, and even though there is a lot of competition in the market, she has succeeded by providing excellent service to her customers.  She will use this loan to buy snacks, cold drinks, detergents and bread.  Her greatest hope is for a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara M. is part of the communal bank “Mapuamelen” and resides in the commune of Penco.  For the past five years, Sara has run a kiosk of confections, baked goods, soft drinks, and ice cream from her house, a temporary shack provided by the government as her house was lost during the earthquake of February 27, 2010. Sara also lost all of her inventory and two display cases. Fortunately, Sara has been approved to receive a subsidy house on her property, which she will obtain in January 2011.  Sara’s husband of 30 years is handicapped, due to an injury he received while working as a fisherman. He helps her attend to her business as they work seven days a week from 7 am to 1 am.  Sara and her husband chose these hours to take advantage of sales, as the other business in the areas close at 10 pm and open much later in the day.

With this loan, Sara will purchase merchandise.  She plans on adding to her business by offering milk products.  Sara is grateful for the economic support provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, as she has been able to expand her business. Sara is also appreciative of the lessons of “your business,” as it is now easier for her to close her accounts. Sara values the time she spends in the weekly group meetings as they have helped her be more social. 

Penco is a commune located close to the city of Concepción in southern Chile, the Bíobío Region. Its name derives from Mapudungun and means “Water of Peumo" (type of tree). It is one of the districts with the highest number of inhabitants in the region.  It is know for its industrial center and port.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Karina Janeth

texts.es: la Sra. Karina  tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hija de 4 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, vive en la casa de su madre ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, casa de  material noble de un piso. La Sra. Karina se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y como ayudante de la venta de pollo en el mercado modelo, ella se dedica a  este negocio hace 3 años, se inicio ayudando a vender productos de belleza. La Sra. Karina es una persona joven con muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propio negocio, con el dienro que solicita sera para el incremento de su inventario.
texts.en: Sra. Karina, 25, has 1 daughter who is 4 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her mother in a well-constructed house in Tinguina.  Sra. Karina makes a living selling beauty products and working as a helper in a market stall at the Model Market.  She has operated her business for 3 years working, at first, as an assistant selling beauty products.  Sra. Karina is a young women with many dreams and goals, one of which is to own her own business.  She will use the loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: El incremento de su inventario

loans.name: La Peñita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la Peñita porque la comunidad en donde viven las integrantes está rodeada de peñas, todas las mujeres de este grupo se conocen entre sí, son amigas desde hace mucho tiempo, decidieron formar el grupo. 
La señora Justina García se dedica la elaboración de zapatos, trabajando en equipo con su familia. Ella con el señor Fortunato Gómez Escalona y con uno de sus hijos, hacen: botines, bota de cierre, bota de escaramuza (jalisca), mocasín, choclo y botín con suela de tractor, venden al mayoreo y menudeo. El proceso de elaboración consta de los siguientes pasos: compra de materia prima, cortar la piel, coser, montar, acabado y diseño.  La señora Justina se dedica a los dos últimos, a hacer los acabados y el diseño de los zapatos.

El negocio se ha transmitido de generación en generación a través de la familia del señor Fortunato, es la tercera generación que se ha dedicado al negocio. Gracias al negocio sus hijos son profesionistas y uno de ellos piensa continuar con el negocio familiar, y en un futuro llegar a exportar sus productos.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Peñita” (The Little Cliff) because the community where the members live is surrounded by cliffs.  All the women in the group know each other; they have been friends for a long time and decided to form the group.

Mrs. Justina García manufactures shoes.  She and her family work as a team.  She and Mr. Fortunato Gómez Escalona with one of their children make ankle boots, laced boots, riding boots, moccasins, slippers and ankle boots with rubber tire soles.  They are both wholesalers and retailers.  The manufacturing process consists in the following steps: purchase raw materials, cut the leather, sew, assemble, finish and design.  Justina does the last two of these steps: she makes the finishings and the designs on the shoes.

The business has been passed down from generation to generation through Fortunato’s family.  This is the third generation in the business.  Thanks to the business their children are professionals and one of them plans to continue with the family business and in the future even export their products.

loans.use: To invest in the family shoemaking business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: la Sra. Maria del Carmen  tiene 31  años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores D. edad. Ella es separada vive en la casa D. su madre, casa D. material noble D. un piso. La Sra. Maria del Carmen se dedica  a la venta D. pasteles y queques, ella se dedica a este negocio hace 5 años, se inicio como ayudante, la clienta cuenta con pedidos D. colegios para la elaboracion D. sus productos. La Sra. Maria del Carmen como toda persona cuenta con sueños y objetivos aun que cumplir, su deseo es poder crecer en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra D. mas insumos y activo fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 31, has two adult children.  She is separated and lives in her mother’s house, a one story house maD. from substantial materials.

She sells cakes.  She has been in this business for five years.  She started out as an assistant.  She has standing orders from schools for her products.

María del Carmen, just like everyone, has dreams and objectives to reach.  Her wish is to make her business grow.

She will use the requested funds to buy more ingredients and supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy cake making ingredients.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is part of the communal bank “Girasol” and resides in the city of Linares. Andrea has dedicated her livelihood to the production and sales of baking products. Andrea uses a small cart and distributes her products. She has two local store owners as frequent clients and schools near her home. Andrea also takes pre-orders for clients, baking tarts and cakes. 

Andrea has managed this business for the last two years. Prior to that, Andrea would sell used clothing. She stopped those sales and decided to dedicate 100% of her time to baking as she noticed sales were better. Andrea relies on her husband’s help. He’s a night shift security guard and he mostly does the frying for the doughnuts. 

With this loan, Andrea will purchase materials for her business, such as sugar, oil, wheat and chocolate, and a rustic fireplace to cook their products.  Andrea’s goal is to one day own a kiosk or an established sales car where she can sell all of the elaborate products she produces. Andrea is a mother of three: a 13, 7 and a 2 year old.

Andrea has valued the economic support Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza provides and also the support and orientation on how to administer a business provided in part by her loan officer during the weekly meetings. 

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, which is in the center of Chile and is a vibrant commercial center. Linares has developed as an important export zone, particularly because of its wine production. Despite the fact that the workforce and production has increased, according to the latest census reports, this region remains one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: Baking ingredients

loans.name: Yolanda Maria

texts.es:
Yolanda María S. S. es una mujer de 31 años  muy fuerte y trabajadora, propietaria de un taller de carpintería que nació hace 8 años y  que antes manejara su esposo, pero con su  fallecimiento hace 4,  se viò obligada a sobreponerse y dirigirlo, para continuar manteniendo la obligación de sus dos pequeños hijos de 6 y 10 años. Yolanda en su taller fabrica  multimuebles y closets, que vende en Barranquilla y en  Santa Marta,una  ciudad costera llamada la Perla del Caribe, por sus hermosos playas y paisajes naturales conservados, su espectacular sierra nevada y su protegido parque Tayrona conocido por su amplia gama de vegetación primaria.
Para Yolanda este es su primer credikiva, con el cual va a comprar materias primas como madera, pegantes, clavos, tornillos y accesorios, pues quiere posicionarse en su producto  estrella,  el closets,  aprovechando que éste mercado está creciendo por el auge que en la actualidad tiene el sector de la construcción. Su desafío mayor es mantener liquidez y por eso está recurriendo a los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solucionar este inconveniente productivo y avanzar en el crecimiento de su microempresa, asì más adelante cumplirà su sueño: "que sus hijos, tengan la mejor educación y puedan ser personas exitosas y destacadas en la profesión que escojan".
texts.en:
Yolanda María S. S., 31, is strong and hard working.  She owns a carpentry shop that was born 8 years ago that her husband used to run.  However, with his death four years ago, she was forced to overcome and start to run it herself in order to continue to support her two young, 6 and 10 year old, children.

Yolanda makes multi-use furniture and armoires that she sells in Barranquilla and Santa Marta, a coastal city known as the Pearl of the Caribbean, thanks to its beautiful beaches and conserved natural scenery, its spectacular Sierra Nevada and its protected Tayrona park with its wide range of native flora.

This is Yolanda’s first Kiva loan that she will use to buy raw materials like: wood, adhesives, nails, screws and accessories because she wants to better position herself with her star item, the armoire, now that home construction is booming.

Maintaining cash flow is her greatest challenge and this is why she has been counting on loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to solve this snag in production and continue growing as a small business.  This way she hopes in the future to have her dream come true:  “that her children have the best education and become successful people who stand out in whatever profession they choose.”

loans.use: To buy raw materials like: wood, adhesives, nails, screws and accessories in greater amounts.

loans.name: Koral Group

texts.es:
Las señoras le pusieron “Koral” a su grupo porque ellas se consideran muy especiales, porque comentan que aunque un coral está debajo del agua y se mueve conforme el agua, no se destruye. Así es su amistad, transparente,  firme, hermosa, y así quieren que sea su grupo, el cual se encuentra ubicado en Hidalgo y está formado por 9 integrantes. 
L. Sra. Victoria Hernández es L. presidenta del grupo. Tiene 60 años es una mujer muy emprendedora, entusiasta y trabajadora  elL.  estudio hasta el 6to año D. primaria, es comerciante venD. tortillas hechas a mano y D. comal, el negocio lo inicio hace 14 años. L. señora Victoria solicita su crédito para poner nuevamente L. ampliación D. su negocio como lo tenía antes, dado que por causas D. fuerza mayor ya no pudo seguir teniendo su tortillería, por eso ahora elL. solicita este crédito para L. compra  D. maíz y D. un comal. ElL. sueña con volver a tener L. tortillería que tenía cuando empezó su negocio.
texts.en:
The women called their group “Koral” because they consider themselves to be very special.  They commented that even though coral is found underwater and moves according to the movement of the water, it’s not destroyed.  This is like their friendship: transparent, firm and beautiful and this is how they want their group to be.  It is located in Hidalgo and has 9 members.

Mrs. Victoria Hernández is the group President.  She is 60 years old and a very enterprising, enthusiastic and hard working woman.  She finished 6th graD..  She makes home-maD. tortillas, a business she started 14 years ago.

She is asking for a loan to expand the business to the extent she used to have it.  Due to circumstances beyond her control she was unable to continue with her tortilL. shop which is why she’s now asking for funds to buy corn and a griddle.  She dreams with having a tortilL. shop like back when she started her business.

loans.use: To buy corn and a griddle.

loans.name: Obidio

texts.es: Obidio, de 29 años, es un hombre tímido pero trabajador, convive con María, de 20 años; ambos tienen un hijo; Ángelo de un año y 7 meses de nacido. Los tres viven en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Desde ya algunos años, se dedica al arado de la tierra; actividad que lo aprendió desde muy pequeño, que con ayuda de dos toros puede remover la tierra, lista para poder sembrar, sea papa o arveja. Por otro lado procura siempre mantener muy saludables a sus animales, ya que son su principal herramienta de trabajo. Paralelamente a estas actividades, una manera de generarse ingresos económicos es vender los productos que cosecha, en temporadas muy fructíferas la venta lo realiza dentro de su mismo campo agrícola, así evita hacer gasto de transporte. Su mayor anhelo es construir su propia casa, ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho compartir experiencias con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono, remedio y guano, productos naturales que fortalecerá los cultivos de papa que sembrará.
texts.en:
Obidio, 29, is a shy but hard working man.  He lives with María, 20.  They have a son, Ángelo, who is a year and 7 months old.  The three of them live in his mother’s house in Chiras.

For a few years now he has worked tilling the fields, a task he learned as a little boy.  He has two bulls that help him till the soil leaving it ready for planting either potatoes or peas.

On the other hand, he always strives to keep his animals very healthy because they are his main work tools.  

In order to earn income he also sells the products he harvests.  During very fruitful seasons he makes his sales at his own fields in order to save transportation costs.  

His greatest wish is to build his own house because he wants to provide his family with a better quality of life.

This is his 4th loan with MFP.  He enjoys sharing experiences with his fellow communal bank members.

He will use the requested funds to buy manure, remedy and guano, natural products that will strengthen the potato crops he will plant.

loans.use: To buy manure and guano to strengthen the potato crops.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
la señora Alba Luz H. tiene 42 años de edad,  es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, radica en la aldea El Comercio, tiene 26 años de vivir en dicha aldea en la cual se a desarrollado como comerciante elaborando pan, quesadillas, ojaldras, tustacas.

la señora Alba todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para preparar la venta del dia, como a las 9 de la mañana tiene preparada la venta y sale a vender en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, todo los dias de lunes a domingo.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, maiz, queso, cuajada, dulce rapadura.
 
su sueño es comprarse una casa ya que en la actualidad renta y quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba Luz H., 42, is a single mother with two dependent children.  She settled in the town of El Comercio 26 years ago and set up a business making and selling bread, quesadillas and baked goods.  

Sra. Alba gets up early every day to make the food that she will sell that day.  She finishes making her products by 9:00 so that she can go to the San Lorenzo market to sell what she makes.  She works every day from Monday to Sunday.
 
She will use the loan to buy firewood, maize, cheese, curd, and "dulce rapadura" (a sugar traditional to the region).
 
Sra. Alba'sdream is buy her own house--she rents now--and give her two children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Paola Patricia

texts.es:
Paola Patrica es una mujer joven que genera sus propios ingresos para apoyar el crecimiento de su familia al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en las edades de 3 y 7 años, con un negocio de comercializar pantalones, camisas bermudas, calzado, suéteres y accesorios para damas.
Su negocio lo inició hace ya dos años, como una fuente de ingreso adicional para apoyar la gestión de su hogar y lograr menos dependencia económica; inicialmente vendió a amigos y familiares, pero gradualmente adicionó empleados de grandes empresas, eso si atendiendo las recomendaciones de sus familiares y de clientes mediante el sistema de referidos. 
Paola emprendió su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace más de 6 años y ha logrado con esta organización tener su vivienda en el Megaproyecto Villas de San Pablo, lo cual ha cambiado su expectativa y nivel de vida, y con los créditos que la Fundación le ha financiado, ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y diversificarlo con nuevas mercancías. Su credikiva es el quinto crédito y con él comprará mercancias como calzado y ropa femenina deportiva y elegante para vestir a sus clientes en las fiestas y vacaciones de fin de año. 
Su sueño ahora es ver crecer a sus hijos saludablemente y que en un futuro tengan éxitos, su mayor desafío es la recuperación de su cartera cuando adiciona clientes nuevos, pero últimamente ha logrado mejorar la selección de sus clientes y el comportamiento de su cartera también es mejor, ella espera seguir así,  para que  en un futuro no lejano, logre tener un gran almacén y brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad y se abran para ellos muchas oportunidades.
texts.en:
Paola Patricia is a young woman who generates her own earnings in order to support her family’s growth.  She lives with her husband, and they have two children, ages 3 and 7.  Her business is selling pants, shirts, shorts, footwear, sweaters, and women’s accessories.

Two years ago she started her business as a source of additional income to support her household and to become less dependent financially.  Initially she sold to friends and relatives.  She gradually added employees from large companies by following the recommendations from her relatives and customers.

Paola started her association with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo over six years ago.  Through this organization she has managed to have her home in Megaproyecto Villas de San Pablo, which has changed her prospects and her standard of living.  With the loans from the Fundación she has managed to increase her working capital and diversify with new merchandise.

This is her fifth Kiva loan.  She will use it to buy merchandise like footwear, women’s sportswear, and elegant clothes for the end of the year parties and vacations.

Her dream now is to see her children grow in good health, and that they have a successful future.  Her biggest challenge is recovering her expenditures when she takes on new customers.  However, she has finally managed to improve the selection of her customers, and her income has also improved.  

She plans to continue this way so that in the near future she will have a large store.  Her plan is also to give her children a quality education so that they have many opportunities.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like footwear, women’s sportswear, and elegant clothes for the end of the year parties and vacations

loans.name: La Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Juana es una D. los miembros del grupo La union 1 y 2, ellos son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, ventas D. comida, etc; en la ciudad D. Hato Mayor una D. las ciudades mas rurales del pais, cuya economia depenD. D. la agricultura. Está asociada D. Esperanza es madre D. 10 hijos, los cuales ha criado con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios junto a su pareja. DesD. hace 18 años se dedico a hacer negocios que generaran mas ingresos para el sustento D. su familia, inicio su negocio en su casa, con un poco D. dinero que pudo conseguir, actualmente lleva con nosotros 4 años y esta recibiendo su octavo prestamo, en cada uno ha realizado sus pagos satisfactoriamente y ha realizado buenas inversiones. Ella actualmente esta operando una fritura (un puesto D. comida fritas) y una fantasia (una pequeña tienda D. cosmeticos y accesorios especialmente para las mujeres).

Juana está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. Pollo, platanos, carnes, etc, pero tambien cosmeticos, ropas, zapatos y accesorios, etc. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para terminar D. construir la cual la esta construyendo poco a poco. Su actividad favorita es negociar y su reto primordial es mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the “La Unión 1 y 2” (The Union 1 & 2) group.  They are micro enterprisers dedicated to clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoe sales, teaching, food sales, etc. in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture.

This Esperanza associate is the mother of 10 children who she has raised with many sacrifices and much effort together with her spouse.  For the last 18 years she has been in business to generate additional family income.  She started her business at home with a little money she was able to obtain.

She has been collaborating with us for 4 years now and is getting her 8th loan.  Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has maD. some good investments.

She currently operates a “fritura” (fried fast food stand) and a “fantasía” (a small cosmetics and women’s accessories store).

Juana is planning to invest the money from the new loan purchasing chicken, plantains, meats, etc. but also some cosmetics, clothes, shoes and accessories, etc.

She will use her profits to finish building her house that she’s been building little by little.  

Her favorite pastime is negotiating and her main challenge is keeping her business afloat.

loans.use: For bananas, chicken, beef, cosmetics, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Greysy Mayela

texts.es:
la señora Greysy Mayela V. tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo. Greysy vive en casa de sus padres desde hace 22 años,  logro sacar sus estudios secundarios y quedo embarazada y a medida que a pasado el tiempo no ha podido tener un trabajo entonces decidio dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, dicho negocio le a dado para cubrir con los gastos de su hijo.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal, desea tener reserva de leña y maiz ya que la epoca esta muy lluviosa por la zona y se es dificil conseguir leña y maiz.
 
sus deseos es tener un trabajo extra que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Greysy Mayela Vásquez, 22, is a single mother of a son.  She has lived in her parents’ house for the past 22 years.  She managed to finish secondary school but became pregnant and as time went by was unable to get a job.  She decided, therefore, to go into tortilla making and this business has provided income sufficient to cover her son’s expenses.

She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.  She wants to have firewood and corn in reserve because during this rainy season in the area it is very difficult to get either of these products.

Her wish is to have an extra job that will allow her to improve the quality of life for herself and her son.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, lime powder and water.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is part of the communal bank “Vida Nueva” (New life) and resides in the commune of Longaví. For the past five years, Nelfa has sold firewood and charcoal with her husband's help. Prior to this business, Nelfa operated a restaurant for 15 years from her house, the same space she now uses for her merchandise sales. 

With this loan, Nelfa plans to purchase more firewood and charcoal. Nelfa's dreams are to operate a grocery store, selling confections, fruit and vegetables. Her short-term goal is to fix her storefront, as it was damaged by the past earthquake on February 27. 

For Nelfa, the loan services provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza have helped to keep her business afloat; she especially enjoys the lessons on business administration. 
  
Longaví is a commune in the Maule Region, central Chile. Its name in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) stands for “snake head.” It's primarily a farming community situated between mountains, foothills and more mountains of lush natural beauty. Its highest point is Mount Longaví, with 3,242 meters of altitude.

loans.use: Firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilu, de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, esta casada con Raúl, de 50 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos, Miguel de 26 y Elva de 18 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Le gusta mucho mantenerse activa y ocupada, se dedica a un variedad de actividades y oficios; como el de vender panes y pasteles que diariamente prepara, de la misma manera se dedica al cuidado de cultivo de arveja, maíz, habas y papa, productos que siembra con una socia, ambas comparten los gastos y las ganancias, asimismo cría animales, y en su establo posee 5 carneros, 3 vacas y 4 chanchos; a todos ellos los cuida y alimenta. Cuando están bien gorditos los mata y vende su carne a los pobladores de su localidad, ya todos la conocen; ella va de casa en casa a ofrecer este producto perecible. En adelante quiere abrir una pequeña carnicería donde pueda atender a sus clientes y vender carne de calidad. Es el primer crédito con MFP y le gusta pertenecer a su banco comunal porqué todos ahí son como una gran familia. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar 2 toros de mil soles cada uno.
texts.en: Marilu, 45 years old, is a happy and hard working woman.  She is married to Raul, who is 50 years old.  They have 3 children, two of whom are living with them; Miguel is 26 and Elva is 18.  They live in their own house in the Chiras area.  She likes to stay active and busy.  She is involved in a variety of activities and trades, such as the sale of bread and pastries that she prepares daily, she also grows peas, corn, beans and potatoes, products that she plants with a partner and they both share the costs and income, and she also raises animals.  In her stable she has 5 sheep, 3 cows and 4 pigs, all of which she feeds and takes care of.  When they are fattened up, she slaughters them and sells the meat to the people in her area.  Everybody know her since she goes door to door selling these perishable products.  In the future she wants to open a small butcher shop where she can take care of her customers and sell good quality meats.  This is her first loan with MFP and she likes belonging to her community bank because everyone there is like a great family.  With the loan she will be able to buy 2 bulls for 1000 soles each.

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls.

loans.name: Lesbia Lizeth

texts.es:
la señora Lesbia Lizeth Z. tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Lesbia se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan desde hace 6 años, su negocio esta ubicado en la aldea El Comercio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle.
todos los dias Lesbia se levanta muy temprano a preparar la masa y elaborar el pan de queso, quesadillas y otros derivados del pan.
sus ventas son por la tarde en los lugares del mercado viejo y nuevo de San Lorenzo.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de manteca, harina, cuajada, queso, huevos, margarina y azucar.
su deseo es tener su propia casa y un esposo he hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lesbia Lizeth Z., 31, is single and has no children.  She has been a baker for six years.  Her business is located in the village of El Comercio in the city of San Lorenzo Valle.

She rises very early daily to prepare the dough and make the cheese bread, quesadillas and other items derived from bread.

Her sales are during the afternoon in San Lorenzo’s New and Old Markets.

She will use the loan to buy lard, flour, cottage cheese, cheese, eggs, margarine and sugar.

Her wish is to have her own house, a husband and children.

loans.use: To buy flour, lard, cottage cheese, cheese, eggs, margarine and sugar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol de 32 años, es un hombre trabajador y alegre, esta casado con Rosa, de 42 años, ambos viven en su casa propia en la localidad de Miraflores. Como todo hombre, es decidido y hábil; por más de 10 años se dedicó a la agricultura tiempo suficiente para entregarle a su digno oficio; vitalidad y juventud. Sus principales cultivos son de maíz, papa y arveja; los que a la actualidad le rindieron muy bien ya que la demanda de estos sembríos nunca decae. Freol desea en el futuro sembrar en mayores cantidades y de esa manera, poder abastecer a sus clientes mayoristas que diariamente compran su cosecha en el mercado central de su ciudad, en ocasiones la venta es demasiado buena por lo que a veces se le acaba rápido los productos que vende. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, además todos los socios de su banco comunal están muy contentos de que sea parte de su grupo, por ser una persona responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono y remedio para el cultivo de maíz que dentro de unos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Freol, 32, is a cheerful, hard working man.  He’s married to Rosa, 42.  They live in their own house in Miraflores.  Like all men he is dedicated and skilled.  For over ten years he has been a farmer, a long enough time to give his dignified work vitality and youth.  His main crops are corn, potatoes and peas which are good producers because demand for these crops never drops.

Freol would like to plant larger amounts in the future so that he can supply the customers that are wholesalers that come by daily to buy his crops at the city’s Central Market.  Sometimes sales are so good that he runs out of product quickly.

This is his 9th loan with MFP.  All the group members are happy that he’s part of the group because he’s a responsible person.

He will use the requested funds to buy manure and remedy for the corn crops that will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: To buy manure for his next corn planting.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
el señor Teofilo O. tiene 56 años de edad y vive en union libre con la señora Juana Maria Ortiz, viven en la aldea El Caimito de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
el señor Teofilo utilizara el credito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia para su negocio y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
su negocio esta ubiacado en su casa de habitacion, tienen 15 años de vivir en ese lugar.
su meta es que su negocio sea grande y que tenga mucha variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, tambien nos comento que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su señora Juana Ortiz.
texts.en:
Mr. Teófilo O., 56, lives in a common law union with Mrs. Juana María Ortiz in the El Caimito village in the city of San Lorenzo.

Teófilo will use the loan to buy merchandise for his store in order to have improved profits.

His store is located in his home; they have lived there for 15 years.

His goal is a larger store with a wide variety of products to meet all his customer demand.  He also commented to us that he wants to provide his wife with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, lard, cooking oil, corn, flour, soups, noodles, sauces, sardines, matches, candles, batteries, milk, plastic bags, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, cooking, bread, beverages and eggs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Glenda Maricela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Glenda, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación libre hace varios años de la cual ha tenido dos hijos de 7 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo en la actualidad esta desempleado.

Ella se dedica al comercio informal vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas). Trabaja todos los días de cuatro a cinco horas diarias, dice que antes tenía un negocio de ventas de electrodomésticos pero no le fue muy bien por lo que decidió vender estos productos que tienen mucha salida y le deja ganancias  para solventar los gastos de su familia.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos que tiene para este mes ya los productos que entrego todavía no los ha terminado de cobrar ya que deja a crédito. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace varios ciclos y es la tesorera, le gusta mucho el Banco por la ayuda que recibe. 

Su sueño es tener una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The Francisco Pacheco communal bank meets every two weeks in the Francisco Pacheco neighborhood of Portoviejo.  This is a marginal, crowded urban area in the city.

We chatted here with Glenda, 31.  She’s been in a common law relationship for several years.  She has two children who are 7 and 5 years old and in school.  Her husband is unemployed at the present time.

She is an informal merchant.  She sells Yanbal brand products (beauty supplies, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day from four to five hours daily.  She says that she used to have a business selling home appliances but didn’t do too well so decided to sell these products that sell well and produce profits sufficient to meet family expenses.

She will use this loan to pay for the placed orders she has this month because she already delivered the items although she hasn’t been paid completely for them because she leaves them on credit.

She has been in several cycles in the communal bank and is the Treasurer.  She likes the bank a lot because of the help she receives.

Her dream is to have good economic stability.

loans.use: To buy Yanbal brand products.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Álvaro C. es un hombre de 45 años, que vive y tiene un negocio en Puerto Colombia, un municipio a 15 minutos de Barranquilla ubicado a la orilla del mar, lo cual da cuenta de su  vocación turística y es allí donde familias barranquilleras, se acercan los fines de semanas a divertirse y a darse un baño de mar, lo cual ha potenciado la sostenibilidad de la microempresa  de Álvaro, que es la preparación de un delicioso arroz chino, que vende de manera ambulante, en su carrito de madera  y con el cual ha logrado apoyar el crecimiento de sus tres hijos en las edades de 9 a 21 años de edad . 
El credikiva es el primer crédito de Álvaro, con el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen, como víveres para la preparación de su arroz chino y también reparará su carruaje de ventas. El negocio de Álvaro nació hace un año y desde entonces, se levanta muy temprano, prepara su arroz chino, con el apoyo de sus hijos que también trabajan en este negocio. Álvaro produce un promedio de 35 libras de arroz diariamente y las vende en los horarios de 10:00 AM a 2:00 P.M, en porciones de a $1000 COP, esto hace atractivo el que mucha gente quiera comprarle,  además del sabor inigualable que tiene su producto y de ser el único que vende de manera ambulante en todo el municipio; Con su rutero   su venta está asegurada, pues el arroz chino está muy acreditado entre sus clientes que día a día generan otros potenciales. Su sueño es continuar con su negocio generando  mas utilidades, para seguir financiando los estudios universitarios de su hija mayor y a mediano plazo planea abrir un local en el cual venda su arroz y otras comidas.
texts.en:
Álvaro C., 45, lives and has a business in Puerto Colombia, a town that is 15 minutes from Barranquilla and at the seashore which makes it a tourist destination for families from Barranquilla who come to spend the weekends there to have fun and enjoy the sea.  This makes Álvaro’s micro  business profitable.  He prepares delicious Chinese-style rice that he sells in an itinerant manner using a wooden cart.  This business has allowed him to support the development of his three children who are between the ages of 9 and 21.  This is Álvaro’s first Kiva loan that he will use to buy larger amounts of ingredients to make his rice and also to repair his sales cart.

Álvaro’s business was born a year ago and since then he gets up very early to prepare the rice with help from his children who also work in the business.  He makes an average of 35 pounds of rice per day and sells from 10am to 2pm.  Each portion costs $1000 COP.  This is a very affordable price which causes many people to want to buy from him.  Besides, his product’s flavor is unequaled and he is the only vendor who sells throughout the town.  His sales are guaranteed along his route because the Chinese-style rice is highly rated by his customers who daily produce more potential customers for him.
