His dream is to continue with the business generating higher profits in order to continue to pay for his oldest daughter’s university education.  Also, in the not too distant future he wants to open a shop to sell his rice and other dishes.

loans.use: Will buy ingredients, like foodstuffs to make his Chinese-style rice, in quantity as well as repair his sales cart.

loans.name: Evert Antonio

texts.es:
Evert Antonio tiene 34 años, es casado y vive junto a su familia 
Se dedica desde hace más de 13 años a la venta de granos básicos lo inicio con granos básicos sus productos  los ofrece a sus diferentes clientes que son amigos, familiares y vecinos. Esta actividad le permite sustentar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia. Para lograr que  sus clientes estén con él desea realizar este crédito para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz entre otros. Desea seguir creciendo para mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. A él lo consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Evert Anonio, 34, is married and lives with his family.

For over 13 years he has sold basic grains.  He started out with basic grains.  His customers are friends, family members and neighbors.  This activity makes it possible for him to meet personal expenses and support his family.

In order to insure customer satisfaction he wants this loan to buy raw materials like: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil and corn, among others.  He wants to continue growing to gradually improve his quality of life.  He is considered to be a levelheaded, responsible person.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Rosa Benedicta

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora a sus 52 años todavía tiene muchas fuerzas y ganas de trabajar, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de esta relación ya todos son mayores que tienen sus propias familias. Su esposo es policía.

Se dedica a la venta de  productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para dama, trabaja los días viernes, sábados y domingos en los que entrega sus productos,  realiza nuevas ventas y cobra ya que deja a créditos sus productos, dice que tiene muchos clientes ya que  lleva 7 años en este negocio.

Este crédito lo  va a emplear en comprar mas de sus productos para cumplir a tiempo con sus clientes ya que esa es su garantía. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque le da mucha ayuda en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un bazar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Francisco Pacheco de Portoviejo the Francisco Pacheco Village Bank meets every fifteen days in a highly populated urban area on the outskirts of the city.

Rosa is a very hardworking woman.  For her age of fifty-two, she still has quite a bit of strength and desire to work.  She's married and she and her husband have four children, all grown with families of their own.  Her husband is a police officer.

Rosa earns her living selling Yanbal products (beauty products like perfume and women's accessories).  She works Friday through Sunday delivering product, making new sales, and collecting payment for items she sold on credit.  She says that since she's been in business for seven years, she has a lot of clients.  

She plans to use this loan to buy more products so she can fill clients' orders in a timely fashion, since that's her guarantee.  She's been with the village bank for three loan cycles and likes it, because it helps her out considerably in her business.

Rosa's dream is to have a shop with everything she needs to satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: To buy Yambal perfumes, creams, jewelry, and cosmetics.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Para la señora María la vida ha sido muy difícil ya que su esposo y compañero hace varios años falleció y la dejo con 9 hijos a su cargo,  hoy ya 6 de ellos son mayores e independientes, solo vive con sus tres hijas menores las cuales estudian los últimos años de colegio. Ella junto a sus hijas viven en la casa de su mamá.

Todas las tardes ella sale a poner un puestito donde vende cueritos asados, empanadas, corviches, además de ricos y deliciosos batidos de fruta. Trabaja desde las tres de tarde y atiende su negocio hasta las 19h00, sus hijas le ayudan después que llegan del colegio.

Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres ciclos y esta muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio, con el ultimo crédito compro una licuadora y empezó a vender batidos lo cual ha generado mas ganancias para ella. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar otra licuadora que le hace mucha falta y para comprar carne y frutas.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijas sean profesionales y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Francisco Pacheco communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Francisco Pacheco neighborhood which is a marginal, very crowded urban zone in this city.

Life has been very difficult for María since her husband and companion of many years died and left her with 9 children to care for.  Today, six of them are already adult and independent.  She lives only with her three youngest daughters who are in the last years of high school.  She and her daughters live in her mother’s house.

Every afternoon she sets up a small stand where she sells fried pork rinds, turnovers and “corviches” (deep-fried dumplings stuffed with fish and bananas served with peanut sauce) as well as delicious blended fruit drinks.  She is open for business from 3pm until 7pm.  Her daughters help out once they get home from school.

She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and is very happy because she has been able to improve her business thanks to the loans.  She used the most recent loan to buy a blender to start selling blended fruit drinks which produced more profits for her.  This loan will be used to buy another blender that she needs very much and to buy meat and fruit.

Her dream is that her daughters become professionals and to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy meat, fruit and a blender.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa, de 57 años, es una mujer sencilla y muy trabajadora que junto a su esposo saca adelante a sus dos hijos; a los que cuida y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Progreso. Afirma con mucho optimismo y tranquilidad, “que los recursos son escasos pero las fuerzas no “. Pese al tiempo que le dedicó a la agricultura no se siente cansada y todas las mañanas a primera horas del día, se levanta muy contenta, pues quiere ver cuanto crecieron sus cultivos de arveja y demás hortalizas que siembra cada temporada. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder ver sus plantaciones saludables, creciendo sin mayor dificultad. Clarisa ya tiene un sitio ganado en la capital, aquí vende su cosecha a muy buen precio y con las ganancias que obtiene lo ahorra para poder instalar una tienda de comestibles, de esa manera piensa incrementar sus ganancias y poder dedicar más tiempo a sus hijos. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo aprendió el valor del ahorro y progreso; por eso agradece a su banco comunal que hace posible que ella surja y avance. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arvejas, así como también abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Clarisa, 57, is an unassuming, hard working woman who, together with her husband, supports their two children.  She cares for and raises them in her own home located in the town of Progreso.

She states with much optimism and calm:  “resources might be few but strength is not.”  Despite the time she’s been farming she does not feel tired and every day rises at dawn happy to see how much her pea and other vegetables she plants each season have grown.  What she enjoys the most is seeing her crops healthy, growing problem free.  

Clarisa has secured a spot in the capital where she sells her crops at very good prices.  She is saving up her profits in order to open a foodstuffs store to increase profits while being able to spend more time with her children.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  During this time she has learned the value of savings and progress.  For this reason she is grateful that the communal bank makes it possible for her to grow and move forward.

She will use the requested funds to buy pea seeds as well as sacks of manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ha logrado salir adelante con sus 3 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 está a su cargo, sus inicios se dan por su esposo que le ayudo a que comenzara con este negocio y así le ayudara a sufragar gastos de su familia, por lo que siempre está pendiente de los diferentes pedidos que sus clientes le realizan. El financiamiento es para la compra de diversos productos que se utilizan a diario.
texts.en: Maria Lourdes is 42 years old, and she has a general store.  She has had this business for more than 10 years.  With a lot of effort and dedication, she has managed to provide for her 3 children, of whom only 1 is still in her care.  She started the business with the help of her husband so that she could help to cover the household expenses.  She is always taking care of the various orders of her customers.  This loan will be used to buy a variety of everyday consumer products.

loans.use: working capital to buy consumer products for her store

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 63 años, es un hombre pícaro y soltero, que vive en compañía de su hermana Eutemia de 52 años; en su propia casa ubicada en la localidad de Progreso. A pesar de su edad, él es un hombre fuerte y con muchas ganas de vivir, desde niño trabajó en los terrenos de cultivo; ahí aprendió a cultivar y cosechar los sembríos. A pesar de no tener familia, no se siente solo, ya que; apoyar a su hermana en la crianza de sus hijos, es el mayor regalo que la vida le pudo haber dado; fue por ellos que comenzó a invertir en la agricultura; sembrando maíz, arveja y papa. El tiempo y la experiencia le enseñaron a  vender sus cosechas en el mercado central de su ciudad; aquí amplio su mirada y se llenó de varios objetivos; uno de ellos es comprar ropa para venderlo en la selva central, “en esa parte del país no existe mucha variedad de prendas de vestir y la innovación traería muchas ganancias”, asegura. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece los años de apoyo, éxitos y gratificaciones que obtuvo gracias a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar abono y semillas de papa, ya que tiene dispuesto a sembrar en estos días.
texts.en: Felix, 63, is a mischievous single man who lives with his 52 year-old sister Eutemia in his own home, located in the town of Progreso.  In spite of his age, he is a strong man with a strong desire to live.  He has been farming ever since he was a child, when he learned to cultivate and harvest the crops. Despite having no family, he does not feel alone, since to support his sister in the upbringing of her children is the greatest gift that life could have given him.  It was for them that he began to invest in agriculture, sowing corn, peas and potatoes. Time and experience taught him to sell his harvested crops in the central market in his city.  There he widened his view and expanded his goals to include buying clothing to sell in the central rain forest, where, according to him, "in this part of the country there is not much variety of clothing, so it is an opportunity to generate profits."  This is his 10th loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the years of support, and for the successes and rewards that he has obtained thanks to his communal bank.  With the loan he requests, he will buy organic fertilizer and potato seeds, since he is now ready to plant.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Aquí conversamos con la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad,  esta separada  y tiene tres hijos todos menores de edad que estudian en escuela y colegio lo que representa una dura carga que nuestra socia a podido sobrellevar gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación.
 
Es auxiliar de enfermería y tiene una pequeña farmacia. Trabaja todos los días, desde las 5am hasta las 22h00, mantiene abierta su farmacia en la cual trabaja desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 ya que en las tardes trabaja como enfermera en una clínica particular, una hermana se hace cargo de la farmacia en las horas que ella no está.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas medicinas y así surtir más su farmacia. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que donde tiene la farmacia es alquilado.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Francisco Pacheco, meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, in a densely populated urban area. 

Here, we spoke with María, 34, who is separated and has three young children, all of whom attend school. The cost of school represents a heavy economic burden which María has overcome thanks to her effort and dedication. 

María is a nursing assistant and has a small pharmacy. She works every day from 5AM until 10PM. She works in the pharmacy from 5AM until 2PM and then goes to her nursing job at a private clinic. María’s sister runs the pharmacy when she is not there. 

María is going to use this loan to buy more medicine so that she can restock her pharmacy. This is her fifth cycle in the bank and she likes the benefits that she receives. 

María’s dream is to have her own store since she currently rents the space for her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for pharmacy

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, ella tiene un hijo,  Ángel de 16, de su primer compromiso, actualmente convive con Antonio, de 28 años, él tiene hijo, Anderson de 4 años, juntos se unieron y viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. 

Desde muy niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, ayudaba a sus padres a mantener su terreno de cultivo, ya cuando consolidó su familia, se dedicó a sembrar y cultivar en su propio terreno de cultivo. Ahora cultiva en dos hectáreas de terreno, papa, arveja y habas; los que después comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad, pero en temporadas de mayor cosecha los mismos compradores van hacia sus mismos campos a comprar lo que ha cosechado. 

En todo este tiempo ella pudo adquirir dos toros, con los que puede arar la tierra, de esa manera evitará el gasto de contratar personal. Con el tiempo se comprará mas hectáreas de terreno de cultivo, para poder sembrar más cantidad de papa y poder obtener mejores ganancias. 

Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual y cumplida con su banco comunal, ya que le apoyan y entre ellos comparten experiencias positivas. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar abono para las 40 hectáreas de papa que está sembrando (2 son propias y 38 son alquilados).
texts.en:
Haydee, age 41, is a hard-working woman. She has one 16-year-old son, Angel, from a previous relationship, and she currently lives with 28-year-old Antonio, who also has a 4-year-old son, Anderson, from a previous relationship. They live together in their own house in Chiras.  

She has worked the land since she was a very young girl.  She helped her parents maintain their crops.  When her family consolidated six years ago, she planted and grew crops on her own land.  She now grows potatoes, peas, and beans on two hectares of land.  She sells them in the central market in her area.  However, during the season when there is a large harvest, the same buyers go to their own fields to buy what has been harvested.

During all of this time she was able to buy two bulls.  She is able to plow the land with them.  This way she avoids the expense of hiring workers.  In time she will buy more hectares of land to cultivate.  She will do this in order to plant greater quantities of potatoes and to be able to obtain better earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be punctual with her communal bank. They support her, and they share positive experiences.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the 40 hectares of potatoes that she is planting (two are her own, the remaining 38 are rented).

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ennita Judith

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Ennita, ella tiene  30 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre, de la cual ha tenido 4 hijos de 13-11-10-8 años, el mayor esta en primer año de colegio mientras que los otros están en escuela.

Ella junto a su marido se dedican a la venta de artículos para el hogar como: planchas, licuadoras, ollas, platos y muchos otros productos más. Trabajan de lunes a sábados desde las 8 am hasta las 16h00 que regresan a su casa, su forma de vender es ir a los campos ya que allá consiguen vender mejor sus productos. Compra sus artículos en el Comercial de Fátima Pin en Portoviejo que le dan a buen precio para la venta.

Esta en el Banco Comunal Hace tres ciclos y le gusta por el cumplimiento que tiene la institución con las socias. Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar sus productos.
 
Sus sueños son terminar su casa que esta en construcción y algún día tener un carro para ir mas cómodos a realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Dios Con Nosotros" [God With Us] meets every two weeks in the residential area el Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the provincial capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills. 

Here we meet with Ennita, 30, who is in a committed relationship by which she has four children of 13, 11, 10 and 8 years. The oldest is in his first year of middle school while the others are in elementary school. 

Along with her husband she works selling household items such as irons, blenders, pots and pans, dishware and many additional products. They work from Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. when they return home. Their way of selling is to go to the countryside since they are able to sell more there. They purchase their items in the store called Fátima Pin en Portoviejo where they have good prices for selling. 

She has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and is pleased with the level of attention the institution shows the associates. She will use this loan for purchasing her products. 

Her dreams are to finish her house which is under construction and some day to have a car so as to travel more comfortably to make her sales.

loans.use: To purchase blenders, irons, pots, dishware, etc.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Teodolinda, de 29 años, es una mujer valiente y luchadora, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, Paola, de 8 y Renzo, de 6 años de edad; ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Para poder educar y darle todas las comodidades que se merecen, Teodolinda se dedica a múltiples actividades, una de ellas es la crianza de animales, entre vacas y cerdos, los que cuida y alimenta, ya cuando están gorditos los vende a los comerciantes de una de las zonas aledañas como es el caso de Huasahuasi. La otra actividad que realiza es la agricultura, ahí siembra arveja, papa y maíz, que junto a una amiga, quien dispone de un terreno y Teodolinda los insumos, ya cuando están maduros sus productos, los venden en el mercado central de su ciudad, repartiéndose luego las ganancias. En adelante está planeando comprar mayor cantidad de animales, comprar terrenos de cultivo para poder sembrar por si misma, con las ganancias obtenidas está segura que podrá ahorrar para comprar su propia casa. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal, en el que puede compartir ideas, sabe que unidos podrán salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar abono para el cultivo de papa, así mismo desea comprar semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Teodolinda, 29, is a brave, hard working woman.  She is a single mother of two children, Paola, 8, and Renzo, 6.  They live in a rented house in Chiras.
In order to provide them with education and the comforts they deserve, Teodolinda is engaged in several activities.  One is raising animals like cows and pigs.  She feeds and cares for them until they are fat and then sells them to merchants in neighboring areas like Huasahuasi.

Another activity is farming.  She grows peas, potatoes and corn alongside a girl friend.  The friend puts in the field and Teodolinda the farming supplies.  When the crops mature they sell them in the city’s central market and they share the profits.

Later on she is planning to buy a larger amount of animals and to buy farmland in order to grow her crops by herself.  She is sure that profits obtained will make it possible for her to buy a house of her own.

This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She likes to work with the communal bank a lot because she can share ideas; she knows that united they can all get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy manure for the potato crops as well as pea seed.

loans.use: To buy manure and pea seed.

loans.name: Ulices

texts.es: Ulises, de 40 años, es un hombre honesto y sensible, vive con su esposa de 36 años, ellos tienen 4 hijos, todos menores, a los cuales cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Desde los 23 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, ahí comenzó a sembrar papa y arveja, los que ahora vende en el mercado central de su ciudad, como también visita otras zonas aledañas, como Matahuasi. Disfruta mucho sembrar arvejas porqué sabe que tendrá mayores ganancias en corto tiempo y sobre todo invirtiendo menos. Pero en realidad lo que más le gusta a Ulises es poder arar la tierra, es así que desde muy temprano se dirige a otros terrenos de cultivo para brindarle sus servicios; por ello cuenta con dos toros que posee, ya que le ayuda a voltear la tierra, de esta manera se genera otros ingresos. En adelante esta planeando abrir un negocio de compra y venta de arvejas; donde podrá vender al por mayor. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y como secretario de su banco comunal se siente muy contento de poder planificar y apoyar a su grupo. Con el crédito que obtendrá podrá comprar abono y guano (producto natural que fortifica a los cultivos), para la papa que está sembrando.
texts.en:
Ulises, forty, is an honest and sensitive man.  He lives with his wife, thirty-six, with whom he has four young children that he cares for and educates in his own house in Chiras.  He has earned his living in agriculture since he was twenty-three. He started out planting potatoes and peas, which he now sells at the central market in his city and areas nearby, like Matahuasi.

He really enjoys growing peas, because he knows he can make a big profit in short time with little investment.  However, what he really likes best is being able to till the land, which he does on other people's lands from early in the morning.  For that, Ulises says, he has two oxen to help him turn the soil, which helps him generate more income.  In the future he plans to open a business buying and selling peas wholesale.

This will be Ulises' seventh loan with MFP and as secretary of his village bank he feels very happy to be able to support and draw up plans for his group.  He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizer and guano (a natural product for fortifying crops), for the potatoes he's planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fortify his potato crop.

loans.name: Carlos Eder

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Para don Carlos este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y está muy a gusto  ya que ha encontrado gente seria y honesta, está agradecido con la Fundación Espoir porque con los créditos que ha recibido ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años, que estudian en escuela. Su mujer se dedica a labores del hogar.

Se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y los viernes y sábados hasta las 23h00 ya que en estos dos días por  las noches vende bebidas alcohólicas, su negocio lo tiene ya hace 10 años y dice que cada día le pone mucho empeño para mejorarlo día a día.

Es por eso que solicito este nuevo crédito para comprar más productos  para surtir aun mas su tienda.

Sus sueños son darles una muy buena educación  a sus hijos y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
The “Dios Con Nosotros” (God with Us) communal bank meets every two weeks in the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley because it’s surrounded by many hills.

This is Carlos’ fourth cycle with the bank and he is very comfortable because he has found honest, serious people.  He is grateful to Fundación Espoir because the loans he has received have helped him improve his business.  He is in a common law relationship which has produced two children who are 9 and 7 years of age and in school.  His wife is a housewife.

He is a merchant.  He has a grocery store that is open every day from 6am until 8pm and until 11pm on Fridays and Saturdays because on these two nights he sells alcoholic beverages.  He has been in business for 10 years and he states that every day he puts in a lot of effort to gradually improve it.

This is why he asked for a new loan to buy more merchandise to better stock his store.

His dreams are to provide his children with a good education and to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat, eggs and foodstuffs in general.

loans.name: María Dirmania

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí encontramos a la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 15 años, tiene un hijo  de tres años el cual es su tesoro mas preciado ya que no podía tener hijos y fue como una bendición que a los 12años de relación tuvo a su bebe. Su marido trabaja en Guayaquil.

Ella actualmente trabaja en un restaurant en el cual ha aprendido mucho y ya quiere independizarse, por lo cual ha solicitado este crédito para poner su propio comedor, nos cuenta que ya tiene el local y ciertas cosas necesarias, pero que aún le faltan mas. Con este crédito va a comprar tres mesas, doce sillas, cucharas y platos y otras cosas, para así echar en marcha su negocio.

Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son salir adelante en su negocio y así poder tener lo necesario para darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The “Dios Con Nosotros” (God with Us) communal bank meets every two weeks in the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley because it’s surrounded by many hills.

We find María, 37, here.  She has been in a free union for 15 years and has a three year old son who is her most treasured possession because she had not been able to have children and it was like a blessing that after 12 years in a relationship she had her baby.  Her husband works in Guayaquil.

She has been working in a restaurant where she has learned a lot and she wants to take off on her own and become independent.  For this reason she has asked for this loan, to set up her own eatery.  She tells us that she already has the place and some of the necessary things but she still needs others. She will use the loan to buy three tables, twelve chairs, spoons, dishes and other things to launch her business.

This is her 3rd cycle with the communal bank and she’s liked it because of the ease in obtaining the loans.

She dreams with succeeding with her business so that she can have what is necessary to give the best to her young son.

loans.use: To buy three tables, twelve chairs, spoons and dishes.

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

La señora Olga tiene 28 años y esta en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos, en este tiempo ha podido ayudarse mucho con los créditos que recibe de la Fundación Espoir por eso está muy agradecida y a gusto con el Banco. Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 7 años de la cual tiene dos hermosos hijos de 3 años el mayor y de 1 y seis meses el segundo. Su Marido es ebanista.

Tiene un negocio de comida en el Mercado Municipal y en sus ratos libres también vende ropa por catalogo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 am hasta las 15h00 en su restaurante y la venta de ropa en las noches por ratos ya que tiene que dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos que no los ve mucho, ellos quedan al cuidado de su mama.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de la comida.
 
Su sueño es tener un  restaurante más elegante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Dios Con Nosotros" [God With Us] meets every two weeks in the residential area of el Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the provincial capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills. 

Olga, 28, has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles. During this time she has been very much helped by the loans she receives from Fundación Espoir so she appreciates and is quite happy with the Bank. She has been in a committed relationship for seven years by which she has two beautiful children, the oldest being three years and the second, 18 months. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. 

She has a food service business in the Municipal Market and in her spare time she also sells clothing by catalog. She works seven days a week from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. at her restaurant and handles the clothing sales now and then in the evenings as she must dedicate time to her children whom she does not see much; they are cared for by her mom. 

This loan is to purchase products for the preparation of the food. 

Her dream is to have a more elegant restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Reina Rocio

texts.es:
Reina R. està solicitando un nuevo crédito de renovación a través de Kiva, porque la tasa de interés a la que accede es muy buena, le han ayudado a disminuir sus costos y a ofrecer un mejor precio de ventas. 

El crédito al que se postula lo invertirá  en la compra de CD, DVD, MP3 para aumentar su oferta de productos, adaptandose a una temporada de buena música bailable y navideña que se acerca, lo mismo que provisionandose con películas instructivas, para que las familias aprovechen las vacaciones, para reunirse alrededor del tema proyectado. 

Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Reina a través de su perfil Kiva anterior, puede ingresar al siguiente enlace: http://www.kiva.org/lend/184971.
texts.en:
Reina R. is requesting a new loan through Kiva because the interest rate she can access is very good, and helps her reduce costs and be able to offer her merchandise at a better sales price.

She plans to use the requested loan to buy CDs, DVDs and MP3s to increase the variety of stock available adapting it with dance music for the approaching Christmas season as well as including educational films so that families can use their vacation time to gather around and learn about the topic of interest.

If you would like to learn about Reina’s story by viewing her previous Kiva profile, please follow this link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/184971.

loans.use: To increase her stock of CDs, DVDs and MP3s.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe de Jesús V. C. esta casado con la señora María Magdalena desde hace 7 años de los cuales surgieron 2 hijos que están en edad escolar y que aun dependen de su ellos. Felipe de Jesús desea construir una barda en la parte de atrás para protegerse de los robos y así tener a su familia segura, para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra. 
La esposa y el trabajan en maquiladora para poder cubrir los gastos de la familia para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Felipe de Jesús V. C. has been married to María Magdalena for 7 years.  They have two school age children in their care.

Felipe de Jesús wants to build a wall in the rear of his property to protect himself from robberies and keep his family safe.  To do so he needs to buy building materials and supplies and pay for labor costs.

Both he and his wife work in an assembly plant to meet family expenses and offer a better quality of life.

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Ma. Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Ma. Concepción Godínez V. esta casada y tiene 3 hijos a los cuales desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida; cuenta con un negocio de la venta de chorizo, queso que ella mima prepara desde hace 5 años y venta de ropa usada de muy buena calidad y su esposo es taxista para poder cubrir los gastos.
 Ma. Concepción nos comenta que hay días que su esposo no tiene pasajeros y las ventas son muy bajas, pero lo que a esta familia sustenta es el negocio de chorizo y queso, por lo que pide el apoyo para que se le de un préstamo y así surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Concepción Godínez V. is married and has three children to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life. She has had a sausage and cheese business for five years in which she prepares the foods herself. She also sells high quality used clothing. Her husband is a taxi driver in order to be able to cover expenses. 

Maria Concepción tells us that there are days in which her husband has no passengers and sales are very low, but what sustains this family is the sausage and cheese business. Therefore she asks for the support of granting her a loan so she may supply her business.

loans.use: To remodel her house

loans.name: Norma Lydia

texts.es: Norma Lydia T. López es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecerles lo mejor, pues desde que ella se dejo de su ex esposo no la apoya con los gastos económicos de los niños. Por ello puso su negocio de la venta de burritos y hamburguesas los fines de semana, requiere de un préstamo para hacer crecer mas su negocio y sus ventas se incrementen, aparte de ella es maestra en una escuela primaria para poder cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Norma Lydia T. López is a very hard working, enterprising woman.  She’s divorced and has two children for whom she wants to provide the best because ever since she left her ex-husband he hasn’t contributed anything towards the children’s expenses.

Because of this she opened a stand to sell burritos and hamburgers on the weekend.  She needs a loan to expand her business and increase sales.  Besides, she also works as an elementary school teacher to meet expenses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Shirley Yajaira

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Para  la señora Shirley este es su tercer ciclo y está muy a gusto, le encantan las reuniones ya que en ellas aprende cosas necesarias para su vida diaria. Tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12-4-2 años, el mayor esta en el primer año de colegio. Su marido es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que se da tiempo para  dedicarse al comercio, vende productos de Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y bisutería). Además vende joyas de Romanel, todos sus productos son por catálogos, trabaja de lunes a viernes unas tres horas por las tardes, deja a crédito y en estos días cobra y realiza nuevas ventas.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de su mercadería ya que tiene bastantes pedidos para este mes y todavía no ha recuperado el capital del mes anterior.
 
Su sueño es estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
The “Dios Con Nosotros” (God with Us) communal bank meets every two weeks in the El Florón neighborhood in Portoviejo, Manabí capital, known as the City of the Valley because it’s surrounded by many hills.

This is Shirley’s third cycle and she is very happy.  She loves the meetings because she learns things that are useful for her everyday life.  She is 27 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She has three children who are 12, 4 and 2 years of age.  The oldest is in first year of high school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She is a housewife who makes time to work in commerce.  She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty supplies, perfumes and costume jewelry); she also sells Romanel brand jewelry.  All of her products are sold via catalogue.  She works from Monday through Friday for about three hours per afternoon.  She sells on credit and on collection days she makes new sales.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise because she has quite a few pending orders for this month and she hasn’t yet recovered last month’s capital.

Her dream is to study a university career.

loans.use: To buy Romanel brand jewelry and Yambal and Avon brand cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José E. S. y su esposa desde hace 2 años se dedican a la distribución de chorizo que ellos mismo preparan. Este negocio les ha traído muy buenos ingresos y han tomado clientes que les gusta su producto. Ahora quiere comprar más mercancía para seguir produciendo su producto y así tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
José E. S. and his wife have sold chorizo that they manufacture themselves for the last two years.  The business has produced very good earnings for them and they have regular customers that enjoy their product.

He wants to buy more merchandise to continue making his product and thus have more profits.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nallely Yarin

texts.es: Nallely Yarin R. Sánchez tiene un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 1 año y le gusta atender a sus clientes con entusiasmo y amabilidad. Es madre de un pequeño al cual quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, tiene pensado que con los ingresos de su negocio comprar su propia casa. Este el proyecto que ella quiere es comprar mas ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nallely Yarin R. Sánchez has had a used clothing sales business for the past year.  She enjoys tending to her customers with enthusiasm and kindness.

She is the mother of a young one for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

She plans to use income from her business to buy her own home.

Her project is to buy more clothes to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, ya son como 13 años que lleva y  espera seguir por muchos años más, siempre le ha gustado la forma de trabajar de la institución. Tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos, los dos son mayores pero su hija menor vive con ella, su marido es chofer.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en un local que es de su suegra que le dio para que instale su negocio sin cobrarle arriendo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 14h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, dice que ya son varios años y que le ha ido bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que luego ella utiliza en la preparación de los alimentos, además quiere comprar dos licuadoras para vender batidos de frutas.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio local y un restaurante más grande.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Vida” (Health & Life) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture and for being near the two best beaches in the province:  San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and has been in it for about 13 years and hopes to continue with it for many more years.  She has always enjoyed the way the institution operates.  She is 54 years old and in a common law relationship.  She has two children both of whom are adults but her younger daughter lives with her.  Her husband is a driver.

She has a small eatery in a locale that belongs to her mother-in-law that she uses rent-free.  She is open for business every day from 5am until 2pm.  Her daughter helps her.  She says that she’s been in this for several years now and thanks to God has done well.

This loan will be used to buy products she uses to prepare her meals. She also wants to buy two blenders to sell blended fruit beverages.

Her dreams are to have her own locale and a larger restaurant.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and two blenders.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como tesorera del mismo, nos cuenta que le gusta el Banco por la seriedad tanto de las socias que son responsables y de parte de la institución que siempre cumple con ellas. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 16 años que están estudiando en colegio. Su esposo es chofer de un tráiler.

Tiene un negocio de venta de tarjetas y cabinas telefónicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 20h00, dice que le va bien ya que por allí cerca no hay otro negocio como el suyo además también vende colas y helados Pingüino. En la actualidad quiere comprar unas computadoras para también poner un negocio de internet.

Es para esto que solicito este crédito para ayudarse a comprar dos computadores para iniciar este nuevo negocio.

Sus metas son salir adelante en su nuevo negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, members of the Salud y Vida (Health and Life) Community Bank meet every 15 days. This area is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Maria is a founding member of the Community Bank and works as the treasurer there. She tells us that she likes the bank because of the seriousness both of the members, who are very responsible, and of the institution, which always serves them. She is 42 years old, married and has two children, a 15 and 16 year old, who are studying in high school. Her husband drives a tractor trailer. 

She has a business selling phone cards and phone calls. She works everyday from 8am until 8pm and says that the business is going well because there is no other business like hers in the nearby area. She also sells soda and Penguin ice creams. She would like to buy computers in order to start an internet cafe. That is why she is requesting a loan, in order to buy two computers to start this new business. 

Her goals are to succeed in her new business and that her sons have professional careers.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Nancy tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad aunque todos viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Es modista desde muy joven, estudio corte y confección en la Academia Esperanza Sacoto, donde aprendió a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa aunque lo que más le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer, dice que también hace camisas para hombre. Trabaja  todos los días cuando hay bastante trabajo casi todo el día,  una de sus hijas le ayuda cuando tiene mucho trabajo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y otros productos que se requieren para la costura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe.

Sus sueños son que nunca le falte trabajo y poner un buen taller de costura.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the members of Salud y Vida Community Bank meet every 15 days. This area is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Nancy is 57 years old, married and has 4 children, all of whom are adults but still live with her. Her husband is a farmer. 

Nancy has been a seamstress since she was very young and studied cutting and sewing of clothes at the Esperanza Sacoto Academy where she learned how to make all kinds of clothing. Although she likes to make women's clothes the most, she also makes shirts for men. She works every day, when there is enough work, almost all day. One of her daughters helps her when she has a lot of work. 

She will use this loan to buy fabric and other products she needs for dressmaking. She has been a member of the Community Bank since the beginning and likes it because of the benefits she receives. Her dreams are to always have enough work and to have a good dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok O. is a 43-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital in Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sok O. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on this land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories, which she will sell to buyers every three months when the plants mature. 

Her husband is a fisherman and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for many years. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing tool is broken. Because of that, Mrs. Sok O. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Angela Ana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Angela, tiene 40 años de edad está casada y tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, tres de sus hijos viven con ella. El esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un local comercial donde vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, bisutería y otros artículos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 12h00 y de 14h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja con la ayuda de tres chicas a las que les paga un sueldo. Sus productos los compra en Quito y Guayaquil una vez al mes.

Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y le ha gustado por la facilidad de los pagos y los intereses bajos. Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar mercadería.
 
Su meta es poner otro local en Portoviejo.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the members of Salud y Vida Community Bank meet every 15 days. This area is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Angela is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Four of them are already adults and three of her children live with her. Her husband is an entrepreneur. 

She has a local shop where she sells all kinds of clothes, shoes, costume jewelry and other items. She works every day from 8am until 12pm and from 2pm until 6pm. She has three employees who help her and she pays them each a salary. She buys her products in Quito and Guayaquil once each month. 

This is her 4th cycle with the Bank and she likes it because of the ease of making payments and the low interest rates. She will use this credit to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to open another shop in Portoviejo.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and costume jewelry

loans.name: 10.15.01 Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Linh V. T. (45) is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Linh is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01 Đông Sơn (10. 15. 01 Đông Sơn). 

Linh is married and has two school-aged children. Linh owns & operates a business providing general services to local community members. Linh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Linh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Linh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. The loan will be the her fourth from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Linh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. T. T. Ngoc (47) is a 61 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. 

2. H. T. Dinh (49) is a 62 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 

3. N. T. Tu (12) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her retail store. 

4. B. T. Kim Thanh (268) is a 43 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food. 

5. N. T. Van Anh (82) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 

6. L. M. Huong (48) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her clothing business. 

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. 


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 


Linh V. T. (45) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Linh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có seven các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01 Đông Sơn (10. 15. 01 Đông Sơn). 


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Linh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn five năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Linh kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2008, Linh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Linh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3, 079, 800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6, 000, 000 VND. 


Khoản vay sẽ là fourth khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. T. T. Ngoc (47) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 


2. H. T. Dinh (49) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 


3. N. T. Tu (12) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 


4. B. T. Kim Thanh (268) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 


5. N. T. Van Anh (82) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 


6. L. M. Huong (48) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. 


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. "

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Mariela Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Mariela tiene 18 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace un año y de esta linda relación tiene un hermoso bebito de 4 meses de nacido. Su marido se dedica al comercio.

Ella vende zapatos de todo tipo, entrega puerta a puerta y deja a crédito, dice que tiene bastantes ventas por las facilidades de pago que da ya que entrega sus productos con una tercera parte del valor y el resto los cobra en dos quincenas. Trabaja de miércoles a domingo, en la actualidad solo trabaja dos horas porque su hijo está muy pequeño. Sus productos los adquiere en un almacén que tiene su suegra en Charapoto.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar mercadería. Este es tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta por la ayuda que ha recibido para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the communal bank "Salud y Vida" meets every 15 days.  This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes away from some of the best beaches in the province, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Mariela is 18 years old, and she has been in a common-law marriage for a year which has produced a beautiful 4 month-old baby.  Her husband works as a merchant.

She sells all types of shoes door-to-door, and she extends credit to her customers.  She says that she has substantial sales owing to the ease of payment that she offers.  When she delivers her products she collects a third of the total value, and she collects the rest in 2 installments that are each 2 weeks apart.  She works from Wednesdays to Sundays, and she now only works for 2 hours because her child is very small.  She acquires her products in her mother-in-law's store in Charapoto.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise.  This is her 3rd loan cycle in her communal bank, and she is very pleased because the bank has helped her to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Bárbara, tiene 52 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad pero dos de  ellos aun viven en su casa, también vive con ella una nieta que es como su hija.
 
Se dedican con su familia a la agricultura, ellos siembran maíz y verduras como habas, habichuelas, achochas y otras verduras. Trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 7am hasta las 12h00 y de 14h00 hasta las 16h00, todos trabajan en los sembríos, cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha su esposo las lleva al mercado de Tosagua o los comerciantes llegan hasta su sembrío.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar insumos y abonos para tener una mejor producción. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Health and Life Communal Bank (Banco Comunal Salud y Vida) meets every 15 days.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Bárbara, who is 52 years old and maintains a common-law relationship, in which she had 4 children who are now already grown.  But two of them still live at home.  She also lives with a niece who is like her daughter.

Her family is devoted to agriculture, they grow maize and vegetables like lima beans, green beans, achochas (of the squash family), and other vegetables.  They work from Monday to Friday from 7 am to noon and from 2 pm to 4 pm.  They all work in the plantations and when it comes time to harvest, her spouse takes the crops to the Tosagua market or the traders come to them.

This loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizer for better production.  Bárbara has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and likes it because the loans are distributed quickly.

Her dream is to have a cement house, since her current house is made of sugar cane.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna D. C., 39, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Nolan D. C., a driver, and mother of three children, two of whom are already in college while the youngest child is still enrolled in high school. By the grace of God, Lorna has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Lorna as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lorna maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lorna dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: buying items ordered by customers

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta S. is from the city of Panta-on Ozamis. She is 57 years old. Crisanta is married and has one adult child. Crisanta owns and operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting flowers for sale. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Fátima Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Fátima tiene 38 años de edad, casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijas de 9 y 7 años, las últimas son mellizas, su esposo es supervisor de obra para una empresa constructora.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, tiene un local que es de su hermana por eso no paga arriendo, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00, solo los domingos trabaja hasta el medio día, la ropa usada la compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora y lo que es ropa nueva la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá salen a mejor precio y de mejor variedad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa nueva en Guayaquil. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 2 años.
 
Sus metas son seguir en su negocio y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The community bank, Banco Comunal Salud y Vida, meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This town is known for its traditional culture. In addition, it is a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Fátima is 38, married, and has three daughters with her husband. One is 9 and the other two are 7 year old twins. Her husband is a supervisor for a construction company. 

Fátima works selling new and used clothing. She works in her sister’s store so she doesn’t pay rent. She works every day from 7AM until 6PM, except for Sunday, when she works until noon. She buys used clothing in Portoviejo from a distributor and she buys new clothing in Guayaquil since she gets a better price and more variety there. 

Fátima is going to use this loan to buy new clothes in Guayaquil. She has been a member of her community bank for two years. Her goal is to continue her business and have her own store.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothes for a store

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng C. is a single mother who lives in Phnom Penh City. She has two children, both of whom are employed at different jobs. Mrs. Chheng C. was married years ago, but divorced her husband. Mrs. Chheng C. has rented a market store where she sells chicken to earn a living. She usually goes to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of poultry they raise. To improve her poultry trade, Mrs. Chheng C. is taking out her first loan to purchase small chickens to raise.

loans.use: To purchase small chickens to raise.

loans.name: Andrea Piedad

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Para la señora Andrea este es su tercer ciclo y le ha gustado el Banco Comunal porque para conseguir los créditos no se necesitan tantos requisitos, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 3 y un año de edad, su esposo es comerciante de frutas que lleva a vender a Santo Domingo.

Se dedica al hogar y al comercio, vende ropa puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que tiene muchos clientes los mismos que le realizan sus pedidos. Sus productos los compra en Guayaquil y Santo Domingo.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más mercadería.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the communal bank "Salud y Vida" meets every 15 days. This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes away from some of the best beaches in the province, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Andrea is in her 3rd loan cycle with the bank, and she likes belonging to the communal bank because there are not so many requirements to get a loan.  She is 21 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 3 and 1.  Her husband is a fruit merchant who takes his fruit to sell in Santo Domingo.

She is dedicated to housework and to her business, which is selling clothing door-to-door.  She works 3 days a week, extends credit to her customers, and collects her payments weekly.  She says that she has many customers that place orders from her.  She buys her products in Guayaquil and in Santo Domingo.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise.

Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir y los intereses son muy bajos. Ella tiene 62 años de edad, esta separada hace varios años y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Tiene un comedor en el centro, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 4am hasta las 20h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo, dice que la gente la prefiere ya que cocina delicioso y por eso tiene muchos clientes, su especialidad es el pescado hornado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local mas amplio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The community bank Health and Life meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ms. Carmen is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make and the interest rates are very low. She is 62 years old and has been separated for several years.  From this relationship she had 6 children.  All are adults now and only one of them lives with her.

She has a restaurant downtown and works Monday through Friday from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and on Saturdays and Sundays from 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She works with the help of her son. She says that people prefer her because of her delicious cooking and that is why she has many clients. Her specialty is baked fish. 

She will use this loan to purchase materials to prepare her delicious dishes. 
 
Her dream is to have a larger location and to continue working.

loans.use: Purchase fish, rice, potatoes, yucca, etc.

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn P. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 22 years old. Gemmalyn is married and has one infant child. Gemmalyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gemmalyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Gemmalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gemmalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Gemmalyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gemmalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda E. is from the village of Estrada. She is 50 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, coffee, detergent soaps as well as vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8200 PHP a month.

In 2007, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from ASKI to purchase new items to expand product offering and is requesting a new loan of 45000 PHP to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila G., 46, lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Hernando G. and has two young hard-working adult children and three still in school. By the grace of God, Mila has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. She works hard to provide income for her family's every-day expenses. Mila operates a granite business designing, crafting and producing granite furniture. Most often, orders are for granite tables. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan to buy raw materials. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Mila dreams of being able to renovate her house. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy raw materials

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia G. is from the village of Minanga Sur, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 50 years old and the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Delia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, she has a store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Selling clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Math S.’s daily routine. She is a single woman who lives with her relatives in Phnom Penh City. She sells clothing for both men and women from her store in the local market. Math S. runs her business very well and her customers recognize the good service she provides. To sustain her business and expand in the future, Math S. would like a $800 loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
This is Gerlie C., 40, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin C. and mother of two hard-working young adults and a toddler. By the grace of God, Gerlie has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Gerlie operates a woodworking business. She designs and produces wooden furniture, craft items and displays from many different varieties of native wood. Most of what she produces is made of Narra, a truly special wood of the highest quality that comes from the Philippines’ national tree, Molave.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials, and expects to earn a higher income as she expands her business. 
 
Gerlie dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, and always takes time to meet with other CCT members to share suggestions and information about their work.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw materials for a woodworking business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta A., 39, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Nolito A., a construction worker, and the mother of two children, both of whom are in high school. By the grace of God, Julieta has managed to support her children's schooling and hopes to send them all the way through college. She is living a dream that most Filipino parents have, because they know that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to a child.

Julieta makes a living selling clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products, working with brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. Customers pay in cash or are given one month to pay their bills, and prices are lower than those in catalogs. Her regular customers are neighbors and people who live in her community, and she generates a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to place orders for her customers, and expects that doing this will allow her to increase her income.
  
Julieta dreams of being able to give all of her children a high-quality education by working hard at her business. She faithfully meets with co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
