* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to fund the placement of orders for her customers

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda M., 55, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Faustino, a carpenter, and the mother of two hard-working young adults. By the grace of God, Yolanda has managed to support her children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a variety store where she also sells native breakfast fare and other items. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience outlet which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small amounts to people who live in the neighborhood. It is the place where you go to buy one package of shampoo, for example, or a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She generates her income by buying supplies wholesale and selling at retail.  Her store is next to her house and her regular customers are neighbors and people who live in her community.  She generates a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use this loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in income from this expansion of her business.
  
Yolanda dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, and faithfully meets up with co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who come together to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her small general store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is married and lives in Prk. Isdang Bato, Palawan. She and her husband make a living by buying and selling dry goods. They have three children who range in age from 13 to 18. Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With lots of hard work and 23 loans from our organization, she has slowly lifted her family out of poverty. She is applying for a new loan, her 24th, to expand her business by buying additional dry goods to sell. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is allowing these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their wildest dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand a small dry goods business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. lives in the town of Plaridel. She is 29 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She makes a living by operating a handicraft business which sells to tourists and local community members. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid eight previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new one to continue expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to expand a small handicraft business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel P. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 34 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2009, Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ana Jane

texts.en:
Ana Jane D. C. is 38-years old,  married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and a food vending businesses. She lives in Hda. Tiling, Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  general store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7500. 

Ana Jane is now borrowing PHP 23000 so that she  could  continue to fund the businesses operations.   This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 23000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ana Jane aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

About ASKI:

loans.name: Vannat

texts.en:
Mr. Vannat K. (pictured with his mother) is 25 years old and a widower. He lives with his widowed mother in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vannat has been a carver for two years. He does not have his own transportation, so traveling is a big expense for him. Therefore, Vannat is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap Y., and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Khoem, have been married since 2005 and have two young sons. They live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sopheap and her husband are rice and vegetable farmers. She is requesting a loan, her third, in the amount of $700 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:

This time Lorna is borrowing 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for additional weaving materials so she can continue to save up for expanding her business and caring for her family. Lorna T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

The couple grows bananas and flowers on their farmland in the village. Besides farming, Solat also sells Chinese noodles and coffee in front of her house. She has obtained a Kiva loan through MAXIMA several times already. She now is requesting another loan of 1,000 USD not only to expand her business selling Chinese noodles and coffee but to continue her farming business as well.

texts.en:

Rodrigo runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which he sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Rodrigo has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Rodrigo is requesting a loan, his first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Keo

Mrs. Keo R. used to be married, but her husband died several years ago. She now lives together with her niece who works in a garment factory earning an average of $3 per day. Keo is an office clerk in her district. She has worked at her job since 2000 and has a formal salary.

Besides working in the public sector, Keo also sells clothes at the local market. She offers her customers both traditional and modern clothes. Presently, Keo thinks that it is time to look for extra revenue so she can grow her business by selling more clothes at the market. So Keo will be using her loan expand her inventory.

texts.en: Math S., a 45-year-old mother of four children, all single, is married to Kong Sovan, 54, a truck driver. loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana D. La Cruz R. D. S. D. 41 años D. edad,  resiD. en Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, todos menores D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Juana posee una pupusería la cual se encuentra en su casa D. habitación y en donD. trabaja desD. hace 8 años con el único fin D. poder contar con una vida mejor para su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en el negocio comprando toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas, tales como: chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz, y verduras para hacer el curtido y la salsa que acompaña a las pupusas. D. esta manera Juana desea atender a más clientes y D. esta forma mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Juana D. La Cruz R. D. S. is 41 years old. She is a resident of Soyapango, where she lives with her husband and her four children, who are not yet grown and are attending school. Juana has a pupusería [a business making pupusas, or filled corn tortillas] located in the house where she lives. She has run this business for 8 years, with the single aim of achieving a better life for her family. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business by purchasing all of the ingredients needed to prepare pupusas, such as: pork, cheese, beans, corn and vegetables to make the curtido [a slaw-like salad] and salsa which accompany the pupusas. In this way, Juana wants to serve more customers and thus improve her sales.

loans.use: Buying cheese, corn, beans and pork

loans.name: Vaisidin

texts.en:
M. Vaisidin is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a housewife and the business of Vaisidin is the main source of income for his large family. 

Vaisidin has been providing transportation services for the last 7 years. At the same time he sells construction materials at the market. Vaisidin is dreaming all of his children being well-educated so he is working hard. As a result the business generates significant income allowing him to support his large family. 

In order to provide the better service for his clients and in that way earn more, Vaisidin needs to make major repairs on his lorry. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose in mind, he requests 1500 USD. With part of the loan he will also buy construction materials to increase the range of goods he sells.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the lorry and construction materials

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina de La Paz G. O. de 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, junto al cual trabaja muy duro para salir adelante y poder vivir de una forma aceptable. Ambos viven en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual se encuentra ubicado su negocio el cual es una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la que se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás. Reina es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual cuenta con el enorme deseo de poder vivir mejor, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio comprando productos como: pan, golosinas, sodas, leche, mantequillas, huevos, detergentes y otro gran numero de productos los cuales son para el uso del hogar.
texts.en: Reina de La Paz G. O. is 58 years old and lives with her husband, whom she works alongside of very hard to progress and be able to live decently.  Both of them live in the department of La Libertad, where their basic needs products store is located.  She has been working in the business for the past 2 years and is a very hardworking woman.  She has great desire to be able to live better, which is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral.  With the loan, she will be able to invest in her business, purchasing products such as bread, sweets, soda, milk, butter, eggs, detergent, and a number of other items for household use.

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
A widowed mother of three, Fotima has worked tirelessly for the past 14 years to develop her bakery business. A resident of one of the most impoverished areas of Tajikistan, Fotima has determined to provide the best standard of living possible for her family of five. With the spirit of a true entrepreneur, Fotima opened the only bakery kiosk in the Kumsangir market. As such, she has been successful in maintaining stable growth in this novel business. 

Fotima is a woman of character and strength. Her determination and integrity have helped her to develop a strong reputation among clients and fellow entrepreneurs. Currently, Fotima is seeking a loan for 3000 USD to purchase stable shelf ingredients for baking. With the increased profits, Fotima hopes to help her children with the expense of their studies. 
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Sulma Morena

texts.es: Sulma Morena H. D. F. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y junto a dos hijos, quienes se dedican a estudiar y ayudarle a su padre con el trabajo en sus tiempos libres. DesD. hace 10 años que Sulma se dedica a la crianza D. pollos y así mismo a la comercialización D. estos y D. gallinas, ella cuida estos animales en pequeñas incubadoras, las cuales son hechas D. forma artesanal, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante con su negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los insumos necesarios para mejorar las condiciones D. su granja, comprando más concentrado para aves, así mismo comprar todos los medicamentos necesarios para una mejor crianza D. los pollos y D. esta manera ofrecer un mejor producto. Sulma depenD. en gran manera D. este trabajo, ya que es por medio D. este como le da todo el apoyo necesario a su esposo con el hogar.
texts.en:
Sulma Morena H. D. F. is 47 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband, who works as a farmer, and two children, who are students and help their father with his work during their free time. For the past 10 years, Sulma has been raising and selling chicks, as well as selling hens. She cares for the animals in small handmaD. incubators, which has allowed her to be successful with her business.

She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase all of the supplies needed to improve the conditions of her farm. She will buy poultry feed concentrate, as well as all of the necessary medicines to better raise the chickens and have a better product to sell. Sulma depends greatly upon this work because it is how she provides all of the necessary support to her husband for their home.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for chicks and chickens.

loans.name: Adela De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Adela de Los Ángeles H. O. de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica a la carpintería para poder ganarse la vida. Ella vive sola en casa propia, en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 4 años que Adela posee su propia carpintería en donde trabajo junto a un empleado, el cual es de gran ayuda para ella, ya que en muchas ocasiones el trabajo es bastante. A pesar de ser un oficio bastante duro, Adela ha sabido superar esto y desempeñar un buen papel como carpintera, trabajo en el cual posee varios clientes. Ella trabajo por pedidos previos, elaborando: muebles para la sala, roperos, chineros, sillas, mesas, y otros más. Adela solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de madera de muy buena calidad, así mismo comprar pegamento, serruchos y otras herramientas más.
texts.en:
Adela de Los Ángeles H. O. is 34 years old and is a very hardworking person who works in carpentry to make a living. She lives alone is her own house in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. For the past four years, Adela has had her own carpenter’s workshop where she works with an employee. He is a great help to her because many times, there is a lot of work. Despite it being difficult work, Adela has known how to overcome this and be a good carpenter, a business in which she has several customers. She works on orders made ahead of time such as living room furniture, closets, china cabinets, chairs, tables, and other items.

Adela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of good-quality wood, as well as glue, saws, and other tools.

loans.use: To purchase wood and raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna P. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Jonna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jonna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jonna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jonna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jonna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jonna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta D. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture, a general store business. Her husband Gregorio D., who is 55 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have six children who are between 15 and 33 years old. 

Vicenta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vicenta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future for student allowance and for family needs. 

Vicenta D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. She owns a business selling clothing for men, women and children, which is located at her home, where for more than 5 years she has tried to get ahead with her business, as it is this which allows her to settle all the household expenses with her husband. Emma is requesting a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of clothing, above all clothing for young people that is very fashionable, as this will make it very easy to sell. This is vital for Emma as the stability of her home depends greatly on the profits she makes. For Emma the well-being of her family comes first, it is the reason why she works very hard to get ahead.

loans.name: Rosa Cleotilde

texts.es: Rosa CleotilD. H. D. M. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su familia la cual este conformada por su esposo y un hijo menor D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. hamacas con la cual cuenta desD. hace más D. 10 años atrás, en donD. se dedica a elaborarlas y venderlas. Rosa es una persona muy agradecida con la vida, ya que goza D. la bendición D. poseer un negocio propio que le ha permitido brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, la cual la es la principal razón por la que se esfuerza día con día. La venta D. hamacas esta a las afueras del mercado regional D. Usulután. Cada día muy temprano Rosa  carga sus hamacas desD. su hogar hasta las calles D. Usulután, con el deseo  D. vender la mayor cantidad  D. su producto, y con la ilusión D. poder obtener muy buenas ganancias, que le permitan ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad hilo y todo tipo D. materia prima para elaborar  hamacas.
texts.en:
Rosa CleotilD. Hernandez D. Mejia is 44 years old and lives in the Usulutan region. She lives with her family, which consists of her husband and one young child.  She has had her business for over 10 years, where she makes and sells hammocks.

Rosa is a person who appreciates life, and who appreciates the blessing of having a business of her own that enables her to proviD. for her family.  This is the main reason she keeps working day after day.

Her hammock business is on the edge of the Usulutan regional market.  Very early every day, Rosa brings her hammocks from her home to the streets of Usulutan, with the intention of selling most of her product and making a good profit to give her family a better life.

This is why she's seeking a loan, so she can buy more thread and other materials to make hammocks.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make hammocks

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a retailing business selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jocelyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo H. V. de 45 años de edad, es un padre soltero, quien vive junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, junto a los cuales reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Rodrigo es un hombre muy trabajador el cual comercializa productos de aluminio como: cacerolas, depósitos, moldes para hornear y otros más. Él trabaja de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos en Sensuntepeque y en Ilobasco, siempre dentro del mismo departamento. Rodrigo solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos de aluminio, sobretodo moldes para hacer pan y para hornear pollo, ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año en donde se vende mayor cantidad de estos productos. Rodrigo es una persona muy responsable quien vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Rodrigo H. V. is a 45 year-old single father who lives with his mother, who devotes herself to the household tasks, and his 3 minor children.  They live together in Sensuntepeque in the Cuscatlán department.  Rodrigo is a very hardworking man who sells aluminum products such as: pans, large pots, bakeware, and other products.  He sells on the street, offering his products in Sensuntepeque and Ilobasco, which are both in the same department.  Rodrigo requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of aluminum products, especially pans used to make bread and to roast chicken, since the end-of-year festivities are approaching, which is when he sells the greatest number of these products.  Rodrigo is a very responsible person who looks after the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy aluminum products to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice B. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Alice is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alice owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport or 'habal-habal' services, with her husband as the driver, to local community members. Alice has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alice is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alice from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand their business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance to provide service

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal B. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 47 years old. Rosal is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rosal owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products from Avon and Natasha. Rosal has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosal joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosal is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosal from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora V. C. de 75 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus nietas menores de edad. Ella es una señora muy esforzada y trabajadora, posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de productos de primera necesidad, la cual es un gran apoyo tanto para ella como para sus nietas quienes dependen de este negocio. Pastora trabaja muy duro para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos pequeñas nietas, de forma que cuenten con una vida mejor por lo que su negocio es de mucha importancia, ya que es clave para la estabilidad de su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la tienda, aumentado aquellos productos los cuales poseen más demanda, y de esta forma percibir más ganancias.
texts.en: Pastora V. C. is 75 years old and lives in Cojutepeque, located in the department of Cuscatlán where she lives with her minor granddaughters. She is a very courageous and hard working woman.  She has a store where she sells perishables and staples, which is a great support for herself and for her granddaughters who depend on this business. Pastora works hard to provide all the necessities to her two small granddaughters so that they have a better life. This is why her business is so important since it is the key to the stability of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for the store to increase those products which are in higher demand and thus earn more profits.

loans.use: Purchase perishables and staples to sell in her store.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma P. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Wilma is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María E. D. B. D. 39 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y junto a tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales gracias a muchos esfuerzos se dedican a estudiar. Rosa resiD. junto a su familia en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella trabaja en su propio negocio en el que comercializa dulces típicos como: conservas las cuales son hechas D. coco, dulces D. leche, jalea D. manzanas, dulces D. nance, coco rallado y otros más, los cuales comercializa en el pueblo D. Ilobasco, el cual es un lugar muy turístico, por lo que es muy apropiado para este tipo D. ventas, ya que tanto personas del país como extranjeros disfrutan D. estos dulces. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar diferentes tipos D. frutas para la elaboración D. estos dulces, los cuales posteriormente pueda vender en mayores cantidades. D. esta forma Rosa espera obtener más ganancias y vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: Rosa María E. D. B., 39, lives with her husband and their 3 minor children, who, thanks to a lot of effort, are all in school.  Rosa lives with her family in Sensuntepeque in the Cuscatlán department.  She has her own business where she sells sweets that are typical of El Salvador such as coconut sweets, milk caramel, apple jam, nance sweets, grated coconut, and other products, which she sells in the town of Ilobasco, a town that has a lot of tourism.  For this reason it is a very suitable place to sell these products, since so many people from the country and also from abroad enjoy these sweets.  Rosa requests a loan to buy different types of fruit to make these sweets, which she will later sell in large quantities.  In this way, Rosa hopes to obtain better earnings and live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make traditional Salvadoran sweets

loans.name: Kaikai Ole

texts.en:
Kaikai Ole K. is 27 years old. He is married to Mary K. and a father of four children who are six years, four years, two years, and nine months old.

Kaikai is a farmer, farming on his own piece of land for the last eight years. He learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend Kshs 20,000 to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kaikai's dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy his own vehicle for transporting the farm produce to different markets. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: Prepare land for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida B. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Aida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora A. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business. She has nine children who are between 13 and 36 years old. Leonora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,500, which she intends to use purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future to support the daily needs of the family. Leonora A. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: Julián R. M. de 35 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, quien vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, junto a los cuales reside en Cara Sucia en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Julián posee un puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal de Cara Sucia, en donde comercializa frutas como: uvas, fresas, bananas y otras frutas más de temporada, los cuales se venden bastante. Julián trabaja junto a su esposa con el deseo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una vida mejor, en la cual cuenten con todo lo básico y necesario para una vida digna. Es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar manzanas, sandias, melones y otros más, con lo que desea con todo su corazón poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma mejorar su estabilidad familia.
texts.en: Julián R. M. is 35 years old. He is very dedicated to his family. He lives with his wife and two young children in Cara Sucia, in the department of Ahuachapán. Julián  has a stall located in Cara Sucia’s city market. He sells quite a lot of grapes, strawberries, bananas and other seasonal fruits. Julián works with his wife.  They wish to be able to offer their children a better life, including the basic necessities for a dignified life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Integral in order to buy apples, watermelons, melons and other fruits. He wants, with all his heart, to increase his sales and then improve the stability of his family.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic needs items

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en: Marichel A. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Marichel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marichel runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marichel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marichel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marichel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois S., 46, is married to Kroeun, 45, who is a local farmer and motor taxi driver. The couple is blessed with two kids who are still enrolled in school. She produces furniture such as cradles and mats. She also saves many sets of these items and then sells them to a wholesaler. She purchases small pieces of clothing in bulk at the cheapest cost from garment factories and turns them into furniture to sell. 

Currently, her husband wants to start a new workshop for mending motorcycles in front of his house in order to earn more profits and to support the family's expenses. She said that her savings is not enough for opening this workshop. So Lois S. will take out a loan to open the workshop for her husband's business.

loans.use: To open a workshop for her husband's business

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto H. G. de 38 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a lo que hace, él vive junto a su madre la cual depende por completo de Carlos y así mismo le ayuda con todos los quehaceres del hogar. Carlos posee un taller de mecánica automotriz y de enderezado y pintura, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en el municipio de Soyapango. Desde hace 17 años que él realiza este tipo de trabajo, obteniendo mucha experiencia en el oficio, lo cual le da la ventaja de elaborar un excelente trabajo con sus clientes, los cuales se sienten muy satisfechos con el servicio brindado por parte de Carlos. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales para su taller tales como lijas, pinturas, herramientas y otros insumos más. Todo esto lo hace con el inmenso deseo de poder obtener mayores ganancias, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que su familia cuenta, es por ello que Carlos se esfuerza mucho por realizar un excelente trabajo, y de esta manera brindarle todo lo necesario a su madre.
texts.en:
Carlos Ernesto H. G. is 38 years old and is a very hardworking person who is dedicated to what he does. He lives with his mother, who is completely dependent upon him, and he also helps her with all of the household chores. Carlos owns an auto mechanic and body shop, which is located in the house where he lives in the municipality of Soyapango. He has been doing this type of work for 17 years and has gained a lot of experience in the trade. This experience gives him an advantage in doing excellent work for his customers, who are very satisfied with the service he provides.

Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials for his shop such as sandpaper, paint, tools, and other supplies. He does all of this with the great desire of be able to earn more because this is the only source of income that his family has. This is why Carlos works hard to do excellent work so that he can provide everything necessary for his mother.

loans.use: To purchase paint, sandpaper, and tools for auto repair

loans.name: José Neftalí

texts.es: José Neftalí L. Y., reside en Puerto el triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar y en sus tiempos libres a aprender el oficio el cual le permite a su padre brindarles todo lo necesario para vivir. José se dedica a la pesca artesanal, oficio el cual elabora desde hace 18 años, posteriormente junto a su esposa, él sale al mercado regional de Puerto El Triunfo donde comercializa los mariscos como: pescado y camarones. Sus ventas son muy estables, ya que este es un lugar turístico y de mucha afluencia de personas. José solicita un préstamo para poder comprar nuevas redes para pescar, así mismo para comprar gasolina para la lancha. Para José este trabajo es muy importante debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos la cual posee para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
José Neftalí L. Y. lives in Puerto el Triunfo, which is located in the Usulután department.  He lives with his wife and their two children.  The children go to school, and in their free time they learn the trade that allows their father to give them everything they need.

José is a fisherman. He has done this work for 18 years, previously together with his wife. He goes to the Puerto El Triunfo regional market where he sells seafood like fish and shrimp.  His sales are very stable because it is a tourist area with a lot of people.

José is requesting a loan to be able to buy new fishing nets.  He will also buy gasoline for his boat.  This work is very important to José because it is the only source of income that he has to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is married and has two children whom he supports. His wife runs a business which is able to give her a monthly income.

Harrison has been in the hardware business for 10 years and he is servicing a third loan with KADET LTD. He is not in any other Micro Finance. Harrison will use the loan to purchase hardware items like timber. With the extra profits, he will renovate some rental rooms so as to maximize rental income.

Harrison hopes to ensure that he can be able to have rental income as a main source of income for his family.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase items like timber.

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou I. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 25 years old. Jackielou is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jackielou owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jackielou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pig.

Jackielou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jackielou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. Jackielou is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jackielou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Sofía Inés

texts.es: Sofía Inés F. D. C. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. únicamente junto a su esposo en el departamento D. La Unión. Sofía posee un taller D. corte y confección, en donD. se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. batas y camisones para niños, ponchos para personas adultas, ropa para damas y caballeros. Esta la comercializa, visitando diferentes oficinas, en donD. las ofrece a los empleados del lugar, los cuales incluso le hacen pedidos previos, lo cual es muy bueno para Sofía, ya que elabora un número D. prendas D. vestir las cuales son ganancias seguras, así mismo comercializa sus productos en su casa D. habitación en donD. venD. con sus amigos y vecinos. Sofía solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: ropa interior, telas, hilos, botones y otros elementos más los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración D. la ropa que comercializa, lo que le permita contar con mayores ventas y D. esta forma mejorar su negocio y la estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en: Sofía Inés F. D. C. is 55 years old. She lives only with her husband in the Department of La Unión. Sofía has a tailoring workshop, where she makes and sells smocks and dresses for children, ponchos for adults and clothing for men and women. She sells them by visiting various offices, where she offers them to the employees of the place. Some people place orders with her, which is very good for Sofía, since it means that some of the garments she makes represent guaranteed profits. She also sells her products from her home, to her friends and neighbors. Sofía is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other items which are necessary to make the clothing she sells. This will permit her to achieve higher sales and thus improve her business and the stability of her household.

loans.use: Buying fabric, thread and buttons to make clothing

loans.name: Kimmy

texts.en:
Kimmy A. is from the village of Lower Cogon, Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Kimmy is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Kimmy owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale and she also has a charcoal business. Kimmy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Kimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additonal products to sell. Kimmy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Kimmy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is married. He and his wife have four children who go to school.

Antony was introduced to KADET LTD by existing customers and he is servicing a second loan in KADET. He is not in any other Micro-finance. He has been in the farming business for four years. He will use the loan to increase the number of broiler chickens on his farm. He sells the broiler chickens in an open air market. He also gets orders from different places where he supplies his farm inputs. 

With the extra profits he will increase the number of Grade cows in the farm. Antony hopes to be able to maximize his farm income in both vegetables and animals. Antony believes he is a hardworking man.

loans.use: The loan will be used to add broilers.

loans.name: Marygane

texts.en:
Marygane C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 35 years old. Marygane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marygane owns & operates a business harvesting & selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Marygane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marygane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marygane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Marygane is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marygane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Annabel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding or starting a new business like a sari-sari store. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Annabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon B. is 20 years of age and a single man. He is a water-factory worker in Phnom Penh City. He has been in this sector for many years and is earning approximately $3 per day. 

Mr. Mon B. tries to work in order to support his family, with the other relatives in different jobs. Currently, he is concerned that he faces difficulties in traveling to his workplace. Mr. Mon B. always travels to work by hiring a taxi or walking because he doesn't have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Mr. Mon B. has requested a loan in the amount of $800 to be used to buy a used motorbike to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Marya

texts.en:
Marya is married. She sells food at the market in the small city of Zhidachev. She has been in this business for 15 years. She always offers her clients good and fresh food products, providing them with what they need. Marya is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She wants to continue her business to make a living for her family.
 
Marya would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to increase her working capital. She hopes to purchase more food for sale and receive additional income. Marya and her husband would like to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Kyimat's Group

texts.en:
Kyimat G. is the leader of the group. She is 27 and married with 2 children. Her spouse is a farmer, cultivating rice and tobacco on the area of 1,3 hectares. First it was the area of 0,3 hectares, but now the family plantation consists of 0,3 hectares of tobacco and 1 hectare of rice. Out of business profits they have managed to build a house and to purchase a car and a calf. The loan purpose is to purchase doors and windows for the new house. In the near future, Kyimat is planning to buy a car and to increase cattle stock.

Zulfiya M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 43 and a widow, raising 3 children on her own. Her sons are engaged in farming while her daughter is married and lives separately from Zulfiya. The family business consists of the following: selling foodstuff and cultivating rice and tobacco on the area of 2,1 hectares. Profits have made it possible to open a shop and to purchase a cow. The loan purpose is to purchase foodstuff (30000 soms) in order to increase commodity circulation and also to make shop repairs (13000 soms). In the future, Zulfiya is planning to arrange her son’s wedding and to develop the business.

Elbek T., 25, is married. Together with his spouse, who is a house-wife, Elbek is raising one son. The family earns income by cultivating rice and tobacco on the area of 2,2 hectares. Out of business profits they have managed to obtain a motorcycle and to increase cattle stock. The loan purpose is to purchase fertilizer (500 kg) such as saltpeter for plantation tillage. In the future, Elbek is planning to obtain a car, to buy cattle, and to buy land for building a house. 

Almaz P., 19, is married. A young head of the family, Almaz, together with his wife, is raising 2 daughters. His main source of income comes from cultivating rice on the area of 0,6 hectares. Out of profits the family has managed to purchase land for building a house. In order to harvest successfully, Almaz needs to purchase fuel (2000 soms) and pay for tractor services (3000 soms). He also needs 5000 soms for workers. For this purpose, he hopes to get a loan. In the future he wants to buy a car and cattle.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

texts.en:

Igor is requesting an 12,000 Grivnas (UAH) loan to purchase parts and do some maintenance work on his car. This business is the main source of income for Igor. He works really hard to save his money because he wants to buy an apartment of his own.

Sankale's primary business has been farming and his secondary business is running a primary school. Both business are doing quite well. He operates both business at the same time and has a good flow of income.The school is located in his residential area and most of his customers are people living within the area.  

With this loan, he plans to buy more textbooks for the school. He wants to grow his businesses. In the future he hopes to acquire and own a secondary school and to expand his farming activity by starting a fish pond.


Sankale believes he is  hardworking man.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Sake No1 Group

texts.fr:
Venant M., naquit à Sake  l’Est du Rwanda, il a 52 ans, il est marié et il a 8 enfants, son ainé a 26 ans et son cadet a 3 ans, son niveau d’étude est troc commun secondaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Sake Bugesera. 6 de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABUNZUBUMWE SAKE NO1,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  commerçants et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Venant et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie, mais Venant, c’est pour acheter les fruits(ananas) et les fournir, dans l’avenir elle souhaite former une coopérative et travaillent ensembles en vue de profiter d’avantage. Les bénéfices venant de leur commerce seront réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour le bon futur
texts.en:
Venant M., born in Sake in the east of Rwanda, is 52 years old, married and has eight children. His eldest child is 26 years old and his youngest three years old. He was educated up until secondary level. He lives with his family in Sake Bugesera and six of his children go to school. 

He is part of the solidarity group, Abunzubumwe Sake No 1, whose members are businessmen and they mutually guarantee one another. Venant and his group work to provide a livelihood for their families by improving their living conditions. Venant does this by buying fruit (ananas) and supplying them to shops. The group would like to form a cooperative in the future and work together in order to gain a greater benefit from it. The profits which they make from their business will be reinvested in order to maintain the group's financial stability and saved in order to prepare a good future for themselves.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit (pineapple) in order to supply shops

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer F. makes a living providing electrical repairs in his community. He is a 32-year-old married man from the village of Mangandingay, Cabarroguis, Quirino. Jennifer has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mwikuyu Muthami

texts.en:
Mwikuyu Muthami is a 47-year-old businesswoman. She and her husband Ikuu have six children, all under 18. Mwikuyu has been operating a tea kiosk business for the past six years in Mwingi Town in the eastern part of Kenya. Ikuu also operates a business, and that generates extra income which helps them support their family.

Mwikuyu is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD. Her monthly income is Kshs. 4,000. She plans to open a greengrocer's shop and buy eggs in bulk to resell. With the extra profit generated from her business, she intends to pay school fees for her children and also construct a good house. Her hopes and dreams are to construct a bigger premises for the business, educate her children and improve her family living standard.

Zumrathon hopes to obtain a loan because she needs money to purchase farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wants to increase her cattle and build a house for the first son. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 13,000 soms, Dilrabohon started to breed cattle. She makes 4,000 soms per month by reselling cattle after fattening. He also breeds livestock to make money to cover family expenses. With money received from his loan, he wants to purchase livestock for breeding. Minurahon I., 27, is married. Her husband works in construction and she breeds livestock to make money. Reselling farm animals after fattening, she makes 1,200 soms per month. loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria G., 59. She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio G. and the mother to five hardworking young adults. By the grace of God, Gliceria has managed to support her children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gliceria operates a variety store while overseeing operations of her ready-to-wear clothing store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies in at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Gliceria dreams to be able to have a few more branches of her clothing store sometime soon. She also wants to be able to help her relatives financially. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane is 36 years old and is married to a house builder. She has six children between the ages of 3 and 16. Four of them go to school. 

Viviane sells beer and food items. Her business is strategic to the customer’s accessibility. With the loan, she will buy more crates of beer, increase the quantity of food items, and buy more iron sheets for sale. The loan will allow her to double the amount that she sells. With the profit, she will buy her own plot of land for commercial purposes.

loans.use: To buy more beer, food items and iron sheets to sell

loans.name: Cosmas Okara

texts.en:
Cosmas is married and they have two children whom they support.

Cosmas was introduced to KADET LTD. by existing clients and he is servicing a third loan after paying his previous loans successfully. He is not in any other MFI (microfinance institution). He has been in the handi-cart transport business and has also managed a kiosk for four years with good income per month.

Cosmas will use the loan to add stock in his kiosk as well as to purchase fabric for selling to tailors as a secondary business since there are so many tailors around the place and he believes that no opportunity should pass him. With the extra profits, he will expand his business by opening another outlet.

Cosmas hopes to eventually have three outlets and expand his kiosk by adding more commodities.

loans.use: The loan will be used to add stock in the kiosk and also to purchase fabric to sell to the tailors

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en: Annielyn R. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Annielyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Annielyn buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. Annielyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Annielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annielyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annielyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Annielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pall

texts.en:
Pall Y., 39 years old, owns a small shop located in front of her house in Kompong Tom Province. She sells Khmer noodle and rice soup. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. 

She has been married for many years to Peng Poum, 44, a bed seller, and they have four children. Pall Y. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. 

Pall Y. also faces a problem: Her shop is too small and not attractive to customers. To solve this obstacle, Pall Y. would like to request a loan to be used to expand her shop, which will allow her to add new customers to her clientele.

loans.use: To expand her shop, which will allow her to add new customers

loans.name: Marie Goreth

texts.en: Marie Goreth is 37 years old and has four children between the ages of six and 15, all of whom go to school. She is married to a farmer. Marie sells beer and milk and has spent 12 years in this business. With the loan she will buy more beer and new products as well as equipment. With the profits she will set up a bar as her own business. Right now she has a small number of customers due to the small quantity of sales. She dreams of having three times what she has today when the loan is obtained.

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks e.g. beer to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn R., aged 34, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Elmer R. Sr., a buy and sell agent and business partner. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is already in high school while the other three are currently enrolled in elementary. By the grace of God, Roselyn has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Roselyn as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Roselyn operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantity and more variety of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Roselyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 39 years old and is married to a gatekeeper. They have four children between the ages of five and 20, all of whom except the oldest go to school.  Clemence sells milk, soft drinks, juice and mineral water and has spent 12 years in her business. Her business is well known in the trading center where she operates it. With the loan she will purchase more liters of milk as well as cartons of mineral water. With the profit she will add to her savings and capital. She is keenly seeking to own her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more milk and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 30 years old, with three children between the ages of 10 and four, two of whom attend school. She is married to a driver. Jeanne sells green vegetables and fruit and has spent seven years in this business. With the loan she will buy more fruit and vegetables. With the profits she will save money and buy more vegetables and fruit. She would like to be able to buy larger quantities because it would help her to make more profit. Her business is a profit-making business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell
